question_sets.context: Danny was just tired about the way things were going. His mother came to the school and went on and on about Rick Jackson. It seemed that she would never stop talking." Somebody's got to stop that boy!" she was shouting. "Rick's troubling everybody in neighborhood (四邻).And he loves to pick on (结交)little boys like Danny."Mrs.Green, Danny's teacher, was concerned (担心)a lot." I didn't know that Rick was picking on Danny," she answered. "He's never said anything about this to me!" Mrs. Green looked at Danny ."How long has this been going to?" she asked. Danny could only shake (摇动) his head and look at the floor. He knew if he said a word about this, he would have trouble (麻烦) after school. Danny hadn't said anything about the problem because he wanted to do things with the boys in the neighborhood. After all, most of them were nice to him. He didn't like to leave the gang just because of Rick. Maybe the time had come to find new friends. He felt it hard to make up his mind (下定决心).

When one of his students heard that he was going to leave, she said to him, "The new teacher won't be as good as you are." Mr. Lewis was happy when he heard this, but he said, "Oh no. I'm sure he'll be as good as I am ---- or even better." The student said, "No. Five teachers have come and gone while I've been here, and each new one was worse than the last."

question_sets.context: Once there was a little girl in a village. She spent summers on her grandfather's farm. The year she was four, she knew some ducks. The ducks were white with orange feet. They lived in a little wooden house near the road. The little girl liked these ducks very much. Every day they walked down the road to the pond(池塘). The ducks went into the water. The little girl sat on the bank(岸) and saw them swimming in the pond. The little talked to the ducks and they quacked(嘎嘎叫) back. Then one day the ducks were gone. No one would say anything about them. The little was afraid to ask where they were. One night everyone sat down for dinner. The food looked a little like chicken. The girl didn't want to eat. Can you guess why?

question_sets.context: Bruno was a boy of eight. His father worked in a cinema and his mother worked in a shop. He lived not far from his school. He always walked there and walked home. On his way to school, he had to pass a playground. It was very wet after it rained. One day, when he got home, his clothes were all wet. His mother became angry(生气的)and said, "Don't play in the water on your way home from school!"On the next day Bruno came home with wet and dirty(脏的)clothes. His mother became even angrier. "I'll tell your father if you come back wet again," said his mother. "He'll punish(惩罚)You, you know." The third day the little boy was dry when he came home. "You're a good boy today", his mother said happily. "You didn't play in the water." "No," the boy said unhappily. "There were too many older boys in the water when I got there this afternoon. There wasn't any room(空地方)for me at all!"

question_sets.context: Kong Rong was a famous writer during the Han Dynasty(汉朝). He was_considerate_when he was only four. Kong had five elder brothers and a young brother. One day, their father bought lots of pears. Some of the pears were big and looked good. Some were small and didn't look so good. The boys were happy and began to choose(选择) some. Kong chose the smallest one. Kong's father found this strange and asked, "Why not choose a bigger one, my son?" Kong answered, " I am younger. My elder brothers are older and eat more. They should take the bigger ones." " But you have a young brother. He should take the smallest one!" " He is younger and needs more nutrition(营养). He should get a bigger one, too." Kong's father was very happy that Kong could be so considerate. He didn't think of what he himself wanted. He thought of what others wanted first.

question_sets.context:
When I was walking down the street one day, I found a small bag on the ground. I picked it up and opened it to see if I could find out the owner's name. There was nothing inside it except(除了) some dollars and an old photo―a picture of a woman and a young girl about twelve years old. I put the photo back and took the bag to the police station. Before I left, the policeman wrote down my name and address. He thought the owner might want to thank me.
That evening I went to have dinner with my aunt and uncle. They had also asked a young woman to have dinner with us. Her face was familiar, but I couldn't remember where I had seen her. During our talk, the young woman happened to say that she had lost her bag that afternoon. All at once I remembered where I had seen her. She was the young girl in the photo, though she was now much older. She was very surprised, of course, when I told her about the bag.
After dinner we went to the police station and she got back her bag. The policeman said to me, "It's a wonderful thing. You not only found the bag, but also the owner of the bag."

choices.D: some dollars and a piece of paper

questions.explanation: She looked like the girl in the picture.

question_sets.context:
Almost every child in cities has the chance to go to school, but not all children in the countries are so lucky.
There is a girl called Xiao Fang. She is eight years old and lives in a small village in Guangxi. When she was young, she wanted to go to school. But she could not, because her family was too poor to afford the school fees for her, so her parents had to keep her at home. Instead of studying, Xiao Fang worked in the fields with her parents every day. Then Hope Project heard about Xiao Fang. It agreed to help Xiao Fang to go to school. Her wish of study came true, and now she is studying in a school.
Unluckily there are many thousands of children who can not go to school. You can join in Hope Project and help these children. You know all the good work needs money. Hope Project needs your help.
If you give Hope Project ￥300 each year, it can pay for one child to go to school for a whole year. With more money, Hope Project can build new schools, buy good desks, chairs, blackboards and books. let's help the children together and give them a chance to have a good start in life.

question_sets.context:
We can not live a modern life without traveling. The fastest way of traveling is by air. With a plane one can travel in one day to places which it took a month or more to get to a hundred years ago.
Traveling by train is slower than by plane, but one can see the country he is traveling through. Modern trains have comfortable seats and dinning-cars. They make even the longest journey enjoyable.
Some people prefer to travel by sea when possible. There are large luxury liners(客轮) or river boats. They are not as fast as trains or planes, but traveling by sea is a very pleasant way to spend a holiday.
Many people like to travel by car. They can make their own timetable. They can travel hundreds of miles a day, just as their wish. They can stop wherever they want to see something interesting or to enjoy a good meal at a good restaurant, or to spend the night at a hotel. That is why people choose traveling by car for pleasant trips, while they usually take trains or planes for business.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the fastest way of traveling is by air.

choices.B: travel only fifty miles a day
choices.D: travel to a very far place in a few minutes

questions.explanation: According to the passage, if we travel by car, we can make our own timetable.

questions.text: When people travel on business, they usually take _________.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, when people travel on business, they usually take trains or planes.

questions.text: <blank> have comfortable seats and dinning-cars.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, modern trains have comfortable seats and dinning-cars.

questions.text: We can not live a modern life without __________
questions.explanation: According to the passage, we can not live a modern life without traveling.

question_sets.context:
What is the time? We can't see it and we can't catch hold of it (抓住它). But we can feel it pass by. Time is always with us in our life. When we wash our faces, time goes away in front of us. And when we play, time goes very quietly.
Time is fair(公平的) to every one of us. If we make the best use of it, time will give us a lot ,or we will miss a lot. The best time will not be found again.
Today, time is becoming more and more valuable(宝贵的) to us. We often hear people say:" Time is money. Time is life". It warns(警告) us not to waste(浪费)any time.
My friends, we must keep in mind, "Time and tide wait for no man ". now we are still young. It is the best time for us to learn more. We must make good use of even minute and be the masters of time.

questions.explanation: "Time is money, Time is life ". I think it is warning us.

questions.explanation: We have no reason to waste time.

questions.text: Young men <blank> the masters of time.
questions.explanation: Young men must be the masters of time.

question_sets.context: The train I was traveling on was already half an hour late. I had to arrive in Vienna at 7:15 time to catch it. He advised me to get off two stops before Vienna station and take a taxi. When the time came, the conductor even helped me with my bags. He wished me good luck as I jumped off. And a few minutes later, I was racing towards the centre of the city in a taxi. It was almost 7:25 when we stopped outside the station. I paid the driver quickly, took hold of my bags quickly and hurried inside. "Pairs train" was all I had time to say to the official I saw. You can guess how I feel when he pointed to a man that was just moving out of the station.

question_sets.context: Once upon a time there was a monster. He was very ugly, and had no friends. No one wanted to talk to him. Even other monsters thought he was ugly. He lived alone and was very unhappy because he was so lonely. "I wish I had a friend." he said to himself every day. "One friend would be enough. Someone to talk to." "Dear Editor." he wrote. " I am an ugly monster. How can I find a friend?" "Dear Monster." the Editor replied. " Advertise for a friend in this magazine." The monster wrote an advertisement. "Monster wants a friend, male or female. I have two heads, four arms, six legs and here tails. I have one blue eye, one green eye and one brown eye. Smoke comes out of my noses. But I am really a kind monster and will be a good friend to someone. If you would like to meet me, please stand outside Blake's Store at 6 p.m. on Friday, May 22nd. Write to me at Box 45. Everybody's Magazine." A few days later he went to the magazine. "Do you have any letters for Box 45?" he asked. The Editor looked in Box45. "Yes, there is one." she said, and gave it to him. The monster opened the letter, and read, "Dear Monster, I think a person's character is more important than his appearance. I will wait outside Blake's Store on Friday. Please carry a flower so that I will recognize you. Yours sincerely, Miss Alice Thwaite."

questions.text: Why was the monster unhappy?
questions.explanation: He lived alone and was very unhappy because he was so lonely.

questions.text: What did the monster advertise for?
questions.explanation: Advertise for a friend in this magazine.

questions.explanation: But I am really a kind monster and will be a good friend to someone.

choices.A: She was not interested in people's appearances.
choices.B: She wanted to meet the monster.
choices.C: She needed a flower to recognize him by

questions.explanation: I think a person's character is more important than his appearance.

question_sets.context:
Mark Twain, the famous American writer, was traveling in France. Once he was going by train to Dijon. That afternoon he was very tired and wanted to sleep, so he asked the conductor to wake him up when they came to Dijon. But first he explained that he was a very heavy sleeper."I' ll probably protest(表示不满)loudly when you try to wake me up," he said to the conductor,"but do not take any notice, just put me off the train anyway."
Then Mark Twain went to sleep. Later, when he woke up, it was night-time and the train was in Paris already. He realized at once that the conductor had forgotten to wake him up at Dijon. He was very angry. He ran up to the conductor and began to shout at him."I have never been so angry in all my life,"Mark Twain said.
The conductor looked at him calmly(冷静地)."You are not half so angry as the American whom I put off at Dijon,"he said.

Jenny and Henry were born on the same day and they look the same. Their father had a taxi (出租汽车)and is busy all the time. He goes out early in the morning but comes back when his children go to bed. He gets a lot of money but he has no time to concern himself with (关心) their studies.
 The two children study in the same class. Jenny works hard at her lessons, but her brother likes nothing but playing. He is not good at writing compositions (作文).
 One day Mrs. Cook told her class to write a composition "My Mother". After supper Jenny wrote one in her exercise-book and then went to help her mother to do some housework. But Henry went to play football. When night fell, he came back to watch TV until a TV play was over. And he took off his clothes and went to bed, he remembered the composition and had to go to the sitting-room again. But he didn't know how to write it. He thought hard and hard and at last he found a way. He found Jenny's schoolbag and brought out her exercise-book and copied (抄) her composition.
 Two days later Mrs. Cook asked Henry, "Can you tell me why yours is the same composition as (与…… 一样) Jenny 's ?"
 "Yes, I can, madam " answered Henry. " We have the same mother."

Johnny Kelley is known as the great-grandfather of the Boston Marathon. He ran all the 42 kilometers of the marathon 61 times. This year was the second time that he has cut back and run only part of it. Kelley holds the record for running more Boston Marathons than anyone else.
Thousands of people cry "Come on" to him as he runs. Today an 11-year-old boy called put to Kelley, "Hey, Mr Kelley. You are great man. " Kelley smiles and thanks people as he runs. "It's a wonderful. " He said, "People come out to shake my hand. I am welcomed by thousands of people. I think a lot of them thought I ran the whole race. And maybe they congratulate because they know me after all there years and they don't know the other runners. "

question_sets.context: It is possible to do many simple tricks with numbers. Here is one trick. It has seven steps. First, write down your house number. For example, if your address is 73 Lemon Street, you would write down 73. Next, double it. In other words, multiply(乘) it by two. Then, add five to this doubled number. For example, if your address is 73 and you have doubled it, you will get 146. Then, if you added five, you'd get 151. So, to repeat the first three steps, write down your house number, double it, and add five. Fourth, multiply this number by 50. In our example here, if you multiply 151 by 50, you'll get 7550. The fifth step is to add your age to this total. For example, if you're 26 years old, you should add 26 to this total. In our example here, the result would be 7550 plus 26, you'll get 7576. Sixth, you have to add the number of days in a year, which is 365. In our example here, 365 added to 7576 is 7941. The seventh and final step is this: subtract(减) 615 from the number that you have. In our example, 7941 minus(减) 615 is 7326. The result here, 7-3-2-6, is the trick. The first part of the number is the address and the last part of the number is the age of the person. That is, 73 is the address that we started with, and 26 is the age that we used. If you follow these seven steps with any address and the age of any person. You will get the same result.

questions.text: According to(根据) the trick, what number can you get if you are 16 years old and your house number is 85?
questions.explanation: Following the described pattern, the address comes first, then the age, making the result 8516.

questions.text: How can your age number appear at the last part off the result?

choices.B: By taking all the steps except Step1 and Step 2.

questions.explanation: To get the age in the result, you need to follow all the steps provided.

questions.text: What's the secret of the trick?

choices.B: By taking Step 2 and Step 4, we get the formula(公式): your address number × 2 × 50.
choices.C: By taking all the steps except 1 and 2, we get the formula: 5 × 50 + your age number + 365 - 615 = your age number.

questions.explanation: Both the address and age are part of the formula, calculated through those steps.

question_sets.context:
Computers are useful machines. They can help people a lot in their daily life. For example, they can help people to save much time to do much work, and they can help people to work out many problems they can't do easily. Our country asks everyone to learn to use computers before the twenty-first century, except the old people.
Today more and more families own computers. Parents buy computers for their children. They hope computers can help them improve their studies in school. Yet, many of their children use computers to play games, to watch video or to sing that computers can not help children to study but make them fall behind. So computers are locked in boxes by parents.
In some other countries, even some scientists also hate computers. They say computers let millions of people lose their jobs or bring them a lot of trouble. Will computers really bring trouble to people or can they bring people happiness?
It will be decided by today's students themselves!

question_sets.context:
The Internet is becoming important in our life. How much do you know about it?What is the Internet?The Internet is a large, world-wide collection (聚集) of computer networks( 网络). A network is a small group of computers put together. The Internet is many different kinds of networks from all over the world. These networks are called the Internet. If you have learned to use the Internet, you can have a lot of interest on the World Wide Web(网)What is the World Wide Web?The World Wide Web has been the most popular development of the Internet. The Web is like a big electronic (电子) book with millions of pages. These pages are called homepages.You can find information about almost anything in the world on these pages. For example, you can use the Internet instead of a library to find information for your homework. You can also find information about your favourite sport or film star, talk to your friends or even do some shopping on the pages. Most pages have words, pictures and even sound or music.What is e-mail?Electronic mail (e-mail) is a way of sending messages to other people. It' s much quicker and cheaper than sending a letter. If you want to use e-mail, you must have an e-mail address. This address must have letters and dots (点) and an" @ " (means "at"). For example: Lily @ Yahoo, com. Write a message, type a person's e-mail address, then send the message across the Internet. People don't need to use stamps, envelopes or go to the post office since the invention of the Internet . Quick, easy and interesting ― that' s the Internet .1. The Internet is<blank>.A. a big computer B. a small group of computersC. lots of computer networks   D. the World Wide Web2. question_sets.context:
In most parts of the world, many students help their schools make less pollution. They join "environment(环境) club". In an environment club, people work together to make our environment clean.
Here are some things students often do.
No-garbage(垃圾) lunches.How much do you throw away after lunch? Environment clubs ask students to bring their lunches in bags that can be used again. Every week they will choose the classes that make the least garbage and report them to the whole school!
No-car day.On a no-car day, nobody comes to school in a car―not the students nor the teachers! Cars give pollution to our air, so remember:
Walk, jump, bike or run.
Use your legs! It's lots of fun!
Turn off the water!Did you know that some toilets can waste twenty to forty m3of water an hour? In a year, that would fill a small river! In environment clubs, students mend those broken toilets.
We love our environment. Let's work together to make it clean.

questions.text: What is the aim (目的) of environment clubs?

choices.A: They ask students to run to school every day.
choices.B: They ask students not to waste water.
choices.C: They ask students not to throw away lunch bags.
choices.D: They work together to keep the environment clean.

questions.explanation: 根据文章第一段 "In an environment club, people work together to make our environment clean." 可知环境俱乐部的目的是保持环境清洁。

questions.text: From the passage we know the students usually have lunch ______.
questions.explanation: 文章提到学生在学校参加环境俱乐部，并自带午餐，因此推断学生通常在学校吃午饭。

questions.text: Who will take a car to school on a no-car day?
questions.explanation: 根据文章 "On a no-car day, nobody comes to school in a car―not the students nor the teachers!" 可知在无车日，学生和老师都不开车来学校。

questions.text: Which is the best title for this passage?
questions.explanation: 文章主要介绍了环境俱乐部及其活动，因此最佳标题是 “An Environment club”。

question_sets.context:
A little old couple(夫妇) walked slowly into McDonald's one cold winter evening. They took a table near the back wall, and then the little old man walked to order. After a short while he got the food back and they began to open it.
There was one hamburger, one order of French fries and one drink. The little old man carefully cut the hamburger in half and divided (分) the French fries in two piles. Then he placed the half of the food in front of his wife.
He took a sip (啜) of the drink and his wife took a sip. "What a poor old couple!" The other people there thought.
As the man began to eat his hamburger and his French fries, his wife sat there watching him and took turns to drink. A young man came over to the old couple. He offered to buy another meal for them. But they said no politely and said that they got used to sharing everything.
Then a young lady asked the wife a question, "Madam, why aren't you eating? You said that you share everything. What are you waiting for then?"
"The teeth (牙齿) ," she answered.

questions.text: What did they do after they got the food back?

choices.A: They began to eat at once.
choices.B: They were waiting for a young man.
choices.C: The old man divided all the food into halves.
choices.D: The old man ate the hamburger and the old lady ate the French fries.

questions.explanation: 根据文章 "The little old man carefully cut the hamburger in half and divided (分) the French fries in two piles." 可知老人把食物分成了两半。

questions.text: The other people thought that the old couple ______.

choices.A: didn't have enough money to buy two orders of food
choices.D: couldn't stay at home on this cold evening

questions.explanation: 根据文章 "What a poor old couple!" The other people there thought." 可知其他人认为这对老夫妇很穷，没钱买两份食物。

questions.text: The young man came over to the couple to _______.

choices.D: know why the old lady didn't eat

questions.explanation: 根据文章 "A young man came over to the old couple. He offered to buy another meal for them." 可知年轻人想给他们买另一份食物。

question_sets.context:
One of Peter's friend loved money very much, and never gave anything to anybody. Soon he became rich.
One day, he was walking near the river with his friends when he slipped (滑倒) and fell in. His friends ran to help him, and one of them_held out_his hand and said, "Give me your hand, and I will pull you out," The rich man's head went under the water and then came up again, but he didn't give his hand. Again another friend tried, but again the same thing happened.
Then Peter said, "Take my hand and I will pull you out!" The rich man took his hand, and Peter pulled him out of the water.
"You don't know our friend very much." He said to the others, "When you say 'give' to him, he does nothing: but when you say 'take', he takes!"

questions.text: One of Peter's friends became rich because <blank>.

choices.C: he never gave anything to anybody
choices.D: his father gave him a lot of money

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that the friend became rich because he never gave anything to anybody.

questions.text: <blank> wanted to help him, but they didn't succeed (成功).
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that his friends tried to help him but didn't succeed until Peter offered to pull him out if he took his hand.

questions.text: "Held out" means <blank>.
questions.explanation: "Held out" means 伸出手 (shēn chū shǒu), which translates to 'extend the hand'.

questions.text: Which of the following is true?

choices.A: The man gave Peter a lot of money for saving him.
choices.B: His friends asked him for money
choices.D: The man didn't want to give anything to anyone.

questions.explanation: The passage states that the man never gave anything to anybody.

questions.text: Which do you think is the best title of this short story?
questions.explanation: The story revolves around the man's reluctance to 'give' and his willingness to 'take', which is the central theme.

question_sets.context:
More than one hundred years ago there was a great French scientist with the name Ampere.
One day, Mr Ampere went out for a walk in the street. There were a lot of people and much traffic there. But all this was nothing to him. He was thinking about a maths problem, he had no paper with him. How could he work it out?
Then he saw a blackboard in front of him. He quickly walked up to it. He took out a piece of chalk and wrote his problem on the blackboard. Then he started to work on it. The blackboard moved a little, but he did not notice. The blackboard moved on, and Mr Ampere walked after it. Then he started to run. But the blackboard moved faster and faster. At last he stopped to have a look.
What did he see? Why, the "problem was NOT a blackboard. It was the back of a carriage.

questions.text: Ampere was <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Ampere was a great French scientist.

questions.text: Ampere was <blank> while he was walking in a busy street.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions he was thinking about a math problem.

questions.text: Where did he write his problem?

choices.D: On the back of a carriage

questions.explanation: Initially, he wrote on what he thought was a blackboard, but it turned out to be the back of a carriage.

questions.text: Did he know that was the back of a carriage?
questions.explanation: He did not realize it was the back of a carriage until the end of the story.

questions.text: Which is right?

choices.A: Ampere was a great French writer
choices.B: One day, Ampere worked out a maths problem at home
choices.D: He didn't notice the "blackboard" was the back of a carriage

questions.explanation: Ampere didn't notice that the 'blackboard' was actually the back of a carriage.

question_sets.context: Which of your hands do you use most? Very few of us use both of our hands well. Most of us are right-handed. Only about five people out of a hundred are left-handed. New-born babies can take things either hand, but in about two years they like to use their right hands. Scientists don't know why this happens. They have studied it. They think our animal ancestors(祖先) right-handed, but this may not be true. Monkeys are our closest relations(关系) in the animal world. Scientists have found that monkeys like to use one of their hands more than the other-but it can be either hand. There are so many right-handed ones. Next time you visit the zoo, watch the monkeys carefully. You'll see that some of them will swing(来回摆动) from their right hands and others will use their left hands. But most human beings use their right hands better and this makes life difficult for the left-handed ones. We live in a right-handed world.

questions.text: Very few of us can use both of our hands well. It means <blank>.

choices.A: we can't use one as the other
choices.C: many people can use one as well as the other
choices.D: some of us can use both hands

questions.explanation: The sentence means that the majority of people don't have equal proficiency in using both hands, but some can.

questions.text: New-born babies<blank>.

choices.A: can only use their right hands
choices.B: can only use their left hands

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that new-born babies can use either hand.

questions.text: Which of the following is true?

choices.C: Some of the monkeys are left-handed, others are right-handed
choices.D: There are much more right-handed monkeys than left-handed monkeys

questions.explanation: The passage notes that monkeys can prefer either hand.

questions.text: We live in a <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage concludes that we live in a right-handed world.

questions.text: Left-handed people are difficult in life because<blank>.

choices.A: they can't use their right hands at all
choices.B: most people use their right hands better
choices.C: they can't use both of their hands
choices.D: they can't use their left hands

questions.explanation: Life is more difficult for left-handed people because most of the world is designed for right-handed people.

question_sets.context:
"Which meal do we all need most, breakfast, lunch or dinner?" Miss Baker asks. Boys and girls wave their hands in the air. They know the answer.
"What do you think, Jim?" Miss Baker asks.
"Dinner, " Jim answers.
"Dinner is the big meal of the day," says Miss Baker. "But I don't think we need it most."
Tom puts up his hands. " Do we need lunch most?"
"No," says Miss Baker. "We need breakfast most." "Why is this so?"
"From night to morning is a long time to go without food," says Ann.
"That's right," says Miss Baker. "We need food every morning. What may happen to us if we have no breakfast?"
The students have many answers to give.
"We may feel hungry."
"We may not feel like working."
"We may feel sick."
"Yes, you are right," says Miss Baker. "Now let's talk about what makes a good breakfast. Give me your answers. I will write them on the blackboard.

questions.text: <blank> are discussing (讨论) eating.

choices.B: Some of the boys and girls

questions.explanation: Miss Baker and her students are discussing eating.

questions.explanation: Miss Baker says dinner is the big meal of the day.

questions.text: Why is breakfast the most important meal?  Because<blank>.

choices.B: there are usually a lot of nice things to eat at breakfast.
choices.C: people like to enjoy food before going to work.
choices.D: form night to morning is a long time to go without food.

questions.explanation: Ann says 'From night to morning is a long time to go without food.'

questions.text: We may feel hungry. This means that <blank>

choices.A: we want to eat some food.
choices.C: we want to have a rest.

questions.explanation: Feeling hungry means wanting to eat some food.

questions.text: Miss Baker teaches by <blank>

choices.B: asking the children to eat apples

questions.explanation: Miss Baker asks questions and discusses them with the students.

But how do theastronauts(宇航员) get to the moon? The moon is about 384,000 kilometres away from the earth. They can't take a plane to the Moon. But something can fly even when there is no air. That is amannedspacecraft(载人宇宙飞船). Several astronauts have been to the Moon in the manned spacecraft.

question_sets.context:
Listening test is one of the important parts of the English exam. Here are some tips for you.
Before you start to listen, you need to relax. Don't be nervous. And try to read the questions. These questions usually help you understand the dialogue or the passage.
Then listen carefully to the first sentence. It usually tells you the main idea of the passage. When you're listening, try to do some thinking and take somenotes(笔记), such as:
・What happened?
・When, where, and how?
・What does the speaker want to tell us?
In this way, you may understand the passage better.
Please remember not to think about one or two words for a long time. When you hear some words you don't know, don't spend too much time on them. Very often, you'll find out what they mean later when you go on with the listening.
根据短文内容,选择最佳答案.

questions.text: This passage mainly talks about _________.
questions.explanation: The passage is about listening tips.

questions.text: It's better for you to keep _________ when you start to have a listening test.
questions.explanation: The passage states that you need to relax before you start to listen.

questions.text: We should listen to the first sentence carefully, because it usually tells us _____.

choices.C: the main idea of the passage
choices.D: how much timeleft(剩余) for the listening test.

questions.explanation: The first sentence usually tells you the main idea of the passage.

questions.text: When you're listening, it's important for you to _______.

choices.D: think about one words for a long time

questions.explanation: It is important to take some notes when you are listening.

questions.text: The _____ usually help(s) us understand the passage better.
questions.explanation: Questions, first sentence, and notes can all help you understand the passage better.

question_sets.context: Selling Shoes "A large store was having its spring sale on shoes and boots. It was the first day of the sale, and the shoe department was full of women who were eagerly trying to buy them. There were all kinds of shoes and boots in a variety of colors, and the prices had been reduced a lot, because the store wanted to get rid of as many as possible in order to make room for their new stock. "The cashiers were kept busy, and at one moment a woman came to one of them with her money in her hand and said, "I don't need a bay, thank you. I'm wearing the shoes I bought." She pointed to them on her feet. "Would you like a bag to put your old shoes in then?" the cashier asked politely as she took the woman's money. "No, thank you," the woman answered quickly. "I've just sold those to someone else."

choices.D: She wanted to try the shoes on her feet.

question_sets.context: Mrs White was going to have her first baby very soon. Yesterday her husband took her to a hospital. So Mr White helped her get into car and drove her there. A nurse (护士)took Mrs White to her room and told Mr White that he could go home and she could call him when the baby arrived(出生). But Mr White said he liked to wait at the hospital.The nurse said,"You may wait outside." Mr White was walking up and down at about midnight(午夜)when the nurse came out of the room and said with a smile,"Which would you like better, a boy or a girl?" "A girl," said Mr White. "I have an elder sister, and she loves me." "Well," said the nurse," it's a boy this time." "That's all right," said Mr White happily. "That's my second choice."

question_sets.context:
Thousands years ago much of our earth was covered with blocks (块) of ice. These ice blocks were as tall as high buildings in modern cities. Most of the ice was in the northern (北方的)part of the world.
Then the ice blocks started to move south. Cold and rain came with the ice. Animals and people had to move.
At last, the ice began to melt (融化). After half a million years, most of it had melted. More than half of the earth became covered with water. The_climate_became much warmer. Things began to grow. The earth began to look the way it looks today.

question_sets.context:
Scientists think that most animals can't see colors. The world is black and white to them.
To find out if dogs could see colors, scientists gave dogs food every time they played a certain piece of music. The dog got ready to eat only when they heard this piece of music. They did not get ready to eat when they heard other piece of music.
Then the scientists gave the dogs food every time they showed them a certain color. The dogs got ready to eat when they saw this color. The scientists then showed the dogs another color. Again the dogs got ready to eat. The colors were all the same to them.
Colors are not all the same to the monkeys, however. For example, if we put food in a red box and do this every day, a monkey will always go to the red box to get the food. If we then put food in a blue box, the monkey won't go to it.

questions.text: All colors are the same to     .
questions.explanation: The answer is D. dogs. The colors were all the same to them.

questions.text: Monkeys know that red and blue are     .
questions.explanation: The answer is A. not the same. Monkeys know the difference between red and blue.

questions.text: The scientists give the dogs food every time they     .

choices.B: went to a box of food

questions.explanation: The answer is D. played certain music. scientists gave dogs food every time they played a certain piece of music.

choices.A: dogs can't see any colors and monkeys can
choices.B: dogs can't see more colors than monkeys
choices.C: monkeys can't see any colors and dogs can
choices.D: monkeys can't see red and blue

questions.explanation: The answer is A. dogs can't see any colors and monkeys can.

questions.explanation: The answer is C. scientists.

Ma Jun:Please tell me something about your family.

question_sets.context:
Japanese students work very hard, but many are unhappy. They feel heavy pressure from their parents to do well in school. Most students are always being told by their parents to study harder so that they can have a wonderful life. Though this may be a good idea for those very smart students, it can have terrible results for many students because they are not talented enough.
As it is reported, a number of students killed themselves. Others try to get the feelings of taking drugs(毒品). Some join the groups of troublemakers and turn to crime(犯罪). Many of them have tried very hard at school but have failed in the exams and have their parents lose hopes. Such students felt that they are hated by everyone else they meet and they don't want to go to school any longer.
It is surprising that though most Japanese parents are worried about their children, they do not help them in any ways .Many parents feel that they are not able to help their children and it is the teachers' work to help their children. To make matter worse, a lot of parents send their children to those school opening in the evenings and on weekends― they only help students to pass exams and never teach students any real sense of the world. It is a great surprise that almost three quarters of middle school students have been to such kind of schools. Many Japanese schools usually have rules about everything from the students' hair to their clothes and the things in their bags. Child psychologists (儿童心理学家)now think that such strict rules are harmful (有害的)to the feelings of the students. Almost 40% of the students said that no one had taught them how to get on with others, how to tell right from wrong, how to show love for others, even for their parents.

questions.text: Why do the Japanese student feel unhappy?

choices.A: Because they don't work hard enough
choices.B: Because their parents give them little pressure
choices.C: Because they can't do well in their schoolwork.
choices.D: Because their parents want them to do well in school, it give them much pressure.

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'Because their parents want them to do well in school, it give them much pressure.'.

questions.text: Their parents want them to study hard because ______________

choices.A: their parents want to have a wonderful life
choices.B: they want their kids to have a wonderful life in the future.
choices.C: they can't do well in their own work.
choices.D: the kids wants to have a wonderful life.

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'they want their kids to have a wonderful life in the future.'.

choices.D: Parents send their children to all kinds of school which are opening on weekends.

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'Schools have too much rules about everything.'.

question_sets.context:
Expert(专家) say that students usually need eight to ten hours' sleep at night, but most Chinese students do not get enough sleep. Some Chinese parents are usually glad to see their children studying late. They will think their children work very hard, but not all parents are happy about this. Once a mother told us tat every morning her 10-year-old boy put up one finger (手指)with his eyes still closed, begging(请求) for one more minute to sleep. Like thousands of students " early birds" in China, he has to get up before six every morning.
A report shows that without a good night's sleep, students seem to be weaker (虚弱)than they should be. Many students have fallen asleep during class at one time or another. Too much homework is not the only reason why students stay up late. Some watch TV or play the computer games late into the night.
Experts have ever said that the students should develop good study habits. So some clever students never study last, they are able to work well in class.

choices.B: it wasn't time for him to get up
choices.C: he didn't want to go to school
choices.D: he wanted his mother to wake him up

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'he didn't have enough sleep'.

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'not work well in class'.

choices.C: not go to bed until late

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'not go to bed until late'.

choices.C: Some clever students are able to work well in class because they have good study habits.
choices.D: Students don't have enough sleep because they have lots of homework to do.

questions.explanation: The correct answer should be 'Some clever students are able to work well in class because they have good study habits.'.

They asked Mozart to stay in a room all by himself for a week. Someone watched the room all the time. No one could talk to him. At the end of the week, he had written a new piece of music.
Mozart died when he was young. But in his short life he wrote more than 560 pieces of music.

question_sets.context:
The Delicious Bread
One day a man went to see his friend. His friend lived far away, so he took some bread with him for his lunch. When he walked along, he thought, "My friend is sure to give me a nice meal and something good to eat." He took out his bread and looked at it. " It's so dry. What's the use of it?" With these words, he threw the bread on the road.
Later he came to a river. There wasn't a boat there. And he couldn't go to the other side of the river. He hoped to have a boat to take him over, so he sat by the river and waited. He waited and waited until the sun went down in the west, but he couldn't see a boat. He stood up and started to go back home.
Soon he felt very hungry. He wanted very much to have something to eat, but he had nothing with him. Suddenly he saw some dry, hard (硬的) bread in the middle of the road. He picked it up and began to eat.
"How delicious the bread is !" he thought.

questions.explanation: According to the first sentence, the man went to see his friend.

choices.C: he was sure to have a nice meal at his friend's home

questions.explanation: He thought his friend would give him a nice meal, so he threw the bread away.

questions.explanation: The passage says "When he walked along", so he went on foot.

choices.B: he didn't wait for the boat
choices.C: there was no boat to take him over

questions.explanation: The passage says "There wasn't a boat there", so he couldn't get to the other side.

questions.explanation: He felt very hungry, so he thought the bread was delicious.

question_sets.context:
James is five years old now. His father is a worker and his mother works in a shop. They live outside the town. His parents go to work in the morning and come back in the evening. The boy has to stay at home alone. There are more than ten children around his house, but some of them are too young and the other have to go to school. So the boy has few friends and he feels sad.
Last month the Hunts moved to the house next to theirs. James went to visit them on the first day. Mt and Mrs Hunt were kind to him and they had a four- year-old daughter named Kate. The boy made friends with her at once (马上) and her parents were very happy. The two children play together when their parents are at work. And James no longer feels lonely.
It was cold yesterday. It snowed heavily and the two children couldn't play outside (在外面). So they stayed in Kate's room. At first they looked at the picture books and then Kate found a coin (硬币) in a box. They began to play with it. Then the girl put it into her mouth and swallowed (吞) it.Mrs Hunt called her husband at once and then took the girl to the hospital.
"The Hunts must be poor. I think," James said to his parents after supper.
"Oh? Why?"
"Kate swallowed a coin and they tried to get it out!"

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't explicitly state the reason, but it can be inferred that Mrs. Hunt was concerned for her daughter's safety. Swallowing a coin could be harmful, leading her to take Kate to the hospital.

question_sets.context:
Most teenagers feel that the most important people in their lives are their friends. They believe that their family members don't understand them as well as their friends do. In large families, it is quite common for brothers and sisters to fight with each other, and then they can only go to their friends for some ideas.
It is very important for teenagers to have one good friend or a group of friends. Even when they are not with their friends, they usually spend a lot of time talking on the phone. This communication is very important in children's growing up, because friends can discuss important things. These things are difficult to say to their family members.
However, parents often try to choose their children's friends for them. Some parents may even stop their children from meeting their good friends. Have you ever thought of the following questions?
Who chooses your friends?
Do you choose your friends or your friends choose you?
Have you got a good friend your parents don't like?
_Your answers are welcome._

questions.explanation: The second paragraph indicates that teenager would choose discuss something difficult to say to parents with friends.

choices.B: We've got no idea, so your answers are welcome

questions.explanation: The sentence is more likely to mean that you are welcome to discuss the question with us.

questions.explanation: The author discusses teenagers needing friends and parents interfering, suggesting understanding is key.

question_sets.context:
One day in April, a special activity called "Food Street" was held on the playground at Railway No.1 Middle School in Xi'an.
This activity was part of the English Art Festival in the school. The students in each class were divided into several groups. And each group sold different kinds of food. The students did the shopping and cooking all by themselves. The students cooked delicious food such as fried chicken, potato chips and vegetables. They all worked hard and sold the food at low prices. The customers, who were the junior students, teachers and parents, all praised them for the nice food.
"It's really hard work," said one of the students who took part in the activity. "We must make a plan before the cooking. We must know how much we should spend on the things we need. Also, we must learn how to serve customers well."
"This activity is to give a chance to the students to develop their practical abilities," said one teacher. "What's more, the students will not only learn how to make money by their own hands, but also know the meaning of life."

question_sets.context:
Mr Smith was the manager of a small office in London. He lived in the country, and he came to work by train. He liked walking from the station to his office unless it was raining, because it gave him some exercise.
One morning he was walking along the street when a stranger stopped him and said to him, "You may not remember me, sir, but several years ago I came to London without a penny in my pocket and you lent me five pounds. Because you said you were in the beginning on the road to success."
Mr Smith thought a few minutes and then said, "Yes, I remember you. Go on with your story."
"Well," answered the stranger. "Are you still willing to take another chance?"

questions.explanation: Go on with your story.

question_sets.context: Thomas Edison was a famous American scientist. He was born in 1847．When he was a child, he liked to find out how things worked. He was in school for only three months. He asked his teacher a lot of strange questions. Most of them had nothing to do with his lessons and his teacher very angry with this. When his teacher told this to Edison's mother,she took her son out of school．As she had been a teacher, she taught him herself. The boy read a lot soon. He became very interested in science. At the age of ten, Edison had already built a chemistry lab(化学实验室) for himself. Ever since then, he never stopped searching for new and better ways to do things.

question_sets.context:
Jack walked into a shop. It had a sign outside: "Second―hand(旧的)clothes bought and sold." He was carrying an old pair of trousers and asked the owner of the shop. "How much will you give me for these?" The man looked at them and then said, "Two dollars."
"What!" said Jack. "I had guessed they were worth(值)at least five."
"No," said the man, "they aren't worth a cent (美分) more than two dollars."well" said Jack, taking two dollars out of his pocket, "here's your money. These trousers were hanging outside your shop. The list Price(定价)of them was six dollars and a half. But I thought that was too much money, so I wanted to find out how much they were really worth."
Then Jack walked out of the shop with the pair of trousers and disappeared(消失)before the shop owner could think of something to say.

questions.text: At first the owner of the shop thought Jack <blank>.
questions.explanation: The owner of the shop thought that Jack wanted to sell the trousers.

questions.text: The owner of the shop <blank> for the old trousers.

choices.D: would give Jack six dollars and half

questions.explanation: He said it.

questions.text: The shop owner said the trousers were worth only two dollars because<blank>.

choices.A: he wanted to sell them cheaply
choices.B: he wanted to buy them cheaply

questions.explanation: He wanted to buy the trousers cheaply.

questions.text: In fact (事实上), the trousers<blank>

choices.B: were stolen by Jack from the shop

questions.explanation: had been Jack's

questions.text: From the story we know that <blank> cheaper than the list price.

choices.A: the owner sold the trousers two dollars
choices.B: Jack sold the trousers one dollar and half
choices.C: the owner bought the trousers three dollars
choices.D: Jack bought the trousers four dollars and a half.

questions.explanation: Jack bought the trousers four dollars and a half.

question_sets.context:
Mother's Day is a holiday for mother. It is celebrated in the USA, England, India and some other countries. In a short time, it becomes widely celebrated. Mother's Day falls on the second Sunday in May. On that day, many people send gifts of love to their mothers.

The idea of a day for mother was first given by Miss Anna Jarvis of Philadelphia(费城). As a result of her hard work, the celebration of the first American Mother's Day was held in Philadelphia on May 10, 1908. Soon the holiday became popular all over the USA and around the world.

In China, people do the same on the day for mothers. And, in some cities, people sometimes ask a song to be broadcast(广播) on the radio for his or her mother only. This might cost a little money, but as it is said, "Love is invaluable(无价的)."

On May 8, 1999, just the day before the Mother's Day that year, a Chinese mother was killed in a criminal bombing(轰炸) in Yugoslavia(南斯拉夫). Her name is Shoal Unhand, a reporter, who wrote lots of articles for Chinese newspapers. All the Chinese will remember her forever.

questions.text:
1. 在下列节日后填上该节日的时间.
A. Christmas Day ( ) B. Father's Day ( )C. April Fools' Day ( ) D. Saint Valentine's Day ( )
questions.explanation: The question is not related to the context. And the format is also wrong.

questions.text: 2. Which country celebrated Mother's Day first?
questions.explanation: According to the second paragraph, 'the celebration of the first American Mother's Day was held in Philadelphia on May 10, 1908'.

questions.text: 3. Which of the following is mentioned in the passage as a way to celebrate Mother's Day in China?

choices.A: Some people send beautiful flowers to mother.
choices.B: Some people help mother with housework.
choices.C: Some people ask a song to be broadcast on the radio for mother only.
choices.D: Some people give mother a present.

questions.explanation: According to the third paragraph, 'in some cities, people sometimes ask a song to be broadcast(广播) on the radio for his or her mother only'.

questions.text: 4. Who had the idea of Mother's Day first?
questions.explanation: According to the second paragraph, 'The idea of a day for mother was first given by Miss Anna Jarvis of Philadelphia'.

questions.text: 5. Which one is right according to the passage?

choices.A: On Mother's Day, all children show their love to their mothers in the same way.
choices.B: Mother's Day becomes widely celebrated for a long time.
choices.C: Just the day before the Mother's Day that year, an American mother was killed in a criminal bombing in Yugoslavia.
choices.D: The celebration of the first American Mother's Day was held in Philadelphia on May 10, 1908.

questions.explanation: According to the second paragraph, 'the celebration of the first American Mother's Day was held in Philadelphia on May 10, 1908'.

question_sets.context:
Ben: Leo, you work too hard. Let's go and sit in the park.
Leo: I can't do that. I have to study for my English test next week.
Ben: But, Leo… You already know that you're going to Tsinghua University! Well, what are you going to major in?
Leo: English and management. How about you? Which school are you going to next year, Ben?
Ben: Oh, I'm going to work for my dad for a year. Then I'll go to college after that.
Leo: What do you want to study?
Ben: I'm not sure yet. I'd' like to study Chinese. So, do you want to be an English teacher or work for a big company after 4 years in Tsinghua University?
Leo: In fact, I hope to go on to study computer science in Beijing University.
Ben: Wow. We are quite different! You know, I just want to find an easy job. I guess you will be a computer programmer.
Leo: Uh-huh. I'd like to.
Ben: Well, I hope to work as a teacher and have a nice family in the future.
Leo: Really? I want to make a lot of money.

questions.text: What does the sentence "I can't do that?" mean?

choices.C: I can't go to the park.

questions.explanation: In the context, 'that' refers to going to the park.

questions.text: What does the sentence "I'll go to college after that." mean?

choices.C: after I work for my father

questions.explanation: 'After that' refers to both working for his father and after 1 year.

questions.text: Who may become an English teacher after 4 years?
questions.explanation: The conversation indicates that Leo is studying English.

questions.text: What is Leo going to study after he leaves Tsinghua University?
questions.explanation: Leo hopes to study computer science in Beijing University.

questions.text: What plan does Ben have for his future?

choices.B: To make a lot of money

questions.explanation: Ben hopes to work as a teacher and have a nice family.

question_sets.context:
Ron liked all kinds of sports. He ran fast and jumped high. He was good at playing football and basketball. He often took part in sports meetings and won some games. Last month, Ron broke his leg in an accident, so he had to stop running and jumping. Later Ron decided to take part in the horse race. He went to the market and wanted to buy a racehorse there. He didn't have enough money to buy a good racehorse. He bought an old one. But soon Ron found there was something wrong with the old horse. It ate less and got thinner. He had to send for a_veterinarian_. An hour later the old veterinarian came and looked the horse over carefully.
'Is my racehorse ill, sir?' asked Ron.
'Yes,' replied the old man.
'Can it be in the horse race?'
'If you insist(坚持), it can,' said the veterinarian. 'But I'm sure you will run faster than it!'

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true?

choices.B: Ron was pleased with the racehorse after he heard the veterinarian's words.
choices.D: Ron couldn't run or jump after an accident.

questions.explanation: Ron was not pleased with the racehorse after he heard the veterinarian's words.

questions.text: Ron bought an old horse, because <blank>.
questions.explanation: He didn't have enough money to buy a good racehorse.

questions.text: What's the meaning of the underlined word "veterinarian"?
questions.explanation: Veterinarian means 兽医.

questions.text: Do you think the racehorse will take part in the horse race?
questions.explanation: I don't know is the right answer.

questions.text: What do you think of the veterinarian?
questions.explanation: Humorous is the right answer.

question_sets.context:
During the past one hundred years, there have been many inventions that make our life much easier and more interesting. TV is one of them. Many people enjoy watching TV for fun. Some even believe that TV has made their children smarter because there are all kinds of information on it --- news, science, sports, music and language. Children can learn a lot from TV in a short time without going out. Many parents are happy about this because they themselves are too busy to spend time with their children.
But we have found that more and more children today have problems with reading, thinking, and concentrating even though they have watched a lot of TV. In fact, getting much information from TV does not mean real learning. Children who watch too much TV do not have enough time to think or to communicate with people. Besides, it takes time and love for children to grow up. What children need most are their parents. Parents give children love, and help them solve problems in the right way. We should teach out children what real life is without TV. After all, machines should not be more important than people.

questions.text: Do you think inventions are good? Why or wily not?

choices.A: Yes, they make our life more difficult.
choices.B: No, they make our life more difficult.
choices.C: Yes, they make our life easier.
choices.D: No, they make our life easier.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that inventions make our life 'much easier and more interesting'.

questions.text: Which sentence is not right according to the passage?

choices.C: Children spend time with TV, not their parents.
choices.D: TV is one of these interesting inventions.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that some believe TV makes children smarter, but it does not confirm this to be true.

questions.text: What kind of problems do the children have who watch too much TV?
questions.explanation: The passage states that children have problems with 'reading, thinking, and concentrating'.

questions.text: What can children get from TV?
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that TV provides 'all kinds of information'.

questions.text: What can we conclude from the passage?

choices.A: People in the future will enjoy more new inventions.
choices.B: Children should learn more from their parents than from TV.
choices.C: Students who watch TV are smarter than students who do not.
choices.D: Watching TV is a good way for children to understand real life.

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes the importance of parents in a child's life, more so than TV.

question_sets.context:
The Blacks are American tourists. The whole family are visiting Beijing now. This is their first visit to China. they are going to stay in China for three months. They want to visit some big cities and villages. They hope to learn some Chinese, too.
Mr. Black is a taxi driver. He likes to drive in Beijing. Mrs Black is a school teacher in Canada. She is visiting a city school today and a village school tomorrow. Their daughter is a middle school student. She is going to meet some Chinese students. They are taking a lot of pictures in China. When they return to America, they are going to show the pictures to their friends. They want the American people to know more about China.

question_sets.context:
The earth moves round the sun, and the moon moves round the earth. When our part of the earth turns to the moon, it is night.
The sun is much bigger than the moon. But sometimes the moon looks bigger than the sun, because it's much nearer to the earth.
The sun is very bright. It gives a very strong light. The moon looks quite bright,
too. But it doesn't give any light at all.
The moon looks much bigger and brighter than the stars. But actually the stars are much bigger and brighter than the moon. They look smaller than the moon because they're much farther away from us.

choices.B: isn't bright, but it gives a very strong light
choices.C: is very big, but it doesn't give any light at all
choices.D: is very round, but it can't move round

question_sets.context:
Mike is a factory worker. He is often very tired after a day's work. His wife, Jenny, has no job, so she stays at home to cook the meals. Every day he can have his dinner when he gets home from his factory.
One day, Mike came home very late because he was very busy in the factory. He was very hungry when he got home.
He was not happy when he found his dinner was not ready. He was very angry with his wife. He shouted at her, "I'm going out to eat in a restaurant." "Wait for five minutes," said his wife. "Why? Do you think that dinner will be ready in five minutes?" asked Mike.
"Of course not," she answered. "But I can be ready to go with you in five minutes."

questions.explanation: The first sentence states, "Mike is a factory worker."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

choices.B: she loves her husband very much

questions.explanation: The text says, "His wife, Jenny, has no job, so she stays at home."

choices.A: he wanted to have dinner in a restaurant
choices.B: he had a lot of work to do
choices.C: he was angry with his wife

choices.C: Jenny didn't like the dinner at home.

question_sets.context:
Every morning Steve goes to work by train. As he has a long trip, he always buys a newspaper.It helps to make the time pass more quickly.
On Tuesday morning, he turned to read the report about an important footballmatch the night before.The teams of his town won the match. The repor was so interesting that he forgot to get off at his station. He didn't know it until he saw the sea. He got off at the next station and had to wait a long time for a train to go back.Of course, he arrived very late at the office.His boss was very angry when Steve told him why he was late.
"Work is more important than football!"he shouted.

questions.text: Steve always buys a newspaper when he goes to work because_    _.

choices.B: he wants to make the time pass more quickly
choices.C: he wants to read the report about football matches

questions.explanation: B is correct. It is the second sentence in the passage.

questions.explanation: A is correct. It is the first sentence in the second paragraph.

questions.explanation: D is correct. It is the forth sentence in the second paragraph.

choices.B: had to walk back to his office
choices.C: had to wait for a train going back

questions.explanation: C is correct. It is the fifth sentence in the second paragraph.

question_sets.context: The computer is fast,but never makes a mistake.While people are too slow and full of mistakes sometimes. That's what people often say when they talk about computers for over a quarter of the century(世纪).Engineers have been making better computers now. A computer can do a lot of everyday jobs wonderfully. It's widely used in hospitals, factories and banks. A computer can report,decide, and control(控制) in almost every field. Many computer scientists are now thinking of making the computer "think" like a man. With the help of a person, a computer can draw pictures, write music, talk with people, play chess, recognise (辨认) voices,translate (翻译) languages and so on. Perhaps computers will one day really think and feel. Do you think that people will be afraid when they find that the computer is too clever to listen to and serve the people?

choices.A: doing more and more jobs for

questions.explanation: B is correct. In this passage, we can see and so on.

questions.explanation: A is correct. Because there is a question at the end of the passage, Do you think that people will be afraid when they find that the computer is too clever to listen to and serve the people?

question_sets.context:
One night Mr Smith left his car outside his house as usual, but when he came downstairs the next morning to go to his office, he found that the car wasn't there.
He called on the policemen and told them what had happened. The policemen said they would try to find it.
When Mr Smith hurried home from his office that evening, the car was back again in its usual Place in front of his house.
He checked it carefully and found two film tickets on one of the seats and a letter which said, "We're very sorry. We took your car because of a sick boy."
So Mr and Mrs Smith went to the cinema with the two tickets the next night and of course they enjoyed themselves very much.
But when they came back home, they found that everything was taken away from their house.

question_sets.context:
Robert is sixteen now. He'll finish middle school in two years. His father has a shop and got much money. He hopes his son can go to university and makes him study hard. But the young man likes to play at cards. He has to go out when his parents fall asleep.
One night, when Robert came back, his father happened to see him. The old man was very angry and told his son to live upstairs. Robert has to go up and down quietly. Of course it troubles him. He thought and thought but didn't find a way.
Last evening Robert listened carefully. And he was sure his parents went to sleep, he went out to play at cards with his friends. He won some money and was happy. And he got back, he took off his shoes and was going upstairs. He heard a noise in his parents' bedroom. He stood behind the door and saw a man come out. He understood it was a thief (小偷). He stopped him at once. The man was very afraid and brought out all the things he stole (偷) in the room.
"Tell me how you didn't wake my parents up," said Robert. "Or I'll take you to the police station!"

choices.A: to catch up with his classmates
choices.B: to be a good helper when he finishes middle school

questions.explanation: The passage states, "He hopes his son can go to university and makes him study hard."

choices.B: Because he can play at cards when his parents fall asleep.
choices.C: Because he can't win any money in the daytime.
choices.D: Because his parents let him do so after they go to sleep.

questions.explanation: The passage says, "He has to go out when his parents fall asleep."

choices.B: Because Robert doesn't like any noise.
choices.C: Because the room upstairs is better than the one downstairs.
choices.D: Because they can hear if Robert goes out at night.

questions.explanation: The passage implies that Robert's parents want to monitor his activities, and making him live upstairs allows them to hear him if he goes out at night.

choices.A: if his parents went to sleep

choices.C: if it was raining hard outside

questions.explanation: The passage indicates, "Last evening Robert listened carefully. And he was sure his parents went to sleep, he went out to play at cards with his friends."

choices.C: to learn how he couldn't wake his parents up
choices.D: the thief to teach him how to steal

questions.explanation: Robert asks the thief, "Tell me how you didn't wake my parents up."

question_sets.context:
Tom was not old, but he did not have much hair. His wife(妻子), Grace, had thick, beautiful, black hair. They had one daughter. Her name was Jane, and she was four and a half years old. There was a photo of her father in the living-room, and a few days ago, Jane looked at it for a long time and then said to her mother, "Mummy, why had Dad got very little hair?"
Grace laughed and said, "He's got very little hair because he thinks a lot, Jane. He's a clever (聪明) man."
Jane looked at her mother's thick, black hair for a few seconds(秒钟), and then she asked, "Mum, why have you got a lot of hair?"

question_sets.context:
Sam lives in New York. His father has a shop there and his mother is a doctor. He's seven years old now and begins to go to school this autumn. It's a little far from their shop and his father drives a car to take him to school every day. So he's not late for class and his teachers like him.
It's Monday today. Miss Hunt is teaching them to count from one to ten. Sam is studying hard. Soon he can count them. Miss Hunt is happy and asks, "How many people are there in your family, Sam?"
Sam is standing and begins to count with his fingers(手指头). Then he says, "Two, Miss Hunt."
"Who are they?"
"My father and mother."
"Oh?" Miss Hunt is surprised(惊奇). She says, "There're three people in your family."
"But now I'm not at home, but at school, you know!"

On Sundays, some of us sing English songs, some of us draw pictures and others play cards. We sometimes fly different kites. They are all beautiful. We usually have lunch in the park. We eat hamburgers, fruit juice, bread and cakes. After lunch we play games by the lake. We have a good time there.

question_sets.context: Computers are useful machines. They can help people a lot in their daily life. For example, they can help people to save much time to do much work, and they can help people to work out many problems they can't do easily. Our country asks everyone to learn to use computers before the twenty-first century, except the old people. Today more and more families own computers. Parents buy computers for their children. They hope computers can help them improve their studies in school. Yet, many of their children use computers to play games, to watch video or to sing that computers can not help children to study but make them fall behind. So computers are locked in boxes by parents. In some other countries, even some scientists also hate computers. They say computers let millions of people lose their jobs or bring them a lot of trouble. Will computers really bring trouble to people or can they bring people happiness? It will be decided by today's students themselves!

question_sets.context: Are you looking for something fun? Would you like to help other people in your spare time? Then join us and be a volunteer! We are anon-profit organization(非盈利性组织). We have volunteer jobs for people of all ages. Anyone, from twelve-year-old children to people in their 80s, can become a volunteer. You can help people in many ways. Schools need help with taking care of children while parents are working. Hospitals need volunteers to look after children while their parents see a doctor. Animal lovers can help take care of those dogs and cats without homes. There is something for everyone. "As a volunteer, I don't want to get anything. Seeing the children's happy faces, I am happy, too. "said Carlos Domingo, an old woman of 62. "I often played computer games in my spare time before. Now I help older people learn how to use computers. " said another volunteer at the age of 18. If everyone helps out a bit, we'll all have a better world to live in. Interested? Call us on 1-800-555-5756. Or visit our website: www. active. Com.

question_sets.context: How wonderful it would be if there was fire! Today is November 9. It's time for us to learn a lot more about fire, especially what to do if we are caught in a fire: 1. Shout out If you smell smoke or see fire, shout out "Fire"! Shout as loudly as you can, because people may be asleep. 2. Call 119 Never try to put out the fire yourself, even if it is a very small one! Get help from your parents or call 119. 3. Keep down close to the floor If there is a lot of smoke in your room, keep down close to the floor. 4. Test the door Test the door before you open it. If the door is cool, open it carefully. If the door is hot, do not open it! Try to find a different way out. 5. Get out If you can, get out of your home as soon as possible. 6. Don't use the lift Never use the lift during the fire. It may also go wrong. 7. Don't go back Never go back into a burning building!

choices.B: what to do when you are caught in a fire
choices.C: when to leave the burning place
choices.D: why to call 119 when it is on fire

question_sets.context:
Soccer is a popular sport. Many games are held(举办)in different places every year. The World Cup is the game that all the players most want to play. It is held every four years. Only the best team can win the game at last.
The last World Cup, in 2002, was held in South Korea and Japan. Thousands of people went to the games or watched them on TV. All the fans got very excited and hoped their favorite team would become the world's best team.
Soccer is a team sport with eleven players on each team. The earliest games of soccer in England were not like what we know today. Games were played between two teams, but each team had more than five hundred players. Each team had to try to carry the ball to the other team's town. Today some towns in England still play a game like this.

question_sets.context:
Have you ever seen snow? Many people in the world have not. Some countries never have snow; some have only a little on the tops of very high mountains. In the north of England, there is quite a lot of snow every winter, but in the south of England, there is usually little.
When a student from a warm country comes to England in autumn for the first time, he feels cold at first. There are often dark clouds, grey sky and cold rain in England in autumn; and most students from warm countries do not like this.
But snow is different . Though it is cold, it is also beautiful. Perhaps, after several(几个) dark mornings, the student wakes up one day, and there is a lot of light in his room. He thinks "Is it so late?" and jumps out of bed. But no, it is not very late. He looks out of the window and there is the snow on the ground and on the houses and everywhere. The light of his room comes from clean, beautiful snow.

question_sets.context: Many people have to work on the weekend. Some people do not mind. Other people think it is terrible. One man thinks working on the weekend can be dangerous. He is Graham Coates. Mr. Coates worked in an office in Brighton, England. On Saturday, May 24, 1986, he went to the office to do some work. When he got in the elevator (电梯) to go home, it stopped between the floors. Mr. Coates could not get out of the elevator. He was trapped! He started to shout, but no one heard him. Then Mr. Coates remembered that it was a holiday in England. No one was going to work until Tuesday! He had to wait until one of his coworkers came to work and found him. Early on Tuesday morning, the vice president of the company came into work and found the elevator was not working. When the elevator was opened, Mr. Coates came out cold, weak, and tired. He had been in the elevator for six-two hours. Now, Mr. Coates says, "I only use elevators if they have telephones in them."

choices.B: The elevator was stuck between the two flowers.
choices.C: He had no food or drink.

questions.explanation: That the elevator was stuck between the two floors is not in the passage.

questions.explanation: The passage says he was in the elevator for sixty-two hours.

choices.C: The vice president discovered (发现) the elevator wasn't working.
choices.D: His coworkers found him when they came back to work on Monday.

questions.explanation: The vice president found the elevator wasn't working and opened it.

questions.explanation: The story focuses on the experience of being trapped in an elevator.

Many exciting Asian football players are leaving home and playing for clubs in Europe. At the same time, many Europeans are playing in Asia.

Football is, I think, the most favorite game in England: one has only to go to one of the important matches to see this. Rich and poor, young and old, one can see them all there, shouting for one side or the other.
To a stranger, one of the most surprising things about football in England is the great knowledge of the game that even the smallest boy seems to have. He can tell you the names of the players in most of the important teams, he has pictures of them and knows the results of large numbers of matches. He will tell you who he hopes will win such and such a match, and his ideas about football are usually as good as those of men three or four times his age.

Chou grew up just with his mother.He did not talk much and did badly in many school subjects.
His mother noticed the boy's special interest in music and sent him to learn the piano when he was only three years old.He loved it and kept on practicing.
Chou is not very handsome,but the singer has huge crowds of fans.
"He is true to himself and never follows others,"said one of his fans.

question_sets.context:
Who Is the Best Salesman in the World?
Harry finished his college and wanted to find a job in the city.One day he saw an advertisement(广告)in a window.It said, "Wanted:The best salesman in the world.Top Pay."
"I'm a great salesman,"Harry said to himself. "I'm sure that I can sell anything.I'll go in and ask for that job."
So Harry went into the building.He saw a manager(经理)in it.He said to the manager, "Good morning.I saw your advertisement.I think I'm the best salesman in the world.Give me the job ,please."
"You must prove(证明)that you're the best,"the manager said.
"I'll pass every test that you give me,"Harry said.
"Good,"the manager said,and he took a box of sweets out of his desk. "Last week I bought a thousand boxes of this sweets.If you can sell them all before the end of the week,you can have the job."
"That's easy,"Harry said.
He took the boxes of sweets and left the office.
Every day and all day he went from shop to shop,trying to sell boxes of the sweets.But he couldn't sell one.The sweets were so bad that he couldn't even give them away.
At the end of the week he went back to the manager. "I'm sorry,sir,"he said. "I was wrong about myself. I'm not the best salesman in the world,but I know who is."
"Oh,"said the manager. "Who do you think is the best?"
"The person who sold you a thousand boxes of the sweets."

choices.A: he could start work at once
choices.B: he was the best salesman in the world

questions.explanation: The manager told Harry he must prove that he's the best.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

choices.B: he gave away a thousand boxes of sweets
