questions.explanation: The passage states, 'Aunt Clara called us up the next morning.'

questions.explanation: Aunt Clara mentioned the boys would bring tents, implying they'd sleep outside.

choices.A: was looking forward to the visit.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions the wife's fear and concern about feeding the boys, indicating worry.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Tone & Attitude

questions.explanation: The narrator went to the station to meet Aunt Clara, suggesting she arrived by train.

question_sets.context:
Before you go to another country it is a great help if you know the language and some of customs(风俗) of the country.
When people meet each other for the first time in Britain, they say" How do you do?" and shake hands(握手).Usually they do not shake hands when they just meet or say goodbye. But they shake hands after they haven't met for a long time or when they will be away from each other for a long time.
Last year a group of German students went to England for a holiday. Their teacher told them that the English people hardly shake hands. So when they met their English friends at the station, they kept their hands behind their backs. The English students had learned that the Germans shake hands as often as possible, so they put their hands in front and got ready to shake hands with them. It made both of them laugh.

questions.text: It is <blank> if you know the language and some of the customs of the country.
questions.explanation: The first sentence says 'it is a great help'.

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'When people meet each other for the first time in Britain, they say 'How do you do?' and shake hands'.

choices.A: when they will be away for a long time
choices.B: when they say"How do you do?"
choices.C: when they just meet or say goodbye
choices.D: after they haven't met for a long time

questions.explanation: The passage says 'Usually they do not shake hands when they just meet or say goodbye'.

choices.B: English people like shaking hands very much

question_sets.context:
Dear Bob,
I now have e-mails! My father bought a computer for me this week. Liu Hai helped me learn how to use it. At first, I didn't know which button to press! Liu Hai also connected me to the Internet. Liu Hai said that you would be happy if you heard from me. He gave me your e-mail address.
This is only my second e-mail. I sent my first e-mail to Liu Hai last night. I failed to reach him by phone, so I wrote him a message . Then I waited to see if he would write back. To my pleasure, this morning I received an answer from him.
Now I know that the internet is so funny and useful. I feel like I'm connected to everybody in the world. If I want to learn about somebody in the USA,I can use the internet. If I need any information, I can use the internet, too. I can look at the mountains in South America, or see fish far in the ocean. I can send a message to you in England , and you receive it in a moment
I would love to get some e-mails from somebody in England. I'm eager to make friends with you and your classmates and learn more about your school and your country. I hope it won't be long before I hear from you . Please write back soon!
BFN,
Li Ming

choices.A: from an English boy to a Chinese girl
choices.B: from a Chinese boy to a British boy
choices.C: from an American boy to a Chinese boy

questions.explanation: The email is from Li Ming to Bob. Li Ming is likely Chinese and Bob is likely British since he is in England.

choices.A: I didn't have a talk with him on the telephone
choices.C: I wouldn't like to talk with him on the phone

questions.explanation: 'Failed to reach him by phone' means he couldn't have a conversation with him on the phone.

questions.explanation: Li Ming says 'Now I know that the internet is so funny and useful'.

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'I can send a message to you in England , and you receive it in a moment'.

questions.text: The "BFN" in the e-mail perhaps is "<blank>" in Chinese.
questions.explanation: "BFN" stands for "Bye For Now", which is similar to "再见" in Chinese.

question_sets.context:
Mr Stilwell looked out of his window. There was a boy at the other side of the street. The boy took some bread out of a bag and began eating it.
There was a very thin dog in the street too. The boy said to it very kindly."Come here, good dog. Do you want a piece of bread?"
The dog was very hungry and went to the boy, but he didn' t give it any of his bread. Instead, he kicked(踢) the dog. It ran away and the boy laughed.
Then Mr Stilwell came out of his house and said to the boy,"Do you want a shilling?"
The boy was happy and said,"Yes, I do."
"Come here,"Mr Stilwell said. The boy went to Mr Stilwell, but Mr Stilwell didn' t give him a shilling. Instead, he hit him with a stick.
The boy cried and said,"Why did you hit me? I didn' t ask you for any money."
"No,"Mr Stilwell said,"and the dog didn' t ask you for any bread, but you kicked it."

questions.text: Mr Stilwell stood <blank> and looked out.
questions.explanation: The first line states Mr. Stilwell looked out of his window, implying he was standing before it.

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't state that the dog belonged to anyone, so it was likely a stray.

questions.explanation: The text doesn't indicate that the boy was Mr. Stilwell's son.

choices.A: kicked the dog, then gave bread to it
choices.B: gave the dog bread, then kicked it away
choices.C: kicked the dog, then laughed at it
choices.D: was kind to the dog to give it bread

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states the boy kicked the dog, it ran away, and then the boy laughed.

choices.C: the people in West countries liked the dogs
choices.D: the people in West countries didn' t like the dogs

questions.explanation: The boy's actions of kicking the dog and laughing at it indicate he was not kind, thus 'bad'.

question_sets.context:
We live in the computer age. People use computers to do much of their work. But few people know how to look after them. Remember the following when you use your computer:
1.Keep your computer in a cool, dry room. Too much or too little heat is bad for computers. Damp(潮湿) is also bad for them.
2.Do not let people smoke near your computer. Smoke of all kinds is very bad for many parts of a computer.
3.Do not eat or drink when you are near your computer. Pieces of food and a little water in the keyboard are also bad for a computer.
4.Keep your screen clean and do not have it too bright. They are bad for your eyes. Make sure the screen is not too far from or too near your eyes. Some people use different glasses to protect their eyes when they use a computer.

questions.text: Computers can <blank> people to do a lot of work.
questions.explanation: The first sentence mentions 'People use computers to do much of their work.'.

questions.text: Few people know how to <blank> their computers.
questions.explanation: The second sentence mentions 'But few people know how to look after them.'

questions.text: A computer works well at a temperature of <blank>.
questions.explanation: The text mentions 'Keep your computer in a cool, dry room. Too much or too little heat is bad for computers.'

questions.text: Smoke is not good for many parts of a computer, is it?
questions.explanation: The second point mentions 'Smoke of all kinds is very bad for many parts of a computer.'

questions.text: A dirty screen or a very bright screen is <blank> for your eyes.
questions.explanation: The fourth point mentions 'Keep your screen clean and do not have it too bright. They are bad for your eyes.'

question_sets.context:
"Dreaming may be the most important part of sleep. We all need to dream," some scientists said.
Dreams take up about one quarter of our sleeping time. People have several dreams each night. Dreams are like short films. They are usually in colour. Some dreams are like old films. They come to us over again. That may be because the dreamer is worrying about something. Dreaming may be a way of trying to find an answer.
Some people get new ideas about their work from dreams. They may think about their work all day. These ideas can carry over into dreams.
Sometimes we wake up with a good feeling from a dream. But often we can't remember the dream. Dreams can go away quickly from memory.
Too much dreaming can be harmful. The more we sleep, the longer we dream. The mind is hard at work when we dream. That is why we may have a long sleep and still wake up tired.

questions.text: It may be less important to sleep than to_______.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that dreaming is the most important part of sleep.

questions.text: Dreams are usually _____.
questions.explanation: The text mentions that dreams are usually in color.

choices.A: Because they are tired in the daytime.
choices.B: Because they are not interested in their work.
choices.C: Because they may think about their work all day.
choices.D: Because they have too much work to do.

questions.explanation: The passage says that people who think about their work all day may have those ideas carry over into their dreams.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true ?

choices.A: Dreams may be helpful to people sometimes.
choices.B: Too much dreaming may be bad for health.
choices.C: People always remember their dreams clearly.
choices.D: People sometimes wake up tired if they have a lot of dreams while sleeping

questions.explanation: The passage says that often people can't remember their dreams.

questions.text: The story mainly tells us ______.

choices.A: dreams are familiar to each person

questions.explanation: The passage discusses the importance and nature of dreams, which are familiar to everyone.

question_sets.context:
Gygori Pilikian spent his 114th birthday yesterday and some reporters visited him to find out the secret of a long life.
"The secret of a long life is happiness," Grygori said. "If you are happy, you will live for a long time."
"Are you married?" a reporter asked. "Yes," Grygori answered, "I married my third wife when I was 102. If you have happy marriage, you will live better. But for(要是没有) my third wife, maybe, I have died."
"What about smoking and drinking?" another reporter asked. Grygori said, "Don't smoke at all and you will feel well. Drink two glasses of wine a day and you will be healthy and happy."

questions.text: Some reporter s visited Grygori because ________.

choices.B: he was a friend of them .
choices.C: he had lived to be much longer than most people .

questions.explanation: The reporters visited him because he lived to be 114 years old.

questions.text: Grygori thought that ______ was the most important to life.

questions.explanation: "Wine" means "酒" in Chinese.

questions.text: The writer wants to tell us ________.

choices.A: drinking much is good for our health .
choices.C: smoking and drinking are the most important to our health.
choices.D: both smoking and drinking are bad for our health.

questions.explanation: The passage suggests drinking a little wine is helpful, but doesn't say anything about smoking being helpful.

questions.text: The best title for this passage is _______.

choices.B: The secret of a Long Life

questions.explanation: The passage is primarily about the secret to a long life.

Father: We shall have a swim in the sea. Then we shall have a mealin the open air.
Jim: Great!
Father: Come on! Let's all get into the car.
Jim: What's wrong, dad?
Father: There's something wrong with the car.
Mother: So we shall stay at home.

question_sets.context: Johnny Kelley is 86 years old. He has just run the last eleven kilometers of the Boston Marathon. It took him one hour and fifteen minutes to run the eleven kilometers. After his run, he went to the hospital center. The nurse was surprised and pleased to see his blood pressure was 139 over 84. She told him that his blood pressure was very good. Then she said, "I wish mine were that good." Johnny Kelly is known as the great grandfather of the Boston Marathon. He ran all the 42 kilometres of the marathon 61 times. This year was the second time that he has cut back and run only part of it. Kelley holds the record for running more Boston Marathon than anyone else. Thousands of people cry "come on" to him as he runs. Today an 11-year-old boy called out to Kelley, "Hey, Mr Kelley--- you are great. Great man." Kelley smiles and thanks people as he runs. "It's wonderful," he said. "People come out to shake my hand. I am welcomed by thousands and thousands. I think a lot of them thought I ran the whole race. And maybe they congratulated me because they know me after all these years and they don't know the other runners."

questions.text: 1.Kelley is known as the guest grandfather of the Boston Marathon because _____.

choices.B: he ran all the 42 kilometres of the Boston Marathon that day
choices.C: He was old and ran all the 42 kilometres of the Boston Marathon 61 times.
choices.D: His grandson is the best runner of the Boston Marathon

questions.explanation: 根据文章第二段，可知C选项正确。

questions.text: 2. When Kelley said it was wonderful , he meant that________.

choices.A: he was welcomed by thousands of people
choices.B: his blood pressure was so good
choices.C: he was able to run the whole Marathon race
choices.D: he got to the hospital center safely

questions.explanation: 根据文章第三段，可知A选项正确。

choices.A: to tell the nurse the good news
choices.B: the thank people who cried "come on" to him

questions.explanation: 根据文章第一段，可知D选项正确。

choices.A: to tell the nurse the good news
choices.B: to thank people who cried "come on" to him
choices.D: to see if his blood pressure was good

questions.explanation: 根据文章第一段，可知D选项正确。

questions.text: 5.Which of the following is true

choices.A: Johnny Kelley's blood pressure was very high.
choices.B: Johnny Kelley was very old but quite healthy.
choices.C: Johnny Kelley ran the whole Boston Marathon when he was 86.
choices.D: This was the first time that Johnny Kelley didn't run the whole race.

questions.explanation: 根据文章第一段和第二段，可知B选项正确。

The children all like sports. Tom likes playing football best. Basketball is Jack and John's favourite sport. So their nicknames(绰号,别名) are football and basketball. Their parents often call Tom"football"and call the twin brothers "basketball". How interesting!

question_sets.context:
We are all busy talking about and using the Internet, but how many of us know about the history of the Internet?
Many people are surprised when they find that the Internet was set up in the 1960s. At that time, computers were large and expensive. Computer networks(网络) didn' t work well. If one computer in the network broke down, then the whole network stopped. So a new network system(系统) had to be set up. It should be good enough to be used by many different computers. If part of the network was not working, information could be sent through another part. In this way the computer network system would keep on working all the time.
At first, the Internet was only used by the government, but, in the early 1970s, universities, hospitals and banks were allowed to use it too. However, computers were still expensive and the Internet was difficult to use. By the start of the 1990s, computers become cheaper and easier to use. Scientists had also developed software(软件) that made "surfing(浏览)" the Internet more conveninent(方便).
Today it is easy to get on-line and it is said that millions of people use the Internet every day. Sending e-mail is more and more popular among students.
The Internet has now become one of the most important parts of people' s life.

questions.text: The Internet has a history of <blank> years.
questions.explanation: The internet was set up in 1960s, so its history is about 40 years.

questions.text: Scientists set up a new network system to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentioned 'So a new network system(系统) had to be set up', which means to make the system work well.

questions.text: The Internet was widely used in the <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage 'By the start of the 1990s, computers become cheaper and easier to use.', so the internet was widely used in 1990s.

questions.text: The underlined words "get on-line" in Chinese mean <blank>.
questions.explanation: "get on-line" means "上网" in Chinese.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true?

choices.A: In the 1960s computer network system went wrong easily.
choices.B: Computers are much cheaper than before.
choices.C: Today the Internet is used everywhere.
choices.D: People had enough softwares to get on-line fifteen years ago.

questions.explanation: It could be inferred from the sentence 'By the start of the 1990s, computers become cheaper and easier to use. Scientists had also developed software(软件) that made "surfing(浏览)" the Internet more convenient(方便).' that people didn't have enough softwares to get online before 1990s. Fifteen years ago is 1995. So, D is not true.

question_sets.context: A man was walking through a forest. He had a few caps in his hands. In the forest there were a lot of monkeys. The day was hot, so he decided to have a rest under a tree. He put one cap on his head and lay down to sleep. When he woke up, he couldn't find his caps. "where are my caps ?" he cried and looked up. He saw some monkeys in the tree. Each had a cap on its head. "Give me back my caps !" shouted the man to the monkeys. But they didn't understand him. They only jumped, laughed and danced. "How can I get back my caps ?" he thought hard. In the end he had an idea. He took off his cap and threw it on the ground ! The little animals did the same thing. Happily the man picked up all the caps and went on his way.

questions.explanation: According to the first sentence of the passage, the man was walking through a forest.

choices.A: he found his caps were gone

questions.explanation: According to the passage, when he woke up, he couldn't find his caps.

choices.B: Because the monkeys wanted to wear the caps.
choices.C: Because the monkeys didn't understand him.
choices.D: Because the monkeys didn't hear what he shouted.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the monkeys didn't understand him.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the man happily picked up all the caps.

question_sets.context:
Bill Clinton took office on January 1, 1993 and became the 42nd US president(总统).He was the first US President who was born after World War Ⅱ. He was also one of the youngest US Presidents.
Clinton was born in a poor family in 1946. Three months before he was born, his father, William Blats, died. When he was small, his mother remarried Norger Clinton, so the boy's family name changed. In the summer of 1963, Clinton won a drama contest(戏剧演出),so he was given a chance to visit the city of washington. During his visit he met President Kennedy in the White House(白宫). From that time on, he made up his mind to become a president.

questions.explanation: This passage is about Bill Clinton's early life and his path to becoming president.

question_sets.context:
It was a sunny day. Mr King went to town on business. On his way home, he found in front of him a big pile of hay (干草). He got down from his horse. The hay had fallen off a wagon(马车). A boy was standing by the wagon and looked worried. Mr King was sorry for the little driver.
"Now don't worry, my boy," Mr King said. "Come with me to the village over there, and I'll find someone to help you get the hay back onto the wagon.".
In the village Mr King's friend asked him and the boy to have dinner, Mr King enjoyed the man's dinner, but he saw the boy still looked worried.
"Dad won't like this !" the boy said in a low voice. "Dad won't like this ."
"Don't worry too much," said Mr King. Just be careful next time. Now have your dinner, and you needn't hurry.
"But I was here for a long time. Dad will be angry." "oh, come on." said Mr King, "Dad will understand, he will be glad if he knows that you have had a good dinner. I'll go with you and explain what has happened, By the way, where's your dad?".
"He's under the pile of hay!"

questions.text: Mr King went to town <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, Mr. King went to town on a horse.

questions.text: The boy looked worried because <blank>.

choices.B: it was getting dark and he couldn't get home for dinner
choices.C: he couldn't go to school on time.

questions.explanation: The boy was worried that his dad was under the hay.

questions.text: Mr King helped the boy because <blank>.

choices.A: he was asked to do so
choices.C: he was a very kind man

questions.explanation: Mr. King helped because he was sorry for the little driver and offered assistance.

choices.A: he didn't go with Mr King
choices.C: he asked for Mr King's help
choices.D: he hurried to tell Mr King about the accident

questions.explanation: The boy wanted to hurry up because he was afraid his father would be angry.

choices.B: Mr King wouldn't save the boy's father.
choices.C: The boy found a way to pull out his father
choices.D: The driver wasn't angry with his son.

questions.explanation: Mr. King assumed the boy was the driver, which is evident from his initial interaction.

question_sets.context:
All the housewives who went to the new supermarket had one great wish to be the lucky customer(顾客)who didn't have to pay for shopping .For this was the notice (布告)just inside the entrance promised (允许). It said , "Remember, once a week, one of our customers get free goods . This may be your lucky day."
For several weeks Mrs Edwards hoped, like many of her friends , to be lucky customer, Unlike her friends, she never gave up hope . The cupboards in the kitchen were full of things she didn't need, Her husband tried to stop her, but he failed. she dreamed of (梦想)the day when the manager(经理)of the supermarket approach her and said, "Madam, this is your lucky day. Everything in your basket is free."
One Friday morning after she finished her shopping and took it to her car, she found that she forgot to buy some tea. she went back to the supermarket, got the tea and went towards the cask-desk, (心款台). As she did so, she saw the manager approach her . "Madam," he said , holding out his hands, " You are only lucky customer and everything you have in your basket is free."

choices.B: wanted to do shopping without paying

choices.A: wanted to play a joke on someone

questions.explanation: The supermarket likely wanted to attract more customers by offering free goods to a lucky customer.

questions.explanation: It's implied that only a few people got free goods, as it was a weekly event and Mrs. Edwards had been hoping for weeks.

question_sets.context:
One day Mrs Wilson took Trudy and Ben to go shopping. They went to the supermarket in the new shopping mall(购物中心).
"Why do you buy things here, Mum?" Trudy asked.
"Because they are cheaper than those at the corner store," Mrs Wilson said. "Help me check(检查) the prices."
The Wilsons were not wealthy(富有的) and Mrs Wilson was always careful with her money. She looked carefully at the prices of things. She bought some groceries(杂货) in the supermarket.
When they got home, the children said, "We don't think you saved money by going to the supermarket there."
"Of course I did," said Mrs Wilson, "everything was cheap there."
"We know," said the children, "but we came home by taxi because we had too much to carry. The cost(花费) of the taxi was more than the money you saved!"
Mrs Wilson added everything up and found her children were right.
"Well done," she said, "next time we will do shopping near our home."

questions.text: Mrs Wilson took Trudy and Ben <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states, 'One day Mrs Wilson took Trudy and Ben to go shopping. They went to the supermarket'.

questions.text: Mrs Wilson bought things in the supermarket in the new shopping mall because <blank>.
questions.explanation: Mrs. Wilson stated, "Because they are cheaper than those at the corner store."

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?

choices.A: The Wilsons were rich and they bought a lot of things in the supermarket.
choices.B: The Wilsons were not rich and they bought things in a cheaper supermarket.
choices.C: The Wilsons enjoyed shopping in the shopping mall because it was large.
choices.D: The Wilsons were poor and they seldom went shopping.

questions.explanation: The text says 'The Wilsons were not wealthy' and Mrs Wilson chose to shop at the supermarket because 'they are cheaper than those at the corner store'.

questions.text: Mrs Wilson went home <blank>.
questions.explanation: The children said, 'we came home by taxi because we had too much to carry.'

questions.text: Mrs Wilson decided to go shopping <blank> next time.

choices.A: in the shopping mall far away

questions.explanation: Mrs. Wilson said, 'next time we will do shopping near our home.'

question_sets.context:
English breakfast is a very big meal―eggs, tomatoes, tea, coffee… For many people lunch is a quick meal. In cities, there a lot of sandwiches bars, where office workers can buy the kind of bread they want―brown, white, or a roll(小圆面包) and then all kinds of salad(色拉) and a meat or fish to go in the sandwich. School children can have a hot meal at school. But many just take a sandwich, a drink and some fruit from home. "Tea" means two things. It is a drink and a meal! Some people have afternoon with sandwiches, cakes and a cup of tea.
They usually have the evening meal quite early, between 6:00 and 8:00, and often all the family eat together.On Sundays many families have a traditional(传统的) lunch. They have chicken, pork with potatoes, vegetables.
The Englishmen like food from other countries, too, especially(特别地) French, Chinese, Italian and Indian. People often get take-away food . They buy the food outside and then bring it home to eat.

questions.text: In England many people have a <blank> breakfast and a quick lunch.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "English breakfast is a very big meal" and "For many people lunch is a quick meal."

questions.explanation: The passage says, "In cities, there a lot of sandwiches bars, where office workers can buy the kind of bread they want"

questions.text: In England tea can mean <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "'Tea' means two things. It is a drink and a meal!"

questions.text: Supper in England can last about <blank> and it begins very early.
questions.explanation: According to the context, the supper usually happens between 6:00 and 8:00.

questions.explanation: The passage says, "People often get take-away food . They buy the food outside and then bring it home to eat."

question_sets.context:
Students often want to practice(练习) their English outside class. One of the best ways of practicing your English is to speak to foreigners. Most of the students ask, "Is it OK to talk to foreigners when we meet them in the street?"
The answer is yes or no, but probably(或许) no! If you see a foreigner who looks lost, it is polite(礼貌) to ask him or her, "May I help you?" But if not, you should probably let him or her get on with the business. That is, you can talk to a foreigner at some time or place. Feel free to ask him or her question if a foreigner comes into your school, classroom or your teacher's office.
It's also OK to talk to foreigners in some public(公共) places. If you see a foreigner alone in a restaurant, a waiting room, or a shop, it may be the right time for you to ask him or her, "Is this seat free?" or questions like this. You can probably help them if they are new to China. And if they are alone, you may be able to make them feel more welcome.
It's a pleasure to talk to a foreigner if you choose the right time and place.

questions.text: What is the best way to practice your English?
questions.explanation: The first sentence says "One of the best ways of practicing your English is to speak to foreigners."

questions.text: From the passage, we know that <blank>.

choices.A: it is polite to stop foreigners to talk with you in the street
choices.B: it is polite to stop foreigners to talk with you when they are busy
choices.C: it isn't polite to stop foreigners to talk with you when they are on business
choices.D: it isn't polite to help foreigner find their way

questions.explanation: The passage says "If you see a foreigner who looks lost, it is polite(礼貌) to ask him or her, 'May I help you?' But if not, you should probably let him or her get on with the business."

questions.text: When you try to talk to a foreigner alone in a park, usually he may <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, it is OK to talk to foreigners in some public(公共) places.

questions.text: This passage is mainly about <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage is about when is the best time to talk to a foreigner.

questions.text: The best title (题目) for this passage is <blank>.

choices.A: How to learn English in class
choices.C: When to speak English outside class
choices.D: How to talk with a foreigner

questions.explanation: The passage is about when is the best time to talk to a foreigner, which is also when to speak English outside class.

question_sets.context:
Mrs. Tan was worried about her weight (重量) . "I'm much too fat, " she told her friend. "I need to lose a lot of weight but I don't know how to do it."
"Go and see Dr Wei," her friend said, "He'll tell you how to lose weight." Mrs. Tan visited Dr Wei and told him her problem.
"It isn't difficult to lose weight," he told her. "All you need to do is go on a diet (节食). I'll give you one." He began to write on a piece of paper. "Eat lots of fruit and vegetables. Also eat a lot of lean meat (瘦肉) and grains (谷物)"
When he finished, he handed her the piece of paper.
"There you are," he said. "Eat all those things and you'll soon lose weights."
A few weeks later, Mrs.Tan's friend called on her. She was surprised to see that she was even fatter than before and that she was eating a large sandwich with chocolate cake and ice cream.
"I thought you were on a diet," she said, "Oh, I'm," Mrs. Tan answered. "I've already had all the food on my diet today. Now I'm eating my dinner."

questions.text: Mrs. Tan didn't know <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first paragraph says "I need to lose a lot of weight but I don't know how to do it."

questions.text: Mrs. Tan wanted to lose weight because she had too much <blank>.
questions.explanation: She says "I'm much too fat"

questions.text: When Mrs. Tan visited Doctor Wei, he told her <blank>.
questions.explanation: He prescribed her a diet which is what to do

questions.text: Mrs. Tan got even fatter because she ate <blank>.
questions.explanation: Her friend saw her "eating a large sandwich with chocolate cake and ice cream"

questions.text: From last sentence we know Mrs. Tan <blank>.

choices.A: didn't understand the doctor at all
choices.D: loved to go on a diet

questions.explanation: She is already on diet but still eating those fatty food, which means she didn't understand the doctor.

question_sets.context:
Mr. Williams is always a very careful driver. He was driving home from work one evening, when he came to a crossroad(十字路口). It had a "Slow!" sign, so he slowed down when he came to the main road, looked both ways to see that nothing was coming, and then drove across without stopping.
At once he heard a police's voice, so he pulled in to the side of the road and stopped. A policeman walked over to him with a notebook and a pen in his hand and said, "Why didn't you stop at that crossing?"
"But the sign there doesn't say 'Stop!'. It just says 'Slow!' and I did go slowly."
The policeman looked around him, and a look of surprise came over his face. Then he put his notebook and pen away, scratched his head (搔头皮), and said, "Well, I'm too stupid! I'm in the wrong street!"

questions.text: Mr. Williams is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that Mr. Williams is always a very careful driver.

questions.text: When he came to a crossroad, he saw <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions, 'It had a "Slow!" sign'.

questions.text: When he saw that nothing was coming, he <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states, '...looked both ways to see that nothing was coming, and then drove across without stopping'.

questions.text: The policeman asked him to stop because <blank>.

choices.A: he stayed in the wrong street
choices.B: he didn't stop when he saw "Stop" sign
choices.D: the policeman thought he broke the rule

questions.explanation: The policeman initially believed that Mr. Williams had violated a traffic rule, but it turned out the policeman was on the wrong street.

questions.text: Which of the following is right according to the passage?

choices.A: Mr. Williams is driving to work one evening.
choices.C: The policeman gave him a notebook.
choices.D: When he came to a crossroad, he stopped.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates the policeman was mistaken about the street, making it the policeman's fault.

question_sets.context:
I'm sitting on the school bus. It is ten past seven in the morning.
Today is Thursday. I will show my social studies homework to the class. I will stand in front of the class and give a talk about Michigan, a state (州) in the U.S. It took me one week to do my homework. Will it go well?
I am not good at social studies. Last year, I did badly in this class. I want to be the first to speak. If I go first, no one will think my work is bad. But I don't put my hand up. Lauren puts up hers. She goes first. She talks for five minutes about Louisiana. Then I quickly put up my hand to be second.
Then it's me. I walk to the front of the classroom and begin my talk. I first show them a picture of Michigan's flag. I also tell them about holidays in Michigan, like the Apple Festival. At the end of my talk, the class cheer.

questions.explanation: The second sentence of the passage clearly states, "Today is Thursday."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Fact vs. Opinion

question_sets.context:
One day we invited some friends to dinner. When it was about six o'clock, my wife found that we had little bread.
So she asked our five-year-old daughter, Kathy, to buy some.
"Here's a dollar," my wife said, " get two loaves(条) of bread, if they have it. If they don't have it, get anything. But hurry!"
Kathy hurried off, and we waited and waited. By a quarter past six, all the friends had arrived. But Kathy had not returned. Finally we saw her dancing around the corner with a bright new hula hoop(呼啦圈) whirling(旋转) round her middle.
"Kathy!" her mother cried. "Where did you get that hula hoop, and where is the bread?"
"Well, when I got to the shop, they had sold all their bread," answered Kathy. "And you said 'If they don't have that, get anything!'"

questions.text: 1. One day Kathy's parents invited some friends to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions inviting friends to dinner, which is also known as supper.

questions.text: 2. How much did Kathy's mother give her?
questions.explanation: The text explicitly states that Kathy's mother gave her a dollar.

questions.text: 3. Kathy <blank> in a hurry.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'Kathy hurried off,' implying that she went to the shop.

questions.text: 4. What did Kathy buy at last?
questions.explanation: Kathy returned with a hula hoop, as the shop had sold all their bread.

questions.text: 5. Why did she do this?

choices.A: because the shop had sold all their bread.
choices.B: because her mother asked her to get anything if they hadn't had bread.
choices.C: because she loved playing with hula hoop.

questions.explanation: The shop's lack of bread and her mother's instruction both contributed to her buying the hula hoop.

question_sets.context:
Han is a visitor, he is in London for the first time. He is now in England for a week, and he sees many strange things.
Yesterday something strange happened to him. He wanted to go to the British Museum to look at some old books, so he went to the bus stop and waited for a bus. Soon the number 18 bus came, and he got on it. He asked the_conductor_to tell him the nearest way to the museum. The conductor told him to get off the bus at the third stop, and then walked down the street for five minutes.
"Go down New Oxford Street, turn left, and turn right and the British Museum is on the left," he said.
Han got off the bus and started to walk. But after five minutes he knew he was lost. At school his English teacher always said, "If you lose your way in London, ask a policeman. They are very friendly."
Suddenly, Han saw a policeman, in a very new uniform. He wanted to ask him a question but before he opened his mouth, the policeman said, "Excuse me, can you tell the way to the nearest police station? It's my first day at work, and I'm lost!"

choices.B: look at some old books in a museum.

questions.explanation: The passage states that Han wanted to go to the British Museum to look at some old books.

questions.explanation: In this context, 'conductor' refers to the person on the bus who provides directions, similar to a '售票员'.

choices.A: when he was on the bus.
choices.B: after he got off the bus and walked for five minutes

questions.explanation: The passage indicates Han realized he was lost after walking for five minutes.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions Han's teacher advised him to ask a policeman for help.

choices.A: He was on his way to workplace.
choices.C: He knew the way to the police station.
choices.D: He got lost as the writer.

questions.explanation: The policeman admitted he didn't know the way to the police station.

question_sets.context:
In the sea there are many island. In its warm water there are some little ones. We call them Coral Island(珊瑚岛).
A coral island is very nice to look at. It looks like a ring of land with trees, grass, and flowers on it. One part of the ring is open to the water. There is a little round lake inside the island.
If you look at a piece of coral, you will see many little holes in it. In each of these holes a very small animals has lived. There sea animals make the coral. They began to build under the water. Year after year, the coral grew higher and higher. At last it grew out of water.
Then the sea brought it to small trees and something else. After some tears, these things changed into a earth. Sometimes birds flew over it and brought seeds to the island.
The little seeds grew. In a few years there were plants all over the island. In a few more years there were trees growing there.
So you see, these island were built by little. The workers were very small. Do they not teach us a lesson ? Can you think what the lesson is?

questions.explanation: The passage says that a coral island looks like a ring of land.

questions.text: There are <blank> in the holes of corals.
questions.explanation: The passage says that very small sea animals live in the holes of corals.

question_sets.context:
There was once a man who kept ten monkeys as pets as he was very fond of them．Every morning the monkeys would climb up and down the trees or swing from one branch(树枝)to another in his backyard．After that,he would feed them bananas．
One morning the man said to the monkeys,"We have very few bananas left today．For breakfast I shall give each of you two bananas and four for dinner．"
When the monkeys heard this,they looked very unhappy．They refused(拒绝)to take the bananas that the man was handing out to them．
"Very well,then．You shall have four bananas in the morning and two for dinner,"the man said．
The monkeys looked at one another．Then they jumped up and down happily,nodding their heads．They took the big,yellow bananas from the man and started eating．

Little Peter is a boy of nine. He began to go to school the year before last and now he's in Grade Three. He lives not far from the school but he is often late for class. He likes watching Tv in the evening and goes to bed late, so he can't get up on time in the morning.
This term, Mrs Black, Peter's aunt, works in Peter's school. She teaches Grade Three maths. She's strict with(严格)Peter and often tells the boy to obey(遵守)the school rules and come to school on time. Yesterday morning peter got up late. When he hurried to school, it was half past eight. His aunt was waiting for him at the school gate.
"You're ten minutes late for the first class, Peter," Mrs Black said angrily.

"Every time I get to the street corner, I see a guidepost(路标). It says:
'SCHOOL---GO SLOW!' "

Most American families are smaller than the families in other countries. Most American families have one or two parents and one or two childen each.
Children in the US will leave their parents' home when they grow up. They usually live far from their parents because they want to find good jobs. They often write to their parents or telephone them. And they often go to visit their parents on holiday.
Parents usually let their children choose their own jobs. Americans think it is important for young people to decide on their lives by themselves.
Parents ask chidren to do some work around their house. And in many families, parents pay their children foe doing some housework so that(以便)they learn how to make money for their own use.

question_sets.context: A businessman had worked too much. He found that he could not sleep at night, but often fell asleep during the day. He became very worried, so he went to see his doctor. "Can you help me, doctor?" he asked. "I slept so well before, but now I don't have more than two hours at night." The doctor looked him over carefully, asked him to work less hard, and told him to take some medicine to help him. He said he was sure that he was not seriously ill, and that he would soon be better. But the businessman became worse instead of better. He slept even less than before at night, and was still falling asleep in his office. He visited the doctor again, and it took the doctor a long time to find out the reason: the businessman's wife was giving him the sleeping medicines in the morning, and the ones to keep him awake at night.

question_sets.context: Sam is one of my friends. He can run very fast indeed, and he is always ready to show people how fast he can run. One day a thief broke into his house, took some of his things and ran off as fast as he could. Sam ran after him and shouted, "Hey, stop! Don't you know you can't run away from me?" But the thief only ran faster. Sam got angry. He tried his best to run. He was soon several miles away from his home. He was still rushing along when he ran into me. "Why are you in such a hurry?" I asked. "I'm trying to catch a thief," "But where's the thief?" I asked. "Miles and miles behind," said Sam, smiling with pride. "He thought he could run faster than I, but you see he is wrong."

question_sets.context:
Mr King lives in a city. He owns some shops and makes a lot of money. His son, Mike, studies at a middle school. The boy likes everything but studying. He doesn't listen to his teachers in class and he never finishes his homework on time. He always plays football when he has any free time. He can never pass the exams.
Mr King is so busy with his business that he has little time to stay at home. He never pays any attention(关心) to his son's studies, so he doesn't know how he is doing.
One day Miss Read, Mike's teacher, telephones Mr King. On the telephone she tells him all about the boy's studies. She wants him to try to help his son at home. When the man hears this, he doesn't feel very happy.
In the afternoon when his son comes back from school, Mr King gives him a good telling off(责备), but soon feels sorry for it when he sees Mike crying in the bedroom. The next morning, before Mike goes to school, he says to him, "Study hard and I'll buy you a car when you pass the exam next year."
Another term is over. Mike doesn't pass the exam once more. Mr King has a look at the school report for a few minutes and then he asks his son, "You don't pass the exam again, Mike. What did you do this term?"
"I learned how to drive a car, dad." answers the boy.

question_sets.context:
Our world is getting smaller and smaller. We can fly around the world in less than 50 hours. The newest plane can fly at 600 miles an hour. You can have breakfast in Tokyo and supper in Paris.
But hundreds of years ago, it took people a long time to go around the world. Magellan's(麦哲伦) men were the first to make that trip. They went by ship and it took them more than two years. On September 20, 1510,he left Spain(西班牙) with five ships and 240men. He was killed in the Philippines(菲律宾). More than two years later, on December 21, 1512 , only one of the five ships with just 31 men returned to Spain. Magellan's trip taught us that the world was round and that people could go around the world.

question_sets.context:
Lucy could not do her work.She felt too tired. She put down her book, yawned(打哈欠) and felt better. Lucy looked up. Had the teacher seen her? To her surprise, the teacher was yawned, too. He took a long breath(呼吸)and opened his mouth wide. He closed his eyes a bit and let out his breath in a big, slow yawn. Then Lucy heard other yawns. The teacher said:"Lucy yawned because our doors and windows are closed. And the room is warm. Her body needed more air. Maybe she yawned because she was tired. Maybe she was hungry. Or she just needed to move a bit. Do you feel better now,Lucy?"he asked. "Yes,"said Lucy. "Yawns wake us up,"the teacher said,"When you yawn you stretch (伸展)many parts of your body. That stretching makes you feel good."
There were more yawns. "People do not know why they yawn,"the teacher said. "But if you see a yawn, hear one, or even read about one, you may yawn too. And once your yawn starts, you can't stop it. You may close your mouth to stop it. But the yawn will still come. "The teacher stood up and said,"Let's open the window and let some air in. You may also go out for a drink. A cold drink or water on your face help to stop yawns.Lucy may go first. "How do you feel now after you have read this story? Did you yawn? Watch a friend read this. See if your friend starts to yawn . If you see a yawn, you will know why!

questions.text: Lucy yawned because <blank>.
questions.explanation: The teacher said, "Maybe she yawned because she was tired."

questions.explanation: The teacher said, "A cold drink or water on your face help to stop yawns."

question_sets.context:
Mr. Smith was an officer. He liked walking from his home to his office unless it was raining, because it gave him some exercise.
One morning he was walking along the street when a stranger stopped him and said to him, "You may not remember me, but seven years ago I came to this city without a penny in my pockets. I stopped you in this street and asked you to lend me some money, and you lent me five pounds, because you said that you were willing to take a chance so as to give a man a start on the road to success."
Mr. Smith thought for a few moments and then said, "Yes, I remember you. Go on with your story."
"Well," answered the stranger. "Are you still willing to take another chance?"

question_sets.context:
Last winter holiday Jim and his friends came to Beijing for holidays.
One day we took them to a Chinese restaurant to try some Chinese food. They tried Sichuan dishes and roast (烤) ducks. They thought that Chinese dishes were very delicious. They wanted to eat them again.
They visited the Great Wall, the Palace Museum and the Tian' anmen Square. We also showed them around our school. We had a basketball match together. Our teacher took them to his house and cooked for them. We had a party before they returned to America .
We all enjoyed the holiday with Jim and his friends because we had a lot of fun.

questions.text: Jim and his friends came to Beijing <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence says 'Last winter holiday Jim and his friends came to Beijing for holidays.'

questions.text: Why did Jim and his friends want to eat Chinese dishes again?
questions.explanation: They thought that Chinese dishes were very delicious.

questions.text: Why not Jim and his friends enjoy the holiday?

choices.B: Because they visited many famous places in Beijing.
choices.C: Because they had a good time with us.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that they enjoyed the holiday because of all the reasons mentioned in A, B and C.

question_sets.context:
One evening Mary was alone in her house. Suddenly she heard a noise outside the door. She stood up quickly and went to the door. She could hear two men.
"Is this the place?" one of the men asked quietly.
"Yes, ring the bell." The other man said.
The second man rang the bell. Mary didn't open the door. she didn't know the men. She was afraid.
"knock at the door," the first man said. The second man knocked at the door. Mary still didn't open the door.
"Are we going to break down the door?" the first man asked angrily.
Mary was very worried now. she ran to the phone and dialed 999. The police answered quickly.
"There are two men outside my house," Mary said quietly, "They are going to break down the door."
She gave the police her name and address. The police got to her house quickly and took the men away.

questions.text: One evening Mary was alone <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that Mary was alone in her house.

questions.text: <blank> came to the door of Mary's house.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that she could hear two men.

questions.text: Mary didn't open the door because she <blank>.
questions.explanation: She didn't know the men and she was afraid.

questions.text: The text is about <blank>.
questions.explanation: Mary was careful because she didn't open the door and called the police.

question_sets.context:
I am doing shopping with my mother. I usually go shopping with my friends orclassmates, but it is my birthday and my mother wants to buy me some new clothes as presents. So we go to a shop called Stradivarius. I really like that shop. My mother starts to laugh as soon as we get there. She says, "Almost all the clothes in the window are just like the things I wore when I was young. Those flared trousers (喇叭裤) and very short skirts."
Back in the 1970s every Saturday morning my mother and her friends looked around the shops. Of course they did not always have money to buy the things they wanted. But they could decorate (装饰) their old jeans to make them look new. My grandmother was very good at sewing (缝补) and she helped my mother sew colored patches (小块的布) onto her old jeans.
My mother says she really likes these styles and so do I.

questions.text: <blank>, so I go shopping with her.

choices.A: I want to buy myself some new clothes
choices.B: I want to buy my mother some presents
choices.C: My mother wants to buy some new clothes
choices.D: My mother wants to buy me some new clothes for my birthday

questions.explanation: The first paragraph states that it's the narrator's birthday, and the mother wants to buy new clothes for her.

questions.text: Why does my mother laugh as soon as she sees the clothes in the window?

choices.A: She thinks the clothes in the window are all strange and old.
choices.B: The clothes look quite different from those she wore when she was young.
choices.C: She is very happy to see that there are so many kinds of clothes.
choices.D: They are nearly the same as the clothes she wore when she was young.

questions.explanation: The mother states the clothes are similar to what she wore when young.

questions.text: Could my mother always buy the clothes she wanted when she was young?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions they did not always have money.

questions.text: My grandmother helped my mother decorate her clothes by <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions sewing colored patches onto old jeans.

questions.text: In a word, both my mother and I <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says the mother and the narrator both like these styles.

question_sets.context:
From London to New York, from Hong Kong to Moscow, subways are an important way of transportation. Traffic in modern cities is often quite heavy, and it can sometimes take hours to cross a busy city in a car or bus. Subways help solve that problem, since they don't have to stop at traffic lights, and hundreds of people can take a subway train together.
In larger subway systems, such as Mexico City's, there are lines that go far beyond the city centre. In this way, people living in the suburbs can take a train to work. This reduces(减少) the traffic entering and leaving a city. It also helps reduce air pollution, a big problem in many cities. Finally, subways are usually cheaper. Basically, in a city with a subway, everybody wins!

choices.B: can take the subway train to work.
choices.C: are an important means of transportation.
choices.D: because subways don't have to stop at traffic lights.57. Traffic in modern cities __________________58. In larger subway systems people living in the suburbs __________________59. Thousands of cars entering and leaving the city __________________60. Travelling by subway doesn't take a long time __________________

questions.explanation: Subways around the world are an important means of transportation.

choices.B: can take the subway train to work.

questions.explanation: Traffic in modern cities is often very heavy and it sometimes takes a long time to cross the city in a car or bus.

questions.explanation: In larger subway systems people living in the suburbs can take the subway train to work.

questions.explanation: Travelling by subway doesn't take a long time because subways don't have to stop at traffic lights.

question_sets.context:
A traveler came out of the airport . There were a lot of taxis . He asked every taxi driver his name . Then he took the third one . It cost 5 dollars from the airport to the hotel . "How much does it cost for the whole day ?" The man asked . "100 dollars ," said the taxi driver . This was very expensive , but the man said it was OK .
The taxi driver took the man everywhere . He showed him all the parks and museums in the city . In the evening they went back to the hotel . The traveler gave the taxi driver 100 dollars and said , "What about tomorrow? It's another 100 dollars ." But the man said ,"That's OK! See you tomorrow ." The taxi driver was very pleased .
The next day the taxi driver took the traveler everywhere again . They visited all the parks and museums again , and in the evening they went back to the hotel . The man gave the taxi driver 100 dollars again and said , "I'm going home tomorrow ." The taxi driver was sorry because he liked the traveler and, above all , 100 dollars a day was a lot of money . "So you're going home . Where do you come from ?" he asked . " I come from New York ! " said the traveler ."I have a sister in New York . Her name is Susanna . Do you know her ?" "Of course I know her . She gave me 200 dollars for you ! "

questions.text: Where did the traveler come from ?
questions.explanation: The traveler said he came from New York, which is in America.

questions.text: Why did the traveler take the third taxi ?  Because ___________ .

choices.A: the other taxi drivers asked for more money
choices.B: the third taxi driver was a kind-hearted man
choices.C: he didn't want to spend his own money on the coming visit
choices.D: the other drivers didn't like him

questions.explanation: The traveler asked every taxi driver his name, suggesting he was looking for a specific person, likely to use someone else's money.

questions.text: Usually the cost traveling one day by taxi may be ____________ .
questions.explanation: The man asked how much it cost for the whole day and the taxi driver said 100 dollars. This was very expensive.

questions.text: Who asked the traveler to give the money to the taxi driver ?
questions.explanation: The traveler's sister, Susanna, gave him 200 dollars for the taxi driver.

questions.text: The driver was unhappy _________________ .

choices.A: when he heard the traveler's last words
choices.B: when the traveler asked every taxi driver his name
choices.C: when the traveler asked him for his sister's name

questions.explanation: The taxi driver was sorry because he liked the traveler and, above all , 100 dollars a day was a lot of money.

question_sets.context:
Mark Twain,the famous American writer,was traveling in France.Once he was going by train to Dijon.That afternoon he was very tired and wanted to sleep,so he asked the conductor to wake him up when they came to Dijon.But first he explained that he was a very heavy sleeper."I' ll probably protest(表示不满)loudly when you try to wake me up," he said to the conductor,"but do not take any notice,just put me off the train anyway."
Then Mark Twain went to sleep.Later,when he woke up,it was night-time and the train was in Paris already.He realized at once that the conductor had forgotten to wake him up at Dijon.He was very angry.He ran up to the conductor and began to shout at him."I have never been so angry in all my life,"Mark Twain said.
The conductor looked at him calmly(冷静地)."You are not half so angry as the American whom I put off at Dijon,"he said.

questions.text: ―Who' s Mark Twain?
questions.explanation: The first sentence says Mark Twain is the famous American writer.

questions.text: Mark Twain wanted to sleep because______.
questions.explanation: That afternoon he was very tired and wanted to sleep.

questions.text: He wanted to wake up______.
questions.explanation: He asked the conductor to wake him up when they came to Dijon.

questions.text: Heavy sleeper means______.

choices.A: A person not easily to sleep
choices.B: A person not easily to wake up
choices.C: A person who liked to protest

questions.explanation: He explained that he was a very heavy sleeper.

questions.text: When he woke up,the train got to______.
questions.explanation: When he woke up,it was night-time and the train was in Paris already.

question_sets.context:
Mr．Jones and Mr．Brown worked in the same office．One day Mr．Jones said to Mr．Brown,"We are going to have a small party at our house next Wednesday evening．Would you and your wife like to come?"
Mr．Brown said,"Thank you very much．That is very kind of you．We are free that evening,I think,but I will telephone my wife and ask her．Perhaps(或许)she wants to go somewhere that evening．"So Mr．Brown went to the other room and telephoned．When he came back,he looked very surprised(吃惊)．
"What's the matter?"said Mr．Jones．"Did you speak to your wife?"
"No,"answered Mr．Brown．"She wasn't there．My little son answered the telephone．I said to him,'Is your mother there,David?'And he answered,'No,she is not in the house．''Where is she then?'I asked．'She is somewhere outside looking for me．'he answered．"

questions.text: Mr．Jones and Mr．Brown were <blank>．
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that they worked in the same office, indicating they were workmates.

questions.text: Mr．Jones would like to <blank>．

choices.A: hold a great party at the office
choices.B: have Mr．Brown and his wife at the party
choices.D: come to the party next Wednesday

questions.explanation: Mr. Jones invited Mr. Brown and his wife to the party, so he would like to have them at the party.

questions.text: Mr．Brown went to telephone his wife because he wanted to <blank>．

choices.B: ask his wife to go to the party
choices.C: find out if his wife had something else to do that evening
choices.D: tell his son to be good at home

questions.explanation: Mr. Brown said he would telephone his wife to ask her if she wanted to go somewhere that evening.

questions.text: Mr．Brown's little son was <blank>．
questions.explanation: The passage implies the son was naughty as the wife went outside looking for him.

question_sets.context:
One day,an old farmer took a bag of rice to town．On the way,the bag of rice fell off the horse．The farmer couldn't lift the bag back onto the horse because it was too heavy．He hoped that someone would come to help him．At this time he saw a man coming towards him．He felt very happy．But when the man came nearer,the farmer saw that he was the most important man in town．He felt very disappointed(失望)．The man came up to him．He took one end of the bag and the farmer took the other．They lifted the bag of rice onto the horse．
"How can I pay you?"the farmer asked．
"Well,if you see anyone in need of help,do the same for him as I have done for you,"the great man answered．

questions.text: The bag of rice fell <blank> the horseback(马背)．
questions.explanation: The correct preposition to indicate falling from a surface is 'from'.

questions.text: The bag of rice was <blank> heavy <blank> the old farmer couldn't lift it back onto the horse．
questions.explanation: The structure 'so...that' indicates a cause-and-effect relationship. The bag was so heavy that the farmer couldn't lift it.

questions.text: The old farmer needed someone <blank> him．
questions.explanation: The correct construction is 'need someone to do something'.

questions.text: He thought the most important man in the town <blank> help him．
questions.explanation: Initially, the farmer felt disappointed because he thought the important man wouldn't help him.

questions.text: The great man <blank> the farmer．
questions.explanation: The passage clearly states that the great man helped the farmer lift the bag of rice.

question_sets.context:
Sam and Mike worked in the same office and they were friendly to each other. They often took their holidays together. Last summer the two young men went to a city by the sea for their holiday. They visited a few places of interest, swam in the sea and than lay on the sands or went out for a walk after supper. They had a good time there.
But one day, when they were swimming, a shark (鲨鱼) swam to Sam and pulled the poor young man to the bottom (海底). Mike heard him calling for help. And swam towards him in a hurry, but it was too late. The shark had_swallowed_Sam. Mike was very sad and returned to his city alone. On the train, he thought hard. Sam' s mother had a heart disease (心脏病) . He didn't know how to tell her about the bad news. At last he found a way. He asked his friend Robert who worked in a hospital to go there with him.
"Bad news for you, Mrs Black," said the young man. "Sam' s swimming suit (游泳衣) was swallowed by a shark.."
"It doesn't matter," said the woman.. "I can buy a new one for him. But where was he at that moment?"
"He was in his swimming suit!"

questions.text: Sam was Mike's <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage indicates that Sam and Mike were friendly to each other, implying they were friends.

questions.text: The two young men went to the city for their holiday because <blank>.

choices.A: they could visit some places of interest
choices.B: he couldn't tell the bad news to Sam's parents
choices.C: the shark had swallowed Sam's swimming suit

questions.explanation: According to the first paragraph, they went to the city to visit places of interest and have a good time.

questions.text: The word "swallow" in the story means <blank>.
questions.explanation: "吞" is the Chinese translation of "swallow".

questions.text: Mike asked Robert to go to see Sam' s mother with him because <blank>.

choices.A: he was afraid the woman when beat him
choices.B: Robert could save the woman when she was in danger (在危险之中)
choices.C: he was afraid to be sent to the police station
choices.D: Robert was strong enough to carry the woman to hospital

questions.explanation: Mike asked Robert to go with him because Robert worked in a hospital and could help if Sam's mother had a heart attack from the bad news.

questions.text: Which of the following is right?

choices.A: Mike didn't want the woman to die of the bad news.
choices.B: Mike wanted the woman to die of the bad news.
choices.C: Mrs Smith wasn't sad at the bad news.
choices.D: Mrs Smith wasn't angry with the young man.

questions.explanation: Mike tried to find a way to tell Mrs. Black about the bad news, implying that he didn't want her to die.

question_sets.context:
Some people have very good memories, and can easily remember long poems(诗歌)by heart. There are other people. They can only remember things when they see or hear them again and again.
The famous English writer, Charles Dickens, said that he could walk down a long street in London and tell you the name of every shop he had passed(经过). Many of the great men like Charles Dickens in the world have great memories.
A good memory is a great help in learning a language. Everybody learns his own language by(通过)remembering what he hears when he is a small child. Some people don't live in their own country, and they seem to learn two languages almost as easily as one. In school it is not so easy to learn a foreign language because students have so little time for it, and they are busy with other lessons, too.
A man's mind is quite like a camera, but it takes photos not only of what we see but also what we feel, hear, smell and taste. When we take a real photo with a camera, there is much to do before the photo is finished and ready to show to our friends. In the same way there is much work to be done before we can keep a picture for ever in our minds. Memory is the diary we all carry with us.

questions.text: Some people are good at <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage starts by stating that some people have good memories, and can easily remember long poems.

questions.text: Others can only remember things <blank>.
questions.explanation: The second sentence of the passage states that some people can only remember things when they see or hear them again and again.

questions.text: Charles Dickens <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Charles Dickens as an example of someone with a great memory.

questions.text: Some people who live in other countries seem to learn <blank>.

choices.A: a language as easily as one
choices.B: two languages as easily as two
choices.C: two languages as easily as one
choices.D: a language as easily as two

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that some people who don't live in their own country seem to learn two languages almost as easily as one.

questions.text: Why is it not so easy to learn a foreign language in school?

choices.D: Because students have little time for it.

questions.explanation: The passage states that it is not so easy to learn a foreign language in school because students have so little time for it.

question_sets.context: Our eating habits are very important for good health and a strong body. There are times when most of us like eating sweets and icecream better than meat and rice. Sweets and icecream are not bad for us if we eat them at the end of a meal. If we eat them before a meal, they may take away our appetite(食欲). It's important for us to eat our meal at regular(规律)time each day. When we feel worry or excited, we may not want to eat. A long time ago, in England, some judges often decided whether a man was telling truth by giving him some dry bread. If the man could not swallow(吞)the bread, it meant that he wasn't telling the truth. Though this seems strange and foolish they thought it was good way of finding out truth. A man who is worrying something has difficulty in swallowing anything dry, because he loses his appetite.

questions.text: Good eating habits make us ________.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that good eating habits are important for good health and a strong body.

questions.text: It's good to eat sweets and ice cream ________.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that sweets and ice cream are not bad if we eat them at the end of a meal.

questions.text: It's good for us to have our meal ________ every day.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that it's important to eat our meals at a regular time each day.

questions.text: The judge in old England thought if a man didn't tell me the truth, he can ________.

choices.B: eat a lot of dry bread

questions.explanation: According to the passage, if a man couldn't swallow the dry bread, it meant he wasn't telling the truth.

questions.text: A person who feels ________ may not want to eat.
questions.explanation: The passage states that when we feel worry or excited, we may not want to eat. Therefore, feeling unhappy can lead to a loss of appetite.

question_sets.context:
The sea looks very beautiful when the sun is shinning on it. It can be very terrible when there's a strong wind.
The sea is very big. The sea is also very deep(深)in some places. There is one place. The sea is about 11 kilometers deep. The highest mountain in the world is about 9 kilometers high. If that mountain was put into the sea at that place, there would be still 2 kilometers of water above it.
In most parts of the sea, there are many kinds of fishes and plants. Some live near the top of the sea. Others live deep down. There are also a lot of small living things, lots of fish live by eating them.
The sea can be very cold. When people go down, the sea becomes colder and colder. But, in 1970, five women scientists live in the deep sea for fourteen days.

questions.text: The sea is very terrible <blank>.

choices.C: when there is a strong wind

questions.text: There is one place. The sea is as deep as <blank> there.
There are a lot of small living things in the sea, and <blank>.

choices.B: they are good food for fish

questions.text: When people go down, the sea becomes colder and colder because <blank>.

choices.C: the temperature(温度)of the deep sea is lower (低的)than that of the top of the sea
choices.D: the temperature of the top of the sea is lower than that of the deep sea

questions.text: in 1970, five women scientists live in the deep sea for fourteen days. This showed <blank>.

choices.A: women liked living in the sea
choices.B: women couldn't go down into the sea
choices.C: women wanted to swim in the sea
choices.D: women could do the same work as a man

questions.text: Tom! Don't play with your toy alone. You must learn to ________.
questions.explanation: The context implies learning to interact with others, which is best represented by 'share'.
questions.test_point: Contextual Vocabulary; Idioms & Phrases; Social Skills

questions.text: There's ________ in the fridge.
questions.explanation: 'Meat' is uncountable, so 'a little' is correct. The others either don't make sense or use the wrong quantifier.
questions.test_point: Countable & Uncountable Nouns; Determiners; Contextual Vocabulary

questions.text: I can even _______ in South China in winter.
questions.explanation: Eating ice cream implies the weather is not very cold, which is possible in South China in winter.
questions.test_point: Contextual Vocabulary; Inference Skills; Logical Progression

questions.text: The child felt happy _______ he could stay at home with his parents.
questions.explanation: 'Because' introduces a clause explaining the reason for the child's happiness.

questions.text: Our teacher always helps __________ our study and life.
questions.explanation: The correct phrase is 'help someone with something'.

questions.text: Miss Gao's ______ sister works in No.1 Middle School.
questions.explanation: 'Elder' is used for family members.

questions.text: Students always have a good time _______ each other.
questions.explanation: 'Have a good time' is followed by a gerund, and 'talking to' is the correct phrase.

questions.text: I like the TV channel with funnier programmes but ________ advertisements.
questions.explanation: 'Advertisements' are countable, so 'fewer' is correct.
questions.test_point: Countable & Uncountable Nouns; Determiners; Contextual Vocabulary

question_sets.context:
Have you ever planted some trees on Tree Planting Day? Every year millions of people , both the old and the young plant a lot of trees. But this may not be the best way to make our home a greener place. Last week we visited a city in Hebei. We were all surprised to see a lot of trees burning near the hills. We Drove there and asked why, the workers there told us that the trees died soon after they were planted. So they burned them and cleaned the place for planting new trees this year. We found a card and it said, "I hope this tree will grow up with me to be the backbone (栋梁) of our country." The workers said that it was important for us to plant more trees, but making them alive was more important.
Some people now have a new idea that they can donate (捐献) some money and let professionals (专业人员) plant and take care of the trees. Because they have more knowledge on planting trees and can do better than us. Do you think so?

questions.text: Which is the best way to make our home a greener place according to the passage?

choices.B: To plant trees and make them alive.

questions.explanation: The last sentence of the first paragraph says that making them alive was more important.

questions.text: What did we find when we went to a city in Hebei?

choices.A: A lot of trees were cut down near the hills.
choices.B: A lot of trees were planted near the hills.
choices.C: A lot of trees were burning near the hills.
choices.D: There were not any trees at all near the hills.

questions.explanation: The second sentence of the first paragraph says that we were all surprised to see a lot of trees burning near the hills.

questions.text: Why did the workers burn the trees?

choices.B: Because there were too many trees.
choices.C: Because they wanted to make room for growing rice.
choices.D: Because they wanted to plant more trees.

questions.explanation: The workers there told us that the trees died soon after they were planted. So they burned them.

questions.text: Why did the workers make a card on the tree?

choices.A: Because the trees is planted by them.
choices.C: Because they want to live under the tree.
choices.D: Because they want to plant trees and make them alive.

questions.explanation: We found a card and it said, "I hope this tree will grow up with me to be the backbone (栋梁) of our country."

questions.text: Which of the following is Right according to the passage?

choices.A: People plant some trees only on Tree Planting Day.
choices.B: The old trees died soon after the young trees were planted.
choices.C: Some people donate some money to ask some workers to plant and take care of the trees.

question_sets.context:
One of Peter's friend loved money very much, and never gave anything to anybody. Soon he became rich.
One day, he was walking near the river with his friends when he slipped (滑倒) and fell in. His friends ran to help him, and one of them_held out_the hand and said, "Give me your hand, and I will pull you out," The rich man's head went under the water and then came up again, but he didn't give his hand. Again another friend tried, but again the same thing happened.
Then Peter said, "Take my hand and I will pull you out!" The rich man took his hand, and Peter pulled him out of the water.
"You don't know our friend very much." He said to the others, "When you say 'give' to him, he does nothing: but when you say 'take', he takes!"

choices.C: he never gave anything to anybody

questions.explanation: From the first sentence, 'One of Peter's friend loved money very much, and never gave anything to anybody. Soon he became rich', we can know the friend became rich because he never gave anything to anybody.

questions.text: <blank> wanted to help him, but they didn't succeed (成功).
questions.explanation: From the text, 'His friends ran to help him, and one of them_held out_the hand and said, "Give me your hand, and I will pull you out,"', so his friends wanted to help him, but they didn't succeed.

questions.explanation: "Held out" means 伸出手 (extend the hand).

choices.B: His friends asked him for money
choices.D: The man didn't want to give anything to anyone.

questions.explanation: The text says 'One of Peter's friend loved money very much, and never gave anything to anybody'.

questions.text: Which do you think is the best title of this short story?
questions.explanation: The story revolves around the man's aversion to 'giving' and willingness to 'take', highlighting the contrast between these actions.

question_sets.context:
It was Jimmy's birthday and he was five years old. He got a lot of nice birthday presents(礼物) from his family, and one of them was a beautiful drum.(鼓 )
" Who gave him that thing?" Jimmy's father asked when he saw it. " His grandfather did," answered Jimmy's mother.
" Oh," said his father. Of course Jimmy liked his drum very much. He made a terrible noise (噪音)with it, but his father didn't mind . He was working during the day and Jimmy was in bed when he got home in the evening , so he couldn't hear the noise.
But one of the neighbors (邻居 ) didn't like the noise at all, so a few days later, she took a sharp (锋利的 ) knife and went to Jimmy's house while he was hitting his drum. She said to him, " Hello, Jimmy, do you know, there is something nice inside your drum? Here is a knife. Open the drum and let's find it."

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that Jimmy got presents from his family.

questions.explanation: Jimmy's mother answered that his grandfather gave him the drum.

choices.D: Jimmy only played in the evening

questions.explanation: The passage states that Jimmy's father didn't mind the noise.

choices.B: enjoyed listening to the sound of the drum
choices.C: wanted to show Jimmy a sharp knife.
choices.D: didn't like the noise at all

questions.explanation: The passage states that one of the neighbors didn't like the noise at all.

questions.text: What did Jimmy's neighbor really want him to do? To ___________.

choices.B: make a noise on his drum with a knife
choices.C: show him how to hit the drum
choices.D: find something nice in his drum

questions.explanation: The neighbor wanted Jimmy to stop making noise with the drum.  The neighbor's words are a trick to get Jimmy to destroy the drum.

question_sets.context:
Thomas Edison
Thomas Edison was a famous American scientist . He was born in 1874 . When he was a child, he liked to find out how things worked . He was in school for only three months . He asked his teacher a lot of strange questions . Most of them had nothing to do with his lessons . The teacher thought the boy was not bright was not worth(值得) teaching . When he told this to Edison's mother, she took her son out of school . As she had been a teacher, she taught him herself .The boy read a lot . Soon he became very interested in science . At the age of ten , Edison had already buit a chemistry lab(化学试验室) for himself .Ever since then , he had never stop searching (寻找) for new and better ways to do things .
