choices.A: Their eyes and hair are yellow.
choices.B: Their eyes and hair are black.
choices.C: Their eyes are black and their hair is yellow.
choices.D: Their eyes are blue and their hair is yellow.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that they all have black eyes and black hair.

questions.text: What's C.N. Yang's nationality?
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly says his nationality isn't Chinese, implying it's American since he's an ABC.

question_sets.context: Mrs Brown lived in a small town near a big farm. One Friday afternoon, after she finished doing housework, she went to her small shop. She opened the window of the shop and looked outside. She liked to see the green farm. There were many cows, horses, and small animals on the farm. Suddenly she saw a kangaroo under her window. It was interesting to see that the kangaroo was wearing an old jacket. It stood there and looked hungry. Mrs Brown gave some bread and water to it. The kangaroo ate them all. Then it became happy and jump away. Suddenly something dropped on the ground, there was $300 and a photo in it. That was a man's photo with his name "John" on it. John? She looked more carefully and remembered she had a brother many years ago. His name was also John. "Is this man my lost brother?" She thought. She took the wallet(皮夹)with her and began to look for the man. She asked many people in the town, and then she came to the farm and asked the farmer. To her great surprise, it was John, her lost brother. They were very excited and happy to see each other.

questions.text: Which is NOT mentioned(提到,涉及) in the story?
questions.explanation: Kangaroos, cows and horses are mentioned in the story. Cook is not mentioned in the story.

questions.text:
Choose the right order according to(根据) the story.
a) They were happy to see each other.
b) Mrs Brown gave bread and water to the kangaroo.
c) She went to her small shop.
d) She went to look for the man.
e) She looked carefully at the photo.
questions.explanation: Following the story's sequence of events.

questions.text: Which is WRONG according to the passage?

choices.A: Mrs Brown lived in a big farm.
choices.B: Mrs Brown found her brother at last.
choices.C: The kangaroo was near the window of the shop.
choices.D: There was a photo and 300 dollars in the wallet.

questions.explanation: The story says Mrs. Brown lived in a small town near a big farm, not on a big farm.

questions.text: Mrs Brown took <blank> to look for her brother.
questions.explanation: Mrs Brown took the wallet with the photo to look for her brother.

questions.text: Why did Mrs Brown lose her brother many years ago?

choices.C: He went out to work and didn't know the way home.
choices.D: His parents didn't have money. So he didn't want them.

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't explain why Mrs. Brown lost her brother. It just states that she lost him many years ago.

question_sets.context: Wearing the wrong type of glasses will do harm to your eyes. This is not true for adults, although incorrect glasses may not be good for children under 10. Ready-made glasses, and not wearing when you should, won't do harm to your eyes, but you may see better with glasses that are specially made for you. Watching too much television is bad for your eyes. This is not true. People with easily affected eyes may find they get red and aching from staring at a fixed distance for long periods, but there won't be any lasting effects. Carrots will help you see in the dark. Carrots are rich in beta-carotene, which the body can change into vitamin A, too little of which can cause night blindness. However, people in most countries don't need to worry about vitamin A deficiency(缺乏),night blindness is more likely to be connected with another vision problem.

questions.text: According to the passage, which of the following is TRUE?

choices.A: Ready-made glasses will do harm to one's eyes.
choices.B: Wearing the wrong glasses may do harm to children's eyes.
choices.C: The human body is unable to change beta-carotene into vitamin A.
choices.D: Watching less television may do harm to children's eyes.

questions.explanation: The passage states that incorrect glasses may not be good for children under 10.

questions.text: Night blindness is most likely caused by _____.
questions.explanation: The passage suggests that night blindness is more likely connected to another vision problem.

questions.text: According to the article, eye problems can be corrected by _______ .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that you may see better with glasses that are specially made for you.

questions.text: Watching too much television can cause _______ .

choices.D: eye trouble for a limited time

questions.explanation: The passage says that watching too much television may cause red and aching eyes for a limited time, but there won't be any lasting effects.

questions.text: The main purpose of this article is to _______ .

choices.A: tell people of the importance of their eyes
choices.B: tell people how to protect their eyes
choices.C: tell people to have more carrots
choices.D: tell people something more about their eyes

questions.explanation: The article discusses common beliefs about eyes and clarifies whether they are true or not, providing more information about eyes.

question_sets.context: Schools and parents in Shenzhen City have been asked to take better care of children's eyesight as 45 percent of them were found to be shortsighted. Too much reading, poor lighting and too much TV are blamed(责备). Of the city's high school graduates(毕业生) who applied to study at colleges this summer, two thirds had to have their choices limited because of poor eyesight. Shenzhen Special Zone Daily said.

questions.text: The purpose of this passage is to_________.

choices.A: criticize(批评) children who are shortsighted.
choices.B: blame parents and schools for children's being shortsighted.
choices.C: ask the high school graduates to pay attention to their eyesight.
choices.D: draw people's special attention to eye hygiene(卫生).

questions.explanation: The passage discusses the problem of shortsightedness in Shenzhen and attributes it to factors related to schools and parents (reading, lighting, TV).

questions.text: Only_______ of the children in Shenzhen City have good eyesight.
questions.explanation: If 45% are shortsighted, then 100% - 45% = 55% have good eyesight.

questions.text: Generally speaking, high school students have______ eyesight than primary school students.
questions.explanation: Although not directly stated, it's implied that high school students, due to more reading and TV, have poorer eyesight.

questions.text: Because of being shortsighted many school graduates_______.

choices.C: couldn't choose to study what they liked best

questions.explanation: The passage states that two thirds had to have their choices limited because of poor eyesight.

questions.text: In order to take care of eyes, children shouldn't_______.
questions.explanation: Too much reading and TV (implying eye strain) are blamed for shortsightedness.

question_sets.context:
Experts(专家) say that students usually need eight to ten hours' sleep at night, but most Chinese students do not get enough sleep. Some Chinese parents are usually glad to see their children studying late. They will think their children work very hard, but not all parents are happy about this. Once a mother told us tat every morning her 10-year-old boy put up one finger (手指)with his eyes still closed, begging(请求) for one more minute to sleep. Like thousands of students " early birds" in China, he has to get up before six every morning.
A report shows that without a good night's sleep, students seem to be weaker (虚弱)than they should be. Many students have fallen asleep during class at one time or another. Too much homework is not the only reason why students stay up late. Some watch TV or play the computer games late into the night.
Experts have ever said that the students should develop good study habits. So some clever students never study last, they are able to work well in class.

questions.text: The 10-year-old boy begged for more minute to sleep because__________

choices.B: it wasn't time for him to get up
choices.C: he didn't want to go to school
choices.D: he wanted his mother to wake him up

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. He begged for more minute to sleep because he didn't have enough sleep.

questions.text: In this passage we know if students don't get enough sleep, they may________
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Students may not work well in class if they don't get enough sleep.

questions.text: In this passage "early birds" means "persons who ______________"
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. "early birds" means "persons who get up early".

questions.text: "Stay up late" here means "_____________"

choices.C: not go to bed until late

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. "Stay up late" means "not go to bed until late".

questions.text: According to the passage, which of the following is right?_________

choices.A: If you want to study better, you must work hard at night.
choices.C: Some clever students are able to work well in class because they have good study habits.
choices.D: Students don't have enough sleep because they have lots of homework to do.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Some clever students are able to work well in class because they have good study habits.

question_sets.context:
Linda bought a book about Europe. Read the contents of the book and answer the questions. Linda买了一本关于欧洲的书,请你读读目录,帮Linda找出下列问题的答案.
ContentsUnit OneThe Countries in Europe……………1Unit TwoThe Weather in Europe……………15Unit ThreeThe Food in Europe……………… 23Unit FourThe Traffic in Europe …………… 40Unit FiveSport in Europe……………………51Unit SixBeautiful Parks in Europe…………58
注:contents内容;目录

questions.text: Linda will take a trip to Europe this summer. She wants to visit many  places, so she needs to study the subway system in Europe. Which unit is the most useful for her?
questions.explanation: Since the subway system is a part of the traffic system, Unit Four (The Traffic in Europe) will be most useful.

questions.text: People all over the world enjoy playing different ball games. For example, the Japanese like to play baseball, and the Americans like to play basketball. Linda wants to know more about the ball games in Europe. Which unit should she read?
questions.explanation: Since Linda wants to know more about ball games, she should read Unit Five (Sport in Europe).

question_sets.context:
When Jack was very young, he played a lot of football, and he was very ___33____ at it. But then he went and worked in a town and there was no ____34_____ for him there, so he stopped _____35____.
Then he began to get rather ____36____, so he thought, " I've stopped playing football, and now I'm getting fat. ___37____ am I going to do ?" He thought about it for ____38____, and then he said to himself," I know, I'll play tennis."
He had a few __39_____, and then played for a few months.
He met a nice girl at the tennis club one day, and they played a game of tennis __40__ another young man and woman. Jack played very badly and was very ___41____ with himself. "I've never played as badly as this before, " he said to the girl.
" Oh," she said, " you have played before, ____42____?"

questions.text: When Jack was very young, he played a lot of football, and he was very ___33____ at it.
questions.explanation: "Well" is the correct adverb to describe how he played.

questions.text: But then he went and worked in a town and there was no ____34_____ for him there, so he stopped _____35____.
questions.explanation: There was no "team" for him in that town.

questions.text: But then he went and worked in a town and there was no ____34_____ for him there, so he stopped _____35____.
questions.explanation: He stopped "playing" football.

questions.text: Then he began to get rather ____36____, so he thought, " I've stopped playing football, and now I'm getting fat.
questions.explanation: He began to get "fat".

questions.text: ___37____ am I going to do ?"
questions.explanation: "What" am I going to do?

questions.text: He thought about it for ____38____, and then he said to himself," I know, I'll play tennis."
questions.explanation: He thought about it for "a few days".

questions.text: He had a few __39_____, and then played for a few months.
questions.explanation: He had a few "lessons".

questions.text: He met a nice girl at the tennis club one day, and they played a game of tennis __40__ another young man and woman.
questions.explanation: They played "against" another young man and woman.

questions.text: Jack played very badly and was very ___41____ with himself.
questions.explanation: He was very "angry" with himself.

questions.text: " Oh," she said, " you have played before, ____42____?"
questions.explanation: The correct tag question is "haven't you".

question_sets.context:
I have a friend. He has a large police dog. The dog's name is Jack. Police dogs are often very clever. Every Sunday afternoon my friend takes Jack for a long walk in the park. Jack likes the long walk very much.
One Sunday afternoon, a young man came to visit my friend. They talked and talked. Soon it was time for my friend to take Jack for his walk. But the visitor was still there. Jack became very worried about his walk in the park. He walked around the room a few times, and then sat down directly (径直地) in front of the visitor and looked at him. But the visitor paid no attention(没注意). He went on talking. Finally Jack could no longer stand it. He went out of the room and a few minutes later he came back with the visitor's hat in the mouth.

choices.A: The writer's friend has a police dog named Jack.
choices.B: The writer's friend's name is Jack.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states 'The dog's name is Jack'.

choices.A: Every Sunday afternoon the writer's friend goes to the park for a walk.
choices.B: Every Sunday afternoon the dog goes to the park for a long walk.
choices.C: Every Sunday afternoon the writer's friend and his dog go to the park for a long walk.

questions.explanation: The passage states 'Every Sunday afternoon my friend takes Jack for a long walk in the park'.

choices.C: The visitor was neither old nor young.

questions.explanation: The passage states 'a young man came to visit my friend'.

choices.A: The visitor paid attention to the dog.
choices.B: The visitor paid a little attention to the dog.
choices.C: The visitor paid no attention to the dog.

questions.explanation: The passage states 'But the visitor paid no attention'.

choices.A: The visitor came back with his hat in his hand.
choices.B: The dog came back with the visitor's hat in his mouth.
choices.C: The writer's friend came back with the visitor's hat in his hand.

questions.explanation: The passage states 'he came back with the visitor's hat in the mouth'.

question_sets.context: Mary went to school when she was six years old. She liked her first day very much. Her, teacher Miss Green, was very nice, and the other children in her class were nice, too. But at the end of the second day. When the other children left the classroom, Mary stayed behind and waited. Miss Green had some work to do and did not see Mary at first, but then she looked up and saw her, "Why didn't you go with the others?" She asked kindly. "did you want to ask me any question?" "Yes, Miss Green." Mary said. "What is it?" Miss Green said. "What did I do in school today?" Mary said. Miss Green laughed. "What did you do in school today?" She said. "Why did you ask me that, Mary?" "Because I'm going home now," Mary answered, "and my mother's going to ask me."

questions.text: How old was Mary when she went to school?
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage says "Mary went to school when she was six years old."

questions.text: Did Mary feel happy at school?
questions.explanation: The second sentence of the passage says "She liked her first day very much."

questions.text: What did Mary do at the end of the second day?

choices.A: She left he classroom with the other children.
choices.B: She kept herself in the classroom to sweep the floor.
choices.D: Mary sat behind the door and cried.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "When the other children left the classroom, Mary stayed behind and waited."

questions.text: Why didn't Miss Green see Mary at first?

choices.B: Because she talked to other teachers.
choices.C: Because she did a lot of work then.
choices.D: Because Mary stood behind the door.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "Miss Green had some work to do and did not see Mary at first".

questions.text: Why did Mary ask her teacher such a question?

choices.B: Because Mary's mother wanted to know it.
choices.C: Because Mary couldn't do the exercises.
choices.D: Because Mary's father wanted to know what she did at school.

questions.explanation: Mary said, "Because I'm going home now, and my mother's going to ask me."

question_sets.context: One day Peter was on the way to town. He wanted to see his uncle and aunt. On the way, he met an old man. The old man wanted to see his wife, she was ill in hospital, but he didn't the way to the hospital. Peter asked a driver, the driver told him to take a No. 4 bus. He took the old man to the hospital. When the old man saw his wife. Peter left the hospital.

questions.text: Where did Peter go one day?
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage is "One day Peter was on the way to town."

questions.text: Who did he meet on the way?
questions.explanation: The second sentence of the passage is "On the way, he met an old man."

questions.text: What's wrong with the old man's wife?
questions.explanation: The passage says "The old man wanted to see his wife, she was ill in hospital".

questions.text: <blank> told Peter the way to the hospital.
questions.explanation: The passage says "Peter asked a driver, the driver told him to take a No. 4 bus".

questions.text: Did the man see his wife at last?
questions.explanation: The passage says "When the old man saw his wife. Peter left the hospital."

question_sets.context: Linda and Betty were both twenty years old. They studied in a medical college (医学院). In June, after a school year was over. They decided (决定) to travel (旅游) in the country. They went to several (= some) towns and villages, and visited some places of interest(旅游胜地). They enjoyed themselves there. One afternoon they were going to stay over night in a small town. It was too hot to go further and they wished they could find a river and swim in the cool water. they were driving the car slowly while (同时) they were walking around. Suddenly Linda saw a lake not far away. They drove there fast and stopped the car by the lake. They looked around and found a man was sitting on a stone(石头) and fishing there. When they took off their clothes and were going to jump into the water, the man came up to them and shouted(大叫), "Sorry, madams, Swimming is forbidden (禁止) in the lake!" "Why didn't tell us about it before we took off our clothes?" Betty said angrily. "But isn't forbidden to take off clothes by the lake," said the man.

questions.text: The story happened(发生) in _______.
questions.explanation: The passage says "In June, after a school year was over. They decided to travel in the country." June is in summer.

questions.text: Linda and Betty went travelling _________.
questions.explanation: The passage says "they were driving the car slowly".

questions.text: As(由于) _____, the two girls drove slowly.

choices.A: something was wrong with their car
choices.B: they were afraid to hit(撞) a tree
choices.C: they were very tired and hungry
choices.D: they wanted to find a river or lake

questions.explanation: The passage says "It was too hot to go further and they wished they could find a river and swim in the cool water. they were driving the car slowly while they were walking around."

questions.text: The two girls stopped by the lake _______.
questions.explanation: The passage says "They drove there fast and stopped the car by the lake". And also says "they took off their clothes and were going to jump into the water".

questions.text: The two girls were angry because _______.

choices.A: the man didn't go away when they were taking off their clothes
choices.B: the man hadn't told them earlier that it was forbidden to swim in the lake
choices.C: the man had fooled(愚弄) them
choices.D: the man had laughed at them

questions.explanation: The passage says ""Why didn't tell us about it before we took off our clothes?" Betty said angrily."

question_sets.context: I felt very sad not to be able to get the ticket for the film "Titanic" last Friday. I learned in the newspaper that tickets could be bought at the cinema box office (售票处) in Richland Hills any day between 10:00 and 4:00. Since I work from 9:00 to 5:30, the only time I could go to the cinema was during my 45-minute lunch time. It is a pity (可惜) that the cinema is on the other side of the town, and the bus service between my office and Richland Hills is not very good. But if you are lucky, you can make the round trip in 45 minutes. Last Monday I stood at the bus stop for fifteen minutes, waiting for a bus. By the time I saw one coming around the corner, there was not enough time left to make the trip―so I had to go back to the office. The same thing happened on Tuesday, and again on Wednesday. On Thursday my luck changed. I got on a bus right away and arrived at the office. I heard one man say he had been waiting in line for over an hour. I found that I would not have enough time to wait in line. I caught the next bus and went back across the town. By Friday I understood my only hope was to make the trip by car. It was expensive, but I felt it would be worth(值得) it to see the film. The trip by car only took 10 minutes, but it felt like an hour to me. When I reached the cinema, I was delighted to see that nobody was waiting in line. But I quickly found that it was because they had already sold the tickets.

questions.text: It seems that the writer of the story works ___________.

choices.C: on a farm near the town

questions.explanation: The passage says "It is a pity that the cinema is on the other side of the town". So the writer works in a small town.

questions.text: He tried to go to the cinema every day but really got there _________.
questions.explanation: He tried to go every day from Monday to Friday. On Thursday, he got on a bus right away and arrived at the office. On Friday, the writer reached the cinema.

questions.text: The word "delighted" in the sentence " I was delighted to see that nobody was waiting in line" many best be replaced (代替) by ____________.
questions.explanation: "delighted" means pleased.

questions.text: Which of the following was true according to (根据) the story?

choices.A: The writer was too busy to have time for a rest during the day.
choices.B: The buses running between his office and Richland Hills were always on time on Thursday.
choices.C: He couldn't buy the tickets any day both before and after work hours.
choices.D: It always took him about twenty minutes to get to the cinema by bus.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the tickets could be bought at the cinema box office in Richland Hills any day between 10:00 and 4:00. The writer works from 9:00 to 5:30.

questions.text: Choose the best title of the story.
questions.explanation: The story is about the writer's failure to get a ticket for the film "Titanic".

question_sets.context:
In Britain, the weather never gets too hot or too cold. There is not a great difference between summer and winter. Why is this?
Britain has a warm winter and a cool summer because it is an island country. In winter the sea is warmer than the land. The winds from the sea bring warm air to Britain. In summer the sea is cooler than the land. The winds from the west blow over Britain all the year. They blow from the southwest across the Atlantic Ocean (大西洋). They are wet winds. They bring rain to Britain all the year, so Britain has a lot of rainy weather. The west of Britain is wetter than the east. The winds must blow across the high land in the west.

questions.text: What's the weather like in Britain?

choices.A: It's not too hot or too cold.
choices.B: It's too hot and too cold.

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that 'the weather never gets too hot or too cold'.

questions.text: When do the winds bring cool air to Britain? In <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that 'In summer the sea is cooler than the land. The winds bring cool air to Britain'.

questions.text: Why is the weather in summer and in winter almost the same? There <blank>.

choices.A: is no difference between summer and winter
choices.B: is sea air around this country
choices.C: are winds from the high land
choices.D: is much rain in the Atlantic Ocean

questions.explanation: The passage explains that Britain has a warm winter and a cool summer because it is an island country, implying the sea air affects the weather.

questions.text: Which of the following is right?

choices.A: There is more rain in the east than in the west.
choices.B: There is as much rain in the west as in the east.
choices.C: There is less rain in the east than in the west.
choices.D: There isn't so much rain in the west as in the east.

questions.explanation: The passage states that 'The west of Britain is wetter than the east', which means there is less rain in the east than in the west.

questions.text: This passage mainly tells us <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage primarily discusses the overall weather conditions in Britain and the factors influencing them.

question_sets.context:
I am doing shopping with my mother. I usually go shopping with my friends or classmates, but it is my birthday and my mother wants to buy me some new clothes as presents. So we go to a shop calledStradivarius. I really like that shop. My mother starts to laugh as soon as we get there. She says, "Almost all the clothes in the window are just like the things I wore when I was young. Those flared trousers (喇叭裤) and very short skirts."
Back in the 1970s every Saturday morning my mother and her friends looked around the shops. Of course they did not always have money to buy the things they wanted. But they could decorate (装饰) their old jeans to make them look new. My grandmother was very good at sewing (缝补) and she helped my mother sew coloured patches (小块的布) onto her old jeans.
My mother says she really likes these styles and so do I.

questions.text: <blank>, so I go shopping with her.

choices.A: I want to buy myself some new clothes
choices.B: I want to buy my mother some presents
choices.C: My mother wants to buy some new clothes
choices.D: My mother wants to buy me some new clothes for my birthday

questions.explanation: According to the first paragraph, the mother wants to buy new clothes for the speaker's birthday.

questions.text: Why does my mother laugh as soon as she sees the clothes in the window?

choices.A: She thinks the clothes in the window are all strange and old.
choices.B: The clothes look quite different from those she wore when she was young.
choices.C: She is very happy to see that there are so many kinds of clothes.
choices.D: They are nearly the same as the clothes she wore when she was young.

questions.explanation: The mother laughs because the clothes in the window remind her of what she wore when she was young.

questions.text: Could my mother always buy the clothes she wanted when she was young?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the mother and her friends didn't always have money to buy what they wanted.

questions.text: My grandmother helped my mother decorate her clothes by <blank>.
questions.explanation: The grandmother helped by sewing colored patches onto the old jeans.

questions.text: In a word, both my mother and I <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage concludes that both the mother and the speaker like the described styles.

question_sets.context:
Visitors to London eat in restaurants. The owners and workers in them are all from other countries. The visitors say in these restaurants they don't feel they are in England. Most of the English people eat at home as much as they can. A young man who goes out of a restaurant may find that he doesn't understand why everything is written in French and Italian (意大利语)
Most of the English people think it is better to eat at home, for (因为) it is cheaper. They don't want to spend (花费) much money on food and they are interested in (对……感兴趣)cooking. They like quick meals which won't take time. But for Christmas, they will spend two or three weeks_in order to_(为了)have good food.

questions.text: Visitors to London often eat in restaurants for ____________.

choices.A: they don't like the food at home
choices.B: their homes are not in London.
choices.C: they like the food in London.

questions.explanation: Visitors don't have a home in London, so choose B.

questions.text: When the English people eat in restaurants, they sometimes think ____________.
questions.explanation: The first paragraph indicates the answer is A.

questions.text: Some of the people don't know ___________.

choices.C: why people write everything in French or Italian
choices.D: why everything comes from French and Italian

questions.explanation: The first paragraph indicates the answer is C.

questions.text: The English people eat at home ________.

choices.B: because the food is much dear at home
choices.C: for it is sometimes very cheap
choices.D: because the food is very cheap at home

questions.explanation: The second paragraph tells that they eat at home because it's cheaper.

questions.text: ______ they spend much time for Christmas.

choices.A: In order to get more food
choices.B: In order to have much food
choices.C: In order to get good food
choices.D: In order to have enough food

questions.explanation: The last sentence says they spend two or three weeks in order to have good food

question_sets.context: Plants (植物) grow well in spring and summer because the weather is warm with a lot of rain. When autumn comes, the weather becomes cool and dry. Plants grow slowly in autumn. Some plants even die (死) before winter comes. But some plants still live in winter. In autumn their leaves (叶子) turn yellow and fall off (落下). So they can lose less water through (通过) the leaves. When spring comes, new leaves will grow out.

questions.text: We have more rain in _________.
questions.explanation: The first sentence mentions that plants grow well in spring and summer because the weather is warm with a lot of rain

questions.text: Plants grow well because ___________.

choices.A: the weather is too hot in summer
choices.B: the weather is too cold in winter
choices.C: there is enough rain in summer
choices.D: there is enough rain and the weather is warm in spring and summer

questions.explanation: The first sentence mentions that plants grow well in spring and summer because the weather is warm with a lot of rain

questions.text: In winter ___________.

choices.C: some plants will die and some will still live

questions.explanation: The text says some plants even die before winter comes. But some plants still live in winter.

questions.text: In autumn their leaves turn yellow and fall off because they want to ________.
questions.explanation: The sentence says "So they can lose less water through (通过) the leaves."

questions.text: Which season is the best one for plants to grow? ___________
questions.explanation: The text says "Plants (植物) grow well in spring and summer because the weather is warm with a lot of rain."

question_sets.context:
Do you know Helmut Newton and John Pilger? Do you want to learn more about their paintings? Come to Barbican Gallery!
Open: Mon, Thur-Sat 10am-6pm (Helmut Newton); Tue, Wed, Sun 10am-9pm (John Pilger)
Tickets: Adult $7 Students, young people 12-17, over 60s $5; Under 12 free;
Group Bookings: Call at 020-; Adult groups of 10 or more $6 each Student groups of 10 or more $2 each

questions.text: You can go to Barbican Gallery to see the paintings at __________ on Friday.

question_sets.context:
Mr Jackson worked in an office, and he did a lot of important and hard work. But then he began to forget things, and this made his work very hard. One day he said to himself, " I am going to see Dr Martin about this."
He waited in the doctor's waiting-room with the other patients(病人), and then the nurse said to him, "you can go in and see Dr Martin now."
Mr Jackson hurried into Dr Martin's office, and the doctor said, " Please sit down, Mr Jackson. What can I do for you?"
" Oh, doctor." Said Mr Jackson. "it is terrible. I can't remember anything for longer than half a minute, and it is making my work very hard. What can I do? Can you help?"
The doctor said, "When did this start, Mr Jackson?"
" When did what start? " Mr Jackson asked.

question_sets.context:
Mr Reece works on a farm. He and his wife grow a lot of plants and they have some sheep.
Every day they have to work hard from morning to night. One day, Mr Reece says
to his wife, "Let's go to Portsmouth next Sunday. We can have a good lunch there and
then we can go to see a film."
His wife is very happy when she hears this, because they always eat a lot, and she
doesn't like cooking three times a day.
They go to Portsmouth by train and walk for about an hour. At 12:00, they want to
have lunch. Before a restaurant they see a notice(告示). It says, "Lunch: 12:30 to 2:30,
1.5dollars."
"Well, that's good," Mrs Reece says. " We can eat for two hours for 1.5dollars here!
This is the place for us."

questions.explanation: Mrs Reece misunderstood the notice. She thought they can eat for two hours for 1.5 dollars. But the notice means the lunch time is from 12:30 to 2:30, and the price is 1.5 dollars.

question_sets.context: The best way of learning a language(语言) is using it. The best way of learning English is talking in English as much as possible. Sometimes you'll get your words mixed up(混合) and people will not understand you. Sometimes people will say things too quickly and you can't understand them. But if you keep your sense of humor(幽默), you can always have a good laughing at your mistakes you make. Don't be unhappy if people seem to be laughing at your mistakes .It's better for people to laugh at your mistakes than to be angry with you, because they don't understand what you are saying. The most important thing for learning English is: "Don't be afraid of making mistakes because everyone makes mistakes."

question_sets.context:
34 Block A, 15th floor,
Blake Street, 18
Singapore
February 15th, 2003
Dear Sir,
I must write through your column (栏目) to thank the gentleman who very kindly helped me and my family a few days ago. It was raining heavily at that time and my car broke down along a lonely stretch (一段路程) outside the city. It was also very dark. I tried to mend the car myself but couldn't find out what was wrong with the engine (发动机). By then I was completely (完全地) wet. Just then a young man stopped his car to help me.
He drove my family home first and later he came back with a mechanic (机修工). He did not leave until the mechanic started my car and I was on my way home again.
Thank you, young man, whoever (无论谁) and wherever (无论在哪里) you are.
Yours faithfully
Chan Honghai

The sun is much bigger than the moon. But sometimes the moon looks bigger than the sun because it's much nearer to the earth. The sun is very bright. It gives a very strong light. The moon looks quite bright, too. But it doesn't give any light at all.
The moon looks much bigger and brighter than the stars. But actually the stars are a lot bigger and brighter than the moon. They look smaller than the moon because they are much farther away from us.

question_sets.context:
A small boy and his father were having a walk in the country when it began to rain. They did not have raincoats or umbrellas with them and there was not any place to hide(躲藏) from the rain, so they had to walk home. Soon they were all wet.
On their way home, the boy asked his father, "Dad, why does it rain? It isn't very nice, is it?"
"No, it isn't very nice , but it's useful ," answered the father, "It rains to make the flowers and vegetables grow for us, and to make the grass grow for the sheep."
The boy thought about this for a moment, then he said, "Then why does it rain on the road too, father?"

question_sets.context:
It was one of the thickest fogs(雾) in years. I couldn't nearly see my hands in front of my face. Cars and buses ran very slowly with their lights on, and their horns(喇叭) made a terrible noise. When evening fell, it got even worse. All traffic came to a stop. Since(由于) I had a very important meeting on the other side of the town, I decided(决定) to walk.
Minutes later I couldn't find my way. Then I heard a young woman's voice  coming out of the fog, "Can I help you?" I couldn't see her, but I was very glad to hear her. I said to her where I wanted to go, and she knew very well how to get there.
As I went after her through the dark streets, I wanted to know how she found her way so easily. "I know this part of the town quite well," she answered. "but in such a fog it is difficult to see anything," I said. "With the fog or without the fog, it is the same to me. You see, I'm blind."

questions.explanation: Blind means 'not able to see'.

Tom was from Canada and he had come to New York for a holiday. One day he was not feeling well, so he asked a man of his hotel to find a doctor. The man said, "Thomas Brown is a good doctor." Tom said, "Thank you very much. Is he expensive?" "Well" the man answered, "he always asks his patients(病人)for two dollars if they are first visit. One dollar if they are later visit." Tom decided to save one dollar, so when he went to see the doctor, he said, "I've come again, doctor." For a few minutes the doctor looked at his face carefully without saying anything. Then he said, "Everything's going as it should do. Oh, I gave you medicine last time, didn't I? Just go on with it."

We each have a memory. That's why we can still remember things after a long time. Some people have very good memories and they can easily learn many things by heart, but some people can only remember things when they say or do the again and again. Many of the great men of the world have got surprising memories.
A good memory is a great help in learning languages. Everybody learns his mother language when he is a small child. He hears the sounds, remembers them and then he learns to speak. Some children are living with their parents in foreign countries. They can learn two languages as easily as one because they hear remember and speak two languages every day. In school it is not so easy to learn a foreign language because the pupils have so little time for it, and they are busy with other subjects, too.
But your memory will become better and better when you do more and more exercises.

Once there lived an old man. He liked gold better than anything else in the world. He often said, "If I have enough gold, I shall be the happiest man in the world."
One day when he was traveling in the desert(沙漠), the old man lost his way. He was very hungry and thirsty, but there were only rocks and sand around him. Just then, he found a bag lying on the sand. He hoped he would find water and food in it. He took up the bag and opened it. He saw that the bag was full of gold. He was so sad that he threw away the bag and began crying.
Now, the old man knew that there was something better than gold in the world.

question_sets.context:
Newspapers are very important in our daily life. Many people begin their day by reading the paper. In this way they learn what is going on in the world. Sometimes, however, they don't have the time to read the news carefully and must be pleased with a quick look at the front page. At other times they may be in such a hurry that they have time only to have a quick look at the headlines(标题).
There are newspapers to please every reader. In big cities there are many types with several different editions every day. In small towns there are fewer newspapers and perhaps only one edition each day. In some places the paper is printed(印刷) weekly.
Most papers have several editions, especially on Sunday when the edition is larger than usual. There are, besides(除了) the front page with the most important news, the sports news, the amusements(娱乐) page, a business page, and so on.

question_sets.context: I am sitting on the school bus. It is ten past seven in the morning. Today is Thursday. I will show my Social Studies(社会研究) homework to the class. I will stand in front of the class and give a talk about Michigan, a state (州) in the US. It took me one  week to do my homework. Will it go well? I am not good at Social Studies. Last year, I did badly in this class. Now I am very nervous . I want to be the first to speak. If I go first, no one will think my work is bad. But I don't put up my hand. Lauren puts up hers. She goes first. I quickly put up my hand to be second. Lauren has a nice voice and is good at talking. She talks for five minutes about Louisiana. Then it's me. I walk to the front of the classroom and begin my talk. I first show them a picture of Michigan's flag (旗子). Then, I tell them about interesting things in Michigan. I talk about a huge wheel (车轮) and tyre (轮胎) near the I-94 highway. I also tell them about holidays in Michigan, like the Apple Festival. At the end of my talk, the class claps (鼓掌) loudly. "I was not so bad,'" I think. I'm glad I put up my hand early. There are 20 other students after me, but nobody gets claps so loud!

questions.explanation: The passage indicates he wanted to be first to speak, but he did not put up his hand initially; Lauren did, which suggests he was not brave enough initially.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates the boy feels "not so bad" and is "glad", implying he is happy at the end.

question_sets.context: If someone asks you, "What color is the sky?" I think the answer will be "blue". I'm afraid that you are wrong. Because the sky has no color. What's in the sky? Is the sky full of air? I'm sure that you have asked these questions. We all know that there's air all around the world. We can not live without air. Planes can't fly very high because as they go higher, the air gets thinner. If we go far enough away from the earth, we can find that there is no air. The sky is space. In this space there is nothing but sun, the moon and the stars. People always want to know more about other worlds in space. They have looked at them through telescopes (望远镜) and in this way they have known much. They know a lot about the moon now. But they want to know more about space. I'm sure they will go farther and farther until they know all about it.

For most people , the word "fashion" means "clothes". But people may ask the question, "What clothes are in fashion?" And they use the adjective "fashionable" in the same way: "She was wearing a fashionable coat." "His shirt was really a fashionable colour."
But of course there are fashions in many things, not only in clothes.There are fashions in holidays, in restaurants, in films and books. There are even fashions in school subjects, jobs… and in languages.
Fashions changes as time goes. If you look at pictures of people or things from the past, you will see that fashions have always changed. An English house of 1750 was different from the one of 1650. A fashionable man in 1780 looked very different from his grandson in 1860.
Today fashions change very quickly. Some of this is natural. We hear about things much more quickly than in the past . Newspapers, radios, telephones and television send information from one country to another in a few hours.
New fashions mean that people will buy new things, so you see there is money in fashion.

question_sets.context: Last Sunday I saw the worst storm in years. It came suddenly and went on for more than three hours. After lunch, I went into my room to have a rest. The air was hot, and all was quiet. The strong wind started blowing into my room. Pieces of paper on my desk flew high into the air and some flew out of the open window. As I ran out to catch them, big drops of rain began to fall. When I came back into the house, it was raining harder and harder. I tried very hard to close the window. Then I heard a loud crashing(碰撞的) sound from the back of the house. I ran out of my room to find out what it was―a big tree had fallen down and broke the top of the back room.

question_sets.context:
There is a one-day holiday in most countries on New Year's Day. The real celebrations for New Year happen on the night before �C on New Year's Eve. There are several interesting customs in the West, and there are many differences from country to country.
Though Christmas is a family get-together, New Year for some is a time to be with friends too. Parties are most often held to welcome the New Year. At these parties, there is food and drink and dancing until the time nears for the coming of New Year.
At midnight, people often say "Happy New Year" to each other. Champagne(香槟酒)  is a favorite drink at New year's. In many western countries fireworks(烟火) are let off at midnight, and many people like to make noise, possibly to drive away bad spirits(幽灵).
One important song is often sung at New Year's --- the Scottish song of Auld Lang Syne( good times long ago).

question_sets.context:
In a map of the world you can easily find two big cities, London and New Work. London is the oldest city in Britain. It's certainly the biggest city in Europe(欧洲).New York is as big as London, if not bigger. The streets in London are crowded and there is one of the world's biggest underground railway systems(地铁系统). The streets in New York are just as crowded as in London. And the New York subway carries more people each day than the London underground. There are a lot of big stores in these two cities. But New York has more supermarkets than London.
In London there are many palaces (宫殿)and churches, for example , St.Paul's. New York isn't as old as London, and it hasn't many old
buildings. But skyscrapers(摩天大楼) are much bigger than the buildings in London.
London has more parks than New York .But New York's Central Park is much bigger than the biggest park in London.

question_sets.context:
Can we live without salt ? Salt is very important to us . We need salt in our food . Animals need it , too. Most of the salt in our country comes from the sea. People dig very big pools(池塘) and let sea water in . When the sun dries(弄干) up the water , people can get salt from the ground . The salt is white, clean and beautiful .
There are a lot of salt wells(井) in Sichuan . A salt well is much like a water well . People bring the well water up to the ground and then dry it in big jars(坛子) over fire . In this way they get salt . We can also get salt from salt mines(矿) . A salt mine may be found under the ground . Some years ago, people in Jiangxi found a big salt mine and soon opened it . People here need salt from other places no more .
In the northwest of our country , there are many salt lakes. Some of these lakes are very big . The salt in a big lake will be enough for our people for centuries .

question_sets.context:
Mr. Jones and Mr. Brown worked in the same office . One day Mr. Jones said to Mr. Brown ,"We are going to have a small party at our house next Wednesday evening . Would you and your wife like to join us?"
Mr. Brown said, "Thank you very much. That is very kind of you . We are free that evening. I think, but I will telephone my wife and ask her. Maybe she wants to go somewhere else that evening." So Mr. Brown went to the other room and telephoned. When he came back, he looked very sorry.
"What is the matter?" said Mr. Jones. "Did you speak to your wife?"
"No," answered Mr. Brown, "She wasn't there, my small son answered the telephone. I said to him, 'Is your mother there, David?' and he answered, 'No, she is not in the house,' 'Where is she then? 'I asked. 'She is somewhere outside.' 'What is she doing?' 'She is looking for me.'"

question_sets.context:
Do you know how to play a game called "Musical Chairs"? It is easy to play and most people enjoy it. All you need are some chairs, some people and some ways of making music. You may use a piano or any other musical instrument(乐器), if someone can play it. You may use a tape-recorder. You can even use a radio.
Put the chairs in a row. The chairs may be put in two rows, back to back. A better way is to have the chairs in one row with each chair facing in the opposite direction(方向) to the chair next to it.
The game is easy. When the music starts, the players walk round the chairs. Every one goes in the same direction, of course. They should walk in time to the music. If the music is fast they should walk quickly. If the music is slow, they should walk slowly.
The person playing music cannot see the people in the game. When the music stops, the players try to sit on chairs. If he has no chair to sit on, he drops out. Then, before the music starts again, one chair must be taken away. When the music stops again, one more player will be out.
At last, there will be two players and one chair! The one who sits on the chair when the music stops is the winner.

questions.explanation: You need one less chair than the number of players to start the game.

choices.C: The winner can sit on the chair.
choices.D: If the person plays music, he cannot be the winner.

questions.explanation: The last one to sit is the winner.

question_sets.context:
Johnny Smith was a good maths student at a high school. He loved his computer. He came home early every day, then he worked with in till midnight. But Johnny was not a good English student, not good at all. He got an "E"in his English class. One day after school, Johnny joined his computer to the computer in his high school office. The school office computer had the grades(成绩)of all the students: the maths grades, the science grades, the grades in arts and music, and the grades in English. He found his English grade An E! Johnny changed it from E to an A. Johnny's parents looked at his school reporter card.. They were very happy of course.
"An A in English!" said Father. "You are a very clever boy, Johnny."
Johnny is a hacker(网上黑客). Hackers know how to take information from other computers and put new information in. Using a modem(调制解调器), they join their computers to other ones secretly(秘密地). School headmasters and teachers are worried about hackers. So are the police, for some people even take money from bank computer accounts(账户)and pout it into their own(自己的) ones. And they never have to leave home to do it! They are called hackers.

question_sets.context: A poor peasant went into a restaurant in London for some coffee and a cake. When he received the check, he was very surprised. "What's this?" he asked the waiter. "Ten pounds for coffee and a cake? There must be something wrong." "No," answered the waiter. "Just for coffee and a cake? There are some other things in it," explained the waiter. "For instance, do you see these works of art on the wall? And all the plates and bowls are the finest in the world. These desks and chairs are the most beautiful and nicest all over the country. In short, you are paying not just for what you ate, but for all these things around you." The peasant paid the check slowly. "Now let me have another cup of coffee and a cake," he told the waiter. "And remember the other things I've paid for."

One Sunday afternoon, a young man came to visit my friend. They talked and talked. Soon it was time for my friend to take Jack for his walk. But the visitor was still there. Jack became very worried about his walk in the park. He walked around the room a few times, and then sat down directly (径直地) in front of the visitor and looked at him. But the visitor paid no attention(没注意). He went on talking. Finally Jack could no longer stand it. He went out of the room and a few minutes later he came back with the visitor's hat in the mouth.

question_sets.context:
Leopards ( 豹 ) live in many parts of the world , from Siberia to Africa .They have a very beautiful yellow skin with large black spots. They live for about 15 years and eat small mammals (哺乳动物) such as zebras, monkeys, and antelopes ( 羚羊) .They sleep for about 12 hours a day . Leopards are very solitary(独居的)animals. They spend most of their time alone in trees , where they wait until a small animal passes . they jump on the animal and then drag it up into the tree, where they eat it.
Like many animals ,leopards are disappearing because people hunt them. They kill them for their beautiful coats. The Sinai leopard , for example , from Egypt, is now probably extinct(绝种的).

question_sets.context:
Dick was seven years old, and Kate was two years younger than her brother. One day their mother took them to their aunt's house and left them to play there while she went to the big city to buy some new clothes.
The children played in the garden for an hour, and then at half past four their aunt took Dick into the kitchen. She gave him a nice cake and said to him, "Now here's a knife, Dick. Cut this cake in half and give one piece to your sister, but remember to do it like a gentleman."
"Like a gentleman?" Dick asked," How do gentlemen do it?"
"They always give the bigger one to the other person." Answered his aunt at once.
"Oh" , said Dick,. He thought about this for a few seconds. Then he took the cake to his sister and said to her," Cut the cake in half, Kate."

questions.explanation: The passage states Dick was seven and Kate was two years younger, so Kate was five.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

questions.explanation: The passage mentions the aunt took Dick to the kitchen at half past four, implying they arrived earlier.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states the mother went to the city to buy clothes.

choices.C: he wanted to get the bigger piece of the cake.

questions.explanation: Dick asked Kate to cut the cake so that he could get the bigger piece, cleverly avoiding cutting it himself and having to give the bigger piece away.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Character Analysis

question_sets.context:
Ben: Leo, you work too hard. Let's go and sit in the park.
Leo: I can't do_that_. I have to study for my English test next week.
Ben: But, Leo… You already know that you're going to Tsinghua University! Well, what are you going to major in?
Leo: English and management. How about you? Which school are you going to next year, Ben?
Ben: Oh, I'm going to work for my dad for a year. Then I'll go to college after_that_.
Leo: What do you want to study?
Ben: I'm not sure yet. I'd' like to study Chinese. So, do you want to be an English teacher or work for a big company after 4 years in Tsinghua University?
Leo: In fact, I hope to go on to study computer science in Beijing University.
Ben: Wow. We are quite different! You know, I just want to find an easy job. I guess you will be a computer programmer.
Leo: Uh-huh. I'd like to.
Ben: Well, I hope to work as a teacher and have a nice family in the future.
Leo: Really? I want to make a lot of money.

Most American children begin to go to school when they are five years old. Most students are seventeen or eighteen years old when they finish high school.
High school students take only four or five subjects(科目) each term. They usually go to the same class every day, and they have homework for every class. After class they do many interesting things. After high school, many students go to college. They can go to a small one or a large one. They usually have to give a lot of money. So many college students work after class to get the money for their studies.

question_sets.context:
Today almost everyone knows computers and the Internet. If I ask you "What is the most important in your life?" maybe you will say "Computers and the Internet."
The first computer was made in 1946. it was very big but it worked slowly. Today computers are getting smaller and smaller. But they work faster and faster. What can computers do? A writer has said, "People can't live without computers today."
The Internet came a little later than computers. It is about twenty-five years later than computers. But now it can be found almost everywhere. We can use it to read books, writer letters, do shopping, play computer games or make friends.
Many students like the Internet very much. They often go into the Internet as soon as they are free. They make friends on the Internet and maybe they have never seen these friends. They don't know their real names, ages, and even sex. They are so interested in making the "unreal friends" that they can't put their hearts into study. Many of them can't catch up with others on many subjects because of that.
We can use computers and the Internet to learn more about the world. But at the same time, we should remember that not all the things can be done by computers and the Internet.

question_sets.context:
Until a few years ago, only boys could become students at the university of Ruritania (鲁里坦尼亚大学). Later the university decided to take girls in. But one of the teachers, Mr Goller, was not pleased at all. He had not wanted to let girl students in.
Mr Goller always began his lessons with the word "Gentlemen!" What could he do now? Well, when the girl students came to his lessons for the first time, he still began with the word. For him the girls were just not there. Then one day there was only one boy in his class among a lot of girls. For a moment, Mr Goller didn't know what to do. Then he began, "Sir! "
Finally a terrible day came when there were no boys in his class He came into the room, looked at the girls and said, "Oh, nobody's here today!" he turned and went out without giving his lessons.

question_sets.context:
Old John went to see a doctor. The doctor examined and said, "Medicine can't help you. You must have a good rest. Go to a quiet place for a month, go to bed early, drink some milk, walk a lot and smoke one cigar a day."
"Thank you very much," said old John. "I will do everything you said."
A month later old John came to the doctor again. "Well," said the doctor, "I'm glad to see you. You look much younger."
"Oh, doctor," said old John, "I feel quite well now. I had a good rest. I went to bed early, I drank a lot of milk, and I walked a lot. Your advice certainly helped me. But you asked me to smoke one cigar a day, and the one cigar a day nearly killed me at first. It's no joke to start smoking at my age.

question_sets.context: One day, an old lady(夫人) wanted to go to London to see her son. She got up early and reached the small station at nine o'clock in the morning. Because this was her first trip to London, she was very worried. Just at that moment, she saw a little boy running to her, she stopped him and asked him what time the train comes here and the train leaves for London. The boy looked at the woman and said, "Tu: tu: tu: tu: tu",just like firing a gun(开枪).Then he ran away. The old woman was very surprised and got angry. She wanted to know why the boy played a joke on her( 和她开玩笑 ). She sat in a chair and though, and then she began to smile(微笑). She couldn't help crying( 忍不住叫出来). "What a clever boy! He told me the time in such a way." Do you know the time?

question_sets.context: Joe: What do you do on weekends? David: Well, I usually have to study on Saturdays. Joe: And how about Sundays? David: Well, we have lunch together. After that I usually go to see a film outside the city. Joe: Do you often go out of the city? David: About once a month. My uncle has a small farm. Joe: It's nice. Do you go alone? David: No, my mum, my two sisters and some of my friends go there, too. Joe: But why do you go there? David: Many things: green trees, clean air, and there are few people.

question_sets.context: There was a pilot and three people in a small plane. Suddenly there was something wrong with the plane when it was flying in the air. The smoke was everywhere in the plane. I know I am going to win the game because I am going to be the cleverest person there. "He picked up a pack and jumped out. Two men were left, an old businessman and a young mountain climber. question_sets.context: 1. In the summer of 1963,Clinton won a drama contest, so he went to visit the city of Washington. 2. Clinton was born in a poor family in 1946. S. president. He is the first U.S. president Who was born after World War Ⅱ , and he is very ambitious(有雄心的 ). 5. When he was young, his mother got married again. Among all the greatest people in the world, Ⅰ like Edison most. He was so creative that he had 1,093 inventions in his life. He was born in 1847 and died in 1931. The most famous of his inventions was a light bulb. Besides the light bulb, Edison developed the phonograph and the" kinetoscope ,"a small box for seeing moving films. He also improved the design of the telephone. He believed in hard work. Sometimes he worked twenty hours a day. The name of Helen Keller is known around the world as a woman of great intelligence ,high ambition and hard working. She spent her life helping others. Born in Tuscumbia, Alabama, in 1880, Helen Keller had a fever that made her blind and deaf at the age of 19 months. When she was seven years old, Anne Mansfield Sullivan became her teacher. Helen Keller quickly learned to read and write. By Helen Keller the age of 10 she began to speak. At the age of 20 she entered Radcliffe College, with Miss Sullivan at her side to spell textbooks letter by letter into her hand. Four years later Helen Keller graduated, and she began her life's work of helping blind and deaf-blind people. She traveled around the world and wrote many books and articles. She met every U. S. president from Grover Cleveland to Lyndon Johnson and played a major role in helping the blind.

question_sets.context: As teenagers, you have many dreams. These dreams can be very big, such as winning the Nobel Prize ,or they can be small. You may just want to become one of the ten best students in your class. Once you find a dream, what do you do with it? Do you ever try To make your dream real? "Follow Your Heart" by Australian writer Andrews tells us that making our dreams real is life's biggest challenge. You may think you're not very good at some school subjects, or that .it is impossible for you to become a writer. These kinds of thoughts stop you from getting your dream, the book says. In fact, everyone can make his dream come true. The first thing you must do is to remember what your dream is. Don't let it leave your heart. Keep telling yourself what you want. Do this step by step and your dream will come true faster because a big dream is, in fact, many small dreams. You must also never give up your dream. There will be difficulties on the road to your dreams. But the biggest difficulty comes from yourself. You need to decide what is the most important. Studying instead of watching TV will lead to better exam results, while saving five yuan instead of buying an ice cream means you can buy a new book. As you get closer to your dream, it may change a little. This is good as you have the chance to learn more skills and find new interests.

questions.text: "Follow Your Heart" is <blank>.

choices.A: The first thing you must do to make your dream real
choices.B: The most important dream to have for teenagers

question_sets.context: More than 2000 years ago at Marathon, the Greeks won a victory. Marathon was a small town. It was about 40 kilometres from Athens-the capital or the country. P h e I dip p ides was the man who took messages from one place to another. He had to tell the people there about the great victory. P h e I dip p ides ran to Athens with the news. He ran as fast as he could so that the people in Athens could learn the good news soon. The run was long. But he kept running. He reached Athens at last and told the people there the good news. But P h e I dip p ides was so tired after the run that he fell on the ground and died. In 1896 the first of the Olympic Games were held in Athens. Today the marathon is the game that is liked by both the old and the young in many cities all over the world.

question_sets.context:
In the world today ,all of the people need recreation.(消遣).We cannot work all the time if we are going to keep healthy and enjoy life.
Everyone has his own way of relaxing .Perhaps the most popular form (形式) is to take part in sports. There are team sports, such as basketball and football. There are also individual(个人的) sports.such as swimming and running. Skating and mountain climbing are the most popular recreation for people who like to be outdoor.
Not everyone who enjoys sports likes to takes part in them. Many people like watching them on TV or listening to them on the radio. So many people like some forms of indoor recreation, such as watching TV, singing and dancing .
It doesn't matter whether we like indoor recreation or take part in outdoor sports, It is important for everyone to relax from time to time, and enjoy some forms of recreation.

questions.explanation: the most popular form is to take part in sports

choices.D: indoor recreation is not as important as outdoor sports.

question_sets.context:
It was late on a snowing night. Doctor Van was driving fast to the hospital to do an operation(手术) on a badly hurt person. Minutes later he came to a red traffic light and had to stop to wait. A man suddenly opened the door of the car and got in.
"Drive on, " shouted the man, "Just do what I've told you to. " The man was strong and tall while Doctor Van was not.
"But I'm a doctor, " Van tried to tell him what he was going to do. "I'm on my way to the hospital to save(救). " "Stop talking and drive faster, as fast as you can! " the man stopped Van and Van had to do so.
Only a few minutes had passed when the man made Van stop his car again and drove him off, and he himself drove away very quickly.
Van stood in the snow for a moment and then walked around to look for a taxi. Another half an hour passed when Van got out of the taxi and ran into the hospital. But it was too late and he could do nothing.
The man who took Van's car was standing by the person all the time. He was so sad! Only then did Van know that the man was the father of that badly hurt person!

questions.text: Who needed an operation at once?
questions.explanation: The last sentence says that the man was the father of that badly hurt person, who needed an operation

questions.text: Why did the man take Van's car?

choices.A: Because he was a doctor and had to get to the hospital as soon as possible.
choices.B: Because he wanted to use the car to see a friend who was badly in hospital and needed his help.
choices.C: Because he wanted to get to the hospital earlier than the doctor.
choices.D: Because he was worried about his son and could not wait to see him.

questions.explanation: The man was worried about his son and could not wait. Although he didn't know how to drive, he just wants to arrive earlier.

questions.text: How long did it take Van to get to the hospital that night?

choices.D: We can't tell just from this passage.

questions.explanation: It took a few minutes for the man to drive the car away. It also took another half an hour to take a taxi. So the total time is more than one hour.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true?

choices.B: Doctor Van was stronger than the man.
choices.D: The weather was not fine that night.

questions.explanation: It mentions that the man was strong and tall while Doctor Van was not. "The man lost his son" is true. "The weather was not fine that night" is true because it was snowing.

questions.text: Which of the following can be the best title (标题) for this passage?

choices.B: A Good Doctor Met a Bad Man.
choices.D: How to save a Badly Hurt person.

questions.explanation: The man was too worried to be helpful. The man's actions delayed the doctor and was not helpful at all.

question_sets.context: George Stephenson was born in 1781 in a poor family. He had to start work when he was only eight. When George was fourteen, he became his father's helper. He spent a lot of time learning about engines(发动机). And on holidays he often took one to pieces and studied each piece carefully. Soon he became a very good worker though he could not read or write. He began to learn the English letters when he was seventeen years old. Every day after he did twelve hours of hard work, he walked a long way to have lessons from a young school teacher. On his eighteen birthday, he wrote his own name for the first time in his life. George invented(发明) many things in his life. The train was the greatest one among them. Today when we watch or take trains from one place to another, we'll think of this great man-George Stephenson.

question_sets.context:
One summer, Jim and John wanted to visit(参观)another city. Both of them bought the tickets and got into the train. In the train John couldn't find his ticket in his pockets(口袋). Jim found the ticket on the floor and picked it up. But he didn't tell John about it. He put it into his own(自己)pocket.
After a while(过了一会儿), the conductor came. He wanted to check the tickets. John was very afraid(害怕). He had to hide(藏)himself under his seat. When the conductor came, Jim brought out two tickets from his pocket.
"Who is the other?" asked the conductor.
"My friend doesn't like to sit. He likes to lie(躺)on the floor under the seat," Jim answered.

question_sets.context:
Turner is a young man. He does not have a wife, but he has a very big dog and he has a very small car too. He likes playing tennis(网球). Last Monday he played tennis for an hour at the club(俱乐部)and then he ran out and jumped into a car.
His dog came after him, but it did not jump into the same car. It jumped into the next one.
"Come here, foolish dog!" Turner shouted at it, but the dog stayed in the other car.
Turner put his key(钥匙)into the lock(锁)of the car, but the key did not turn. Then he look at the car again. It was not his! He was in the wrong car. And the dog was in the right one! "He's sitting and laughing at me!" Turner said angrily. But then he smiled and got into his own car with his dog.

question_sets.context:
The Red Cross Society of China (RCC) has so far received 150 million yuan (18 million US dollars) in donation for tsunami-hit(遭受海啸袭击的) countries, reports from the RCC said on January 14, 2005.
2.66 million US dollars of the money were sent to Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand and Maldives soon after they were hit by the killer disaster late last month. The rest(剩余部分) of the money will be sent for rebuilding villages, schools and orphanages(homes for children who lost their parents) in the disaster area, the reports said.
According to the reports, two RCC's rescue(营救) teams have arrived in Indonesia and Sri Lanka Friday. A third team will go to Thailand early next week.
The RCC will report how much money has been collected and the uses of the money on its Website on time, the reports said.

question_sets.context:
Many years ago,when I was working as a volunteer(志愿者)at a hospital, I got to know a little girl named Lisa. The poor little girl had a very serious disease and was dying. The doctor had done his best but no medicine really worked. The only chance to save her seemed to be a blood transfusion (输血)from her five-year-old brother. The little boy had the same disease before and had developed the antibodies(抗体)to fight the illness.
The doctor talked to me little boy about what they planned to do, and asked him if he would be willing(愿意的)to give his blood to his sister. I saw him hesitate(迟疑)for a moment. He took a deep breath and said, "Yes, I'll do it if it can save Lisa."
As the transfusion was going on, the little boy lay quietly in bed next to his sister. He 1ooked at her and smiled all the time, When everything was done and the colour returned to his sister's face, his smile disappeared and he looked a little afraid. He 1ooked up at the doctor and asked, "Will I start to die now?"
He was too young to understand the doctor. He thought he would have to give all his blood to his sister. but he agreed.

choices.B: She got better with the antibodies from her brother.
choices.D: The transfusion failed and her illness got worse.

choices.B: He thought he was going to be killed.

choices.D: He thought he was going to die when he grew up.  ・

question_sets.context:
Have you ever taken part in a marathon? A marathon is 42km long.  It is the longest race in the world. To make the runner's body work, harder training is quite necessary.  A runner should start to prepare for a marathon at least three months before. Preparation may  have races, many hours of running at different speeds and changes in diet(饮食). During the training time the runner must eat a fit diet. The diet should have lots of things needed in training the players.
In the early days of training, runners run 80km per week. The running is increased every two or three weeks and at least two long runs per week are needed. Two weeks before the marathon, the training programme becomes less, from 100km per week down to 60km and then to 30km in the final week. On the last two days they may not run at all.
Breakfast should be eaten at least three hours before the race. Easily digested(消化)food such as cereal(麦), toast(烤面包) and scrambled(炒碎) egg is best, with as much fluid(液体) as possible. Runners should drink water about half an hour before the race to keep up the body fluid.

questions.text: What is the length of the modern marathon?
questions.explanation: A marathon is 42km long.

questions.text: According to the passage, when should a marathon runner begin his training?

choices.C: Three or four months before the race.

questions.explanation: A runner should start to prepare for a marathon at least three months before.

questions.text: What should a runner have for his breakfast on the day of the race?
questions.explanation: Breakfast should be eaten at least three hours before the race. Easily digested(消化)food such as cereal(麦), toast(烤面包) and scrambled(炒碎) egg is best, with as much fluid(液体) as possible.

questions.text: Players must have_ <blank> _in order to run better in a marathon.

choices.A: training at different speeds and changes in diet.

questions.explanation: Preparation may have races, many hours of running at different speeds and changes in diet(饮食).

questions.text: Hard training before a marathon can_ <blank> _.

choices.C: help the players to make more progress

questions.explanation: To make the runner's body work, harder training is quite necessary.

question_sets.context: A young man was in love with a beautiful girl .One day she said to him, "It is my birthday tomorrow." "Oh," said the young man . "I'll send you roses(玫瑰),one rose for each year of your life." The same evening he went to the flower shop .As he knew the girl was twenty-two years old, he paid for twenty-two roses and asked the shop assistant to send them to the girl the next day. The shop assistant of the flower shop knew the young man very well as he often bought flowers in his shop before. When the young man left the shop , the assistant thought: The young man is very kind to me . He often comes to buy my flowers .In return I'll send ten more flowers ." He did so . The next morning thirty-two roses were sent to the girl. When the young man came to see her ,she did not want to speak to him. And he never knew why she was so angry with him .

question_sets.context: The people in the United States speak the same language as the people in Great Britain(英国). However, American English is different from British(英国的)English in many ways. There are a few differences in grammar(语法). For example, speakers of British English say " in hospital"and "Have you a pen?"Americans say "in the hospital" and "Do you have a pen?"Pronunciation(发音)is sometimes different, Americans usually sounds the "r"in the words. Some spelling are different. People in Britain write "colour" and "center", but people in the United States write "color" and "center". Some words are different. People in the United States use "gasoline(汽油)" but people in Britain use "petrol".

questions.explanation: The passage mentions differences in spelling, pronunciation, and grammar.

question_sets.context:
Mr Black worked for Mrs White. She was old, fat and rich. He worked in her garden. Mrs White didn't know anything about the garden, but she always told him to do this or not to do that. This made Mr Black very angry. So he called her an elephant.
Mrs White were not pleased to hear that. She took Mr Black to the judge (法官). The judge heard the story, and said, "Mr Black, it is wrong to call a lady an elephant. You must never do that again."
"Yes," said Mr Black. "Do you mean that I must not call this lady elephant?"
"That's right," the judge answered.
"And can I call an elephant a lady?" Mr Black asked.
"Yes, you may!" the judge answered.
Then Mr Black looked at the woman and said, "Good-bye, lady."

questions.text: Mrs White took Mr Black to the judge because ________.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Mrs. White was not pleased that Mr. Black called her an elephant and took him to the judge.

choices.C: Mrs White asked him to do this or not to do that

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Mrs. White always told him what to do, which made him angry.

questions.explanation: Mr. Black was angry, so he insulted Mrs. White by calling her an elephant.

questions.explanation: The judge told Mr. Black it was wrong to call a lady an elephant, implying he wanted Mr. Black to change his behavior/idea about it.

choices.A: and Mrs White became good friends
choices.D: still meant Mrs White was an elephant

questions.explanation: Mr. Black cleverly found a way to still call Mrs. White an elephant without directly saying it.

question_sets.context:
One day Rockefeller John went to stay at a hotel in New York and asked for the cheapest room they had. Rockefeller said, "What is the price of the room?" The manager told him.
"And which floor is it on?" again the manager told him.
"Is that the lowest priced room you have? I am staying here by myself and only need a small room."
The manager said, "That room is the smallest and cheapest we have," and added, "But why do you choose a poor room like that? When your son stays here he always has our most expensive room while yours is our cheapest."
"Yes," said Rockefeller, "but his father is a rich man, mine isn't."
