question_sets.context:
What is the best way to learn a language? We should remember that we learned our own language well when we were children. If we learn a second language in the same way , it will not seem difficult. Think of what a small child does. He listens to what people say and tries to imitate (模仿) what he hears. When he wants something, he has to ask for it. He is using the language, talking in it all the time. If people have to use a second language all the time they will learn it quickly.
We learn our own language by hearing people speak it, not by seeing what they write. We imitate what we hear. In school, though you learn to read and write as well as to hear and speak, it is best to learn all the new words through the ear. You can read them, spell them and write them later.

questions.explanation: The passage mentioned 'If people have to use a second language all the time they will learn it quickly'. Therefore, the answer is C.

questions.explanation: The passage mentioned 'it is best to learn all the new words through the ear'. Therefore, the answer is C.

choices.C: Using the language all the time

questions.explanation: Both listening to what people say and using the language all the time are good ways to learn a language, according to the passage. Therefore, the answer is D.

question_sets.context:
During the summer holidays there will be a changed schedule of services for the students. Changes for dining-room and library service hours and for bus schedules will be put up on the wall outside of the dining-hall. Weekly film and concert schedules will be put up each Wednesday outside of the student club.
In the summer holidays, buses going to the town centre will leave the gate every hour on the half hour during the day. The dining room will serve three meals a day from 7: 00 am to 7: 00 pm during the week and two meals from noon to 7: 00 pm on weekends. The library will be open at its usual hours during the week, but have shorter hours on Saturdays and Sundays. The weekend hours are from noon to 5: 00 pm.
Students must have a new summer card if you want to use the library lending services. This announcement will also be seen in the next week's student newspaper.

question_sets.context:
I often dreamed about Pisa when I was a boy. I read about the famous building called the Leaning Tower of Pisa. But when I read the word Pisa, I was thinking of pizza. I thought this tower was a place to buy pizza. It must be the best place to buy pizza in the world, I thought.
Many years later finally saw the Leaning Tower. I knew then that it was Pisa and no pizza. But there was still something special about it for me. The tower got its name because it really does lean to one side. Some people want to try to fix it. They are afraid it may fall over and they don't like it leans over the city.
I do not think it's a good idea to try to fix it. The tower probably will not fall down. It is 600 years old. Why should anything happen to it now? And, if you ask me, I like what it looks like. To me it is a very human kind of leaning. Nothing is perfect, it seems to say.
And who cares? Why do people want things to be perfect? Imperfect things may be more interesting. Let's take the tower in Pisa. Why is it so famous? There are many other older, more beautiful towers in Italy. But Pisa tower is the most famous. People come from all over the world to see it.

choices.C: How the Leaning Tower of Pisa got its name

questions.explanation: The passage primarily discusses the writer's fondness for the Leaning Tower of Pisa and reasons for it.

questions.explanation: The writer initially confused 'Pisa' with 'pizza'.

questions.explanation: The passage states that the tower is 600 years old.

questions.text: The writer <blank>.

choices.A: doesn't like what the tower looks like
choices.B: likes what the tower looks like
choices.C: thinks it's the most beautiful tower in Italy

questions.explanation: The writer explicitly states they like how the tower looks.

questions.text: The writer likes the Leaning Tower of Pisa because <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer appreciates the tower's imperfection, finding it more interesting than perfect structures.

Mr Black works in an office. He's very busy and he has no time to rest. Every evening, When he comes back from his office, he always feels tired and wants to go to bed early, but his wife often has something interesting to tell him after supper. She keeps talking until it's too late. But Mr Black has to get up early in the morning.
One day Mr Black felt terrible and couldn't go to work. He went to see a doctor with Mrs Black. Before he said what the matter was him, his wife told the doctor all. The doctor got the reason and said to Mrs Black, "Here is a bottle of medicine for your husband and some pills for you."
"For me?" the woman said in surprise, "I'm fine. I don't need any medicine!"

"This tin (罐头) of fish," Mrs. Peter said. "And there are some cold, boiled potatoes (土豆) and some beans (豆子) here, too."
"Good" Then Mrs Peter went to her meeting. All the ladies had lunch at Mrs Green's, and at three o'clock Mrs Peter came home.
"Was your fish nice?" She asked.
"Yes, but my feet are hurting," he answered.
"Why are they hurting?" Mrs Peter asked.
"Well, on the tin it was written: Open the tin and stand in hot water for five minutes."

Mr Grant moved to another town. One day he went to see a doctor. He sat down in the waiting room and looked round. The doctor's degrees (学位证书) were on the wall. Suddenly Mr Grant remembered there had been a classmate with the same name in his class at school, and he had become a doctor.
As he went in to see the doctor, he remembered a young, handsome student and he was sad to see how old this man looked. He said to him, "Good morning, Doctor. Did you go to King High School?"
The doctor answered, "Yes, I did."
"Were you there from 1942 to 1946?" Mr Grant asked.
"Yes, I was." the doctor answered. "How did you know?"
Mr Grant laughed and said, "You were in my class!"
"Oh?" the doctor said and looked at him carefully for a few minutes. "What were you teaching?" he asked.

question_sets.context:
Tom was twelve years old. His sister, Nancy was two years younger than he. One day their mother asked them to clean the house. Because they did very well, their mother bought a delicious cake and said to Tom, "Tom, cut he cake into two pieces, and give one to your sister. Don't forget that you must do it like a brother." "Like a brother?" Tom asked. "How does a brother do it?" "He always gives the bigger piece to the other person," answered his mother.
"Oh, I see," said Tom. He thought about for a while, then thought for a while, then he took the cake to his sister and said to her, "please cut them into two pieces, Nancy, and be a good sister."

questions.text: Tom was <blank> years older than Nancy.
questions.explanation: Tom was twelve years old, and Nancy was two years younger. Therefore, Tom was two years older than Nancy.

questions.text: <blank> cleaned the house very well.
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'they did very well', which means both Tom and Nancy cleaned the house very well.

questions.text: Tom's mother asked him to give <blank> of the cake to his sister.
questions.explanation: Tom's mother said, 'He always gives the bigger piece to the other person'.

questions.text: At last Tom asked <blank> to cut the cake.
questions.explanation: Tom asked his sister Nancy to cut the cake

questions.text: In this story there were only <blank> people.
questions.explanation: Tom, Nancy, and their mother

question_sets.context: One day a great general asks his soldiers," What is the strongest power in the world?" Four of his soldiers put up their hands, They want to answer the question. The general asks the first man to speak. The first man is younger them the other three, and he's not strong. He says," My gun is the strongest. It can kill any enemy." "Thank you. Next, please. "The second man is very strong. He says." I don't think so. Soldiers use guns. So the soldier is the strongest." The third man says. "Soldiers use guns, but our general gives orders. So I think our general is the strongest." The fourth man is the oldest. He says," Love is the strongest. For love, people don't use guns." The general says nothing. He takes out a medal and gives it to him.

questions.text: <blank> soldiers answer the general's question.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Four of his soldiers put up their hands, They want to answer the question.'

questions.explanation: The text states 'The general says nothing. He takes out a medal and gives it to him.', implying that the general appreciates the fourth man's answer the most.

question_sets.context:
In the world today ,all of thepeople need recreation.(消遣).We cannot work allthe time if we are going to keep healthy and enjoy life.
Everyone has his own way of relaxing .Perhaps the most popular form (形式) is to take part in sports. There are team sports, such as basketball and football. There are also individual(个人的) sports.such as swimming and running. Skating and mountain climbing are the most popular recreation for people who like to be outdoor.
Not everyone who enjoys sports likes to takes part in them. Many people like watching them on TV or listening to them on the radio. So many people like some forms of indoor recreation, such as watching TV, singing and dancing .
It doesn't matter whether we like indoor recreation or take part in outdoor sports, It is important for everyone to relax from time to time, and enjoy some forms of recreation.

questions.text: Which is the most popular form of recreation?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that "Perhaps the most popular form is to take part in sports."

questions.explanation: The first paragraph states, "We cannot work all the time if we are going to keep healthy and enjoy life."

questions.explanation: The second paragraph says, "Skating and mountain climbing are the most popular recreation for people who like to be outdoor."

choices.A: Because they like sports but don't like take part in them

questions.explanation: Some people like watching rather than participating due to preference or physical limitations.

choices.A: basketball is kind of team sports
choices.B: everyone who enjoys sports should take part in them
choices.C: different people have different ways of relaxing
choices.D: indoor recreation is not as important as outdoor sports.

questions.explanation: The passage discusses various forms of recreation and how people relax in different ways.

question_sets.context:
Long ago there was a man with the name Smith. He made a living on making caps. One day he went to sell his caps. He went through a forest. There were many monkeys in it. It was very hot and the man wanted to rest a little. He came up to a large tree, put his caps on the ground, took one of them and put it on his head. Then he lay down and soon fell asleep.
"Where are my caps?"Smith cried when he woke up. He looked up and saw many monkeys in the trees and each monkey had a cap on its head.
"Give me back my caps!"The man shouted at the monkeys. But the monkeys didn' t understand him. They only laughed. The man got very angry, took off his own cap, threw it on the ground and cried,"If you want all my caps, you may take this one, too!"
And what do you think happened? The little animals did the same. Each monkey took off its cap and threw it on the ground. The man was very glad. He quickly collected all his caps and went on his way.

question_sets.context: When Mr. David retired(退休), he bought a small house in a village near the sea. He liked it and hoped to live a quiet life in it. But to his surprise, many visitors came to see his house in summer holidays, for it was the most interesting building in the village. From morning to night, there were visitors outside the house. They kept looking into the rooms through the windows and many of them even went into the house. He decided to drive the visitors away. So he put a notice on the window. The notice said,"If you want to satisfy your curiosity(好奇心),come in and look around. Price: twenty dollars."Mr. David was sure that the visitors would stop coming, but he was wrong. More and more visitors came and Mr. David had to spend every day showing them around his house. "I came here to retire, not to work as a guide(导游)", he said angrily. In the end, he sold the house and moved away.

questions.explanation: The passage states that the house was 'the most interesting building'.

choices.C: to let visitors come in and look around
choices.D: to get some money out of the visitors

questions.explanation: The passage says 'He decided to drive the visitors away'.

questions.explanation: The notice increased the visitors.

choices.A: the visitors didn't come any more

choices.D: no visitor would pay the money for a visit

question_sets.context:
A man was sitting in his doctor's office. He was telling the doctor about his problem.
"I like football, you know, doctor," he said. "And my wife has never been good to me since I became interested in it. She often hears me shouting in my dreams(梦). Night after night, when I close my eyes, I'm out there on the field and running after flying ball. When I wake up, I always feel tired. I'm getting thinner and thinner. So, what am I going to do?"
The doctor sat back and said,"First, you will have to try your best not to dream about football. When you close your eyes, try to think about something else. Try to think, for example, that you are at a party or someone is going to give you several million dollars…"
"Are you crazy(疯了), doctor?" the man shouted. "I'll miss my ball then!"

choices.A: he couldn't get to sleep at night.
choices.B: he wanted to get some ideas about his problem
choices.C: the doctor asked him to talk about the footballs

questions.explanation: He was telling the doctor about his problem.

questions.text: The man always felt tired when he woke up because <blank>.

choices.A: he thought of his football even in his dreams
choices.B: he had a lot of housework to do at night
choices.C: he often got up during the night to play football

questions.explanation: When I close my eyes, I'm out there on the field and running after flying ball. When I wake up, I always feel tired.

questions.text: The doctor told the man <blank>.

choices.A: not to dream in his sleep
choices.B: to close his eyes after he was lying in bed
choices.C: not to think of football when he was sleeping

questions.explanation: First, you will have to try your best not to dream about football. When you close your eyes, try to think about something else.

choices.A: football is one of the most popular games.
choices.B: the man's wife was also a football fan.
choices.C: football made the man's life terrible

questions.explanation: And my wife has never been good to me since I became interested in it.

questions.text: The best title(标题) for this story would be <blank>.
questions.explanation: The story mainly talks about a man who is obsessed with football.

question_sets.context:
Joe had a shop. He worked five and a half days a week. His shop was closed at one o'clock on Thursday, and it was closed the whole(整个)day of Sunday. Saturdays were the busiest days.
One Thursday a woman came into the shop at five minutes to one. "I'm sorry I'm late, "she said. "but some people have just telephoned to say that they are going to come to dinner tonight, and I need some more meat. "
Joe only had one piece of good meat in the shop. He had sold all the others earlier in the day. He took the piece out and said to the woman, "This is 6.50 pounds(磅). "
"That piece is too small, "the woman said. "Don't you have anything bigger?"
"Joe went into the room behind his shop, opened the fridge, put the piece of meat into it, took it out again and closed the door of the fridge with a lot of noise(噪音). Then he brought the piece of meat back to the woman and said, "This is bigger and more expensive. It's 8.75 pounds. "
"Good, "the woman said with a smile, "give me both of them, please. "
One Thursday a woman came into the shop at five minutes to one. "I'm sorry I'm late, "she said. "but some people have just telephoned to say that they are going to come to dinner tonight, and I need some more meat. "
Joe only had one piece of good meat in the shop. He had sold all the others earlier in the day. He took the piece out and said to the woman, "This is 6.50 pounds(磅). "
"That piece is too small, "the woman said. "Don't you have anything bigger?"
"Joe went into the room behind his shop, opened the fridge, put the piece of meat into it, took it out again and closed the door of the fridge with a lot of noise(噪音). Then he brought the piece of meat back to the woman and said, "This is bigger and more expensive. It's 8.75 pounds. "
"Good, "the woman said with a smile, "give me both of them, please. "

questions.explanation: The first sentence says that Joe had a shop.

questions.explanation: The text says that his shop was closed at one o'clock on Thursday and it was closed the whole day of Sunday.

questions.explanation: The woman said that some people have just telephoned to say that they are going to come to dinner tonight, and she needed some more meat.

question_sets.context:
Many people like to watch TV .Watch TV is one of the most important activities of the day .TV brings the outside world closer to people's homes .Some people say the world is now smaller than before because of TV .Perhaps they are right .
What's going on in other countries ?
What's going on in the deepest parts of the sea ?
Well ,just turn on the TV .Turn it on and watch .You can see a lot and you can learn a lot . Of course people can also learn through reading or listening to the radio .But watch TV they can learn better and more easily .Why ? Because they can hear and watch ,too .
TV helps to open our eyes .TV also helps to open our minds .TV often give us new ideas .We learn newer and better ways of doing things .

questions.explanation: The first sentence says that watching TV is one of the most important activities of the day.

questions.explanation: 'closer' means 'nearer'.

question_sets.context: Women's fashions (时装)change more quickly than men's .In the early 1990's, all women wore their skirts down to the ankle (脚踝).Today, some skirts are even longer than before, but some are very short .Women's shoes have also gone through all sorts of changes in the last ninety �Cfive years .For example, boots (靴)for women were very common at the beginning of the century .Then for years, they were not thought fashionable.Today, they're back again in all colours, lengths (长度)and materials (材料). In fact, today's women can wear all kinds of clothes on almost any occasion (场合). While all of these changes were taking place in women's fashions, men's clothing remained (保持)almost the same as it was a few years ago. And, in fact, most men are still dressed in the kinds of they used to wear.

question_sets.context:
One day Tom was playing with his younger brother Paul beside the well near their home. Suddenly Tom fell down the well. Paul was frightened. Their parents were not at home. Their father was working in the factory and their mother was helping a neighbour. Tom called his younger brother, Paul. Paul looked at the bottom of the well and saw his brother standing in the water of the well. Tom was five feet tall and the water was only three feet deep. Paul was glad to see his brother safe in the well. Then he ran home and brought a long rope.
He was only six and not very strong, so he could not pull Tom out. He was thinking hard and finally had a good idea. He tied one end of the rope to a tree and threw the other end to his brother in the well. Then Tom climbed up the rope and got out of the well. He thanked his brother first and went home to change his wet clothes.

questions.text: Tom was _______.
questions.explanation: The first line of the passage states that Tom was playing with Paul.

questions.text: Tom fell down _______ .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Tom fell down the well near their home.

questions.text: _______ was trying to save Tom.
questions.explanation: The passage describes Paul's actions to help Tom.

questions.text: Their parents were _______.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that the parents were not at home.

questions.text: Paul was ______.

choices.B: only five and not very strong

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Paul was only six and not very strong.

question_sets.context:
Two women on a train were arguing(争论). At last one of them called the conductor. She said, "If this window is open, I'll probably die(死) of cold." The other woman said, "But if this window is closed, I'll die because I will feel difficult in breathing (呼吸). The conductor didn't know what to do.
Just at that moment, an old man came up to them. "Oh, I have a good idea. First open the window, and that will kill one. Next close it, and that will kill the other. Then we can have peace. What do you think of it?"

questions.text: The first woman wanted to close the window because ________.
questions.explanation: The passage states the woman said she would die of cold if the window was open.

questions.text: Who called the conductor?
questions.explanation: The passage states that one of the women called the conductor and it logically makes sense that the first woman who felt cold did.

questions.text: The old man wanted to ______.

choices.C: drive them out of the train
choices.D: show he was cleverer than the conductor

questions.explanation: The old man's suggestion, although extreme, was aimed at stopping the argument.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true?

choices.A: The two women's seats were near each other.
choices.B: The conductor didn't know how to stop the arguing.
choices.C: The old man first opened the window and then closed it.
choices.D: The four people were on the same train.

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't mention the old man physically opening or closing the window.

questions.text: This story tells us that we should______________.

choices.A: first open the window and then close it
choices.B: help others whatever they want to do
choices.C: help the conductor to stop the arguing
choices.D: be polite and peaceful on a train

questions.explanation: The story indirectly teaches the value of being polite and peaceful in a shared space.

question_sets.context:
Mr. Black works in an office. He's very busy and has no time to have a good rest. Every evening, when he comes back from his office, he's always tired and wants to go to bed early. But his wife often has a lot of interesting things to tell him after supper. She doesn't stop talking until she falls asleep, but it's usually too late and Mr. Black has to get up in the morning when she is asleep.
One day the man felt terrible and couldn't go to work. He decided to go to see a doctor. And Mrs. Black went to the hospital with him. Before her husband said what was the matter with him, the woman had told the doctor all and the man understood why. The doctor wrote a prescription (处方). And when Mrs. Black brought the medicine to the consulting room (诊疗室), the doctor said to her, "The bottle of medicine is for your husband and the pills are for you."
"For me?" the woman said in surprise, "I'm fine. I don't need medicine!"
"I don't think so, madam," said the doctor, "They are sleeping pills. Your husband will soon be all right if you take them."

choices.B: too busy not to have a good rest

questions.explanation: 根据句意可知，他的妻子在睡觉前不停地说话。

choices.B: he has to go to work
choices.D: his wife lets him get up

choices.C: Mr. Black takes the bottle of medicine

questions.explanation: 根据文章最后一句可知，医生让Mrs. Black吃药。

question_sets.context:
Daniel wakes up in the morning and collects his post. There's a letter for him with a picture of a sick horse. It's from a charity, asking him to give money to help save the animals. The doorbell rings and there is an old woman on Daniel's doorstep. She is asking for money to help old people. When he turns on the TV, he hears sad music and see a picture of a weak child who is dying of hunger in Africa(非洲). He knows those poor children need money. He is always ready to help those in trouble.
In May, Yao Ming, a basketball star, help a TV show in Shanghai and he collected ＄300000 to help scientists with medical research(医学研究). "We must do something to help our county at this difficult time," he said.
People such as Daniel and Yao Ming feel good about helping with money.

questions.text: Daniel always <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first paragraph says that Daniel is always ready to help those in trouble.

questions.text: From this passage, we learn that Yao Ming is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The second paragraph says that Yao Ming helped a TV show in Shanghai and he collected money to help scientists, implies he is kind and helpful.

questions.text: This passage is mainly about <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage talks about how Daniel and Yao Ming help others, which belongs to the topic of charity.

question_sets.context:
In Europe many people died during the Second World War. As a result, at the end of the war there were manyorphans(孤儿)there. A man called Hermann Gmeiner wanted to help these children. His idea was simple. He wanted orphans to have a home, and he wanted them to have the care and kindness of parents. Gmeiner asked people to give him some money. With this money he built the first SOS Children's Village at Imst, in Austria. It opened in1949. This is how the SOS stand for "Save OurSouls(灵魂)." This means "Please help us!" An SOS Children' village gives help to orphans.
Hermann Gmeiner's idea for helping orphans soonspread(传播)all over the world. By 1983 there were 170 SOS Children's Villages in the world. People in many countries give money to help the villages. Today the children from the first village have grown up. Now some of them work in other SOS Children's Villages.
In SOS Villages orphans live in family groups. There are several houses in each village. The biggest village has 40 or 50 houses! Between seven and ten children live in a house. A woman lives with each group of children and looks after them. She gives the children a lot of love and kindness. She cooks meals for them and makescomfortable(舒适的), happy home for them.
Of course, the children don't spend all their time in the village. They go to school, they go out with their friends. But the village gives them a home―sometimes for the first time in their lives.

questions.text: Which of the following came last?

choices.B: There were many orphans at the end of the war
choices.C: Gmeiner built the first SOS Children's Village
choices.D: A man called Hermann Gmeiner wanted to help the orphans

questions.explanation: Based on the order of the events in the passage, building the SOS Children's Village came last.

questions.text: An orphan is a child <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first paragraph states that the man wants orphans to have the care and kindness of parents.

questions.text: We can conclude(推论)from the article that the money for helping the SOS Villages mainly comes from <blank>.
questions.explanation: The text mentions that Gmeiner asked people to give him some money, and people in many countries give money to help the villages.

questions.text: Which of the following can bestsummarize(总结) the work a woman in an SOS Village does for each group of children?

choices.A: She gives the children a lot of love and kindness
choices.B: She lives with each group of children

questions.explanation: The passage mentions she lives with children, cooks meals for them, implies she looks after them. However, the passage highlights she gives the children a lot of love and kindness, which can best summarize the work she does.

question_sets.context: 34 Block A, 15th floor, Blake Avenue, 18, Singapore, 15th February, 1987. Dear Sir, I must write through your column (栏目) to thank the gentleman who very kindly helped me any my family a few nights ago. It was raining heavily at the time and my car had broken down along a lonely stretch (一段路程) outside the city. It was also very dark. I tried to repair the car myself but couldn’t find out what was wrong with the engine (发动机). By then I was completely (完全地) wet. Just then a young man stopped his car to help. He drove my family home first and later came back with a mechanic (机修工). He did not leave until the mechanic started my car and I was on my way home again. It was then that I found out I did not even know his name. Thank you, young man, whoever (无论谁) and wherever you are. Yours faithfully Chan Honghai

questions.explanation: The address includes 'Singapore', which is a country.

questions.text: Mr. Chan is writing this letter <blank>.

choices.A: because his car stopped in the rain
choices.D: to find out the name of the young man

questions.explanation: The letter begins with 'I must write...to thank the gentleman...'

questions.text: The young man was <blank>.

choices.D: repairing his own car in the rain

questions.explanation: The letter says 'Just then a young man stopped his car to help', implying he was passing by.

questions.text: The young man came back with a mechanic <blank>.

choices.A: after taking Mr. Chan’s family home
choices.D: when Mr. Chan was on his way home

questions.explanation: The letter states 'He drove my family home first and later came back with a mechanic'.

questions.text: Mr. Chan was most <blank>.

choices.A: polite to those who had helped him

questions.explanation: The entire letter is an expression of gratitude to the young man.

question_sets.context:
Helen Keller lived in the USA. She was a great woman.
When Helen was a baby, she got very sick. After many weeks, the doctor said, "She is better, but now she can't hear." Her parents were very sad.
After a few years, things got worse. There was no way for Helen to speak to other people. She heard nothing. She saw nothing. She didn't understand anything.
Then one day a teacher came into live with Helen and her family. The teacher helped Helen learn about words. Helen was a very clever child and soon she learned to spell her first word. When she was older, she went to college.
Helen was very famous. She helped many blind and deaf(聋) people. She traveled around the world and helped many people.

question_sets.context:
Once an old man went to see a doctor. The doctor looked him over carefully and said, " Medicine won't help you. You must have a good rest. Go to bed early, drink milk, walk a lot and smoke one cigar a day. Go to the country place for a month. "
After a month the man came to the doctor again. "How are you? "said the doctor, " I'm glad to see you again. You look much younger." "Oh, doctor, I feel quite well now, " sail the man, " I had a good rest. I went to bed early , drank a lot of milk and walked a lot .Your advice(建议) certainly help me, but you told me to smoke one cigar a day almost killed me first. It's no joke to start smoking at my age!"

question_sets.context: It is seven thirty in the morning. Mr. Boffin is going to work. He usually drives to work. But now he can't find the key to his car. He asks Mrs. Boffin. She doesn't know. question_sets.context: One day Mr. White stayed very late in a restaurant. When he got home at ten o'clock, Mrs. White was sitting at the dinner table waiting for him. I don't hope you'll be late

question_sets.context: A driver stopped his car on a street side to have a rest. As he lay down in the seat and closed his eyes, a person came up and knocked(敲) at the window to ask the time. The driver opened his eyes and looked at his watch: "It's 8:05," he said. Then he went to sleep again. But soon he was waken up(被叫醒) again because a second person was knocking at the window. "Sir, do you know the time?" he asked. The driver looked at his watch again, and told him it was half past eight. In this way, the driver thought he could not have a good rest, so he wrote a short note(纸条) and stuck(贴) it on the window for all to see. It said, "I don't know the time." Again, he lay down in the seat for his sleep. A few minutes later, a third person came and began to knock at the window, "Hey, sir," he said. "It's a quarter to nine."

question_sets.context:
Once there lived an old man. He liked gold better than anything else in the world. He often said, "If I have enough gold, I will be the happiest man in the world."

One day when he was traveling in the desert(沙漠), the old man lost his way. He was very hungry and thirsty, but there were only rocks and sand around him. Just then, he found a bag lying on the sand. He hoped he would find water and food in it. He took up the bag and opened it. He saw that the bag was full(满的) of gold. He was so sad that he threw away the bag and began crying.

Now, the old man knew that there was something better than gold in the world.

Can animals be made to work for us? Some scientists(科学家) think that one day animals may be taught to do some easy jobs. They say that in a film or on TV. We may see elephants(大象), monkeys, dogs, bears or other animals doing a lot of thins. If you watch carefully, you may find that those animals are always given a little food to eat after they have done something. The scientists say that many different animals may be taught to do lots of jobs if they know they will get something to eat.
We all know elephants can carry large logs(木头) and dogs can look after houses. And we can also teach animals to work in factories. Apes(猿猴), for example(例如), have been used in America to help make cars, and scientists believe(相信) that these large monkeys may one day get in crops and drive trains. People are training(训练)them to do those things.

question_sets.context:
Every evening at six o'clock an old man goes to a restaurant near his house. He eats dinner. After dinner, he drinks coffee and talks to the people at the restaurant.
The old man's name is Bill. Bill eats at the restaurant every evening because he is lonely. His wife died and he has no children.
Every evening the same waitress brings Bill to his dinner. Her name is Cara. She is 17 years old. Cara is kind to Bill. She knows he is lonely, so she talks to him. If Bill is late for dinner, she calls him on the telephone. "Are you OK?" she asks him.
One evening Bill doesn't come to the restaurant. Cara calls him, but he doesn't answer the phone. Cara calls the police. "Please go to Bill's house." Cara tells the police. Later the police call Cara at the restaurant. "Bill died in his sleep," the police tell her. Bill was 82 years old.
A week later, a man comes to the restaurant. "I have something for Cara," the man says. The man gives Cara a check(支票) for $500'000. The money is from Bill.
"This money is for me? From Bill?" Cara asks the man.
"Yes," the man answers.
"But…why?" Cara asks the man.
"Bill liked you," the man says. "You were kind to him"

question_sets.context:
We have rather a small house, with only two bedrooms. You can think our alarm,then, when Aunt Clara wrote to say that she was coming to stay with her family for the weekend. Her family, I should say, has four boys, all under the age of twelve.
I sent off a telegram(电报)at once, and explained(解释)in it that our house was too small. Aunt Clara called us up the next morning. "I forgot to explain," she said in her sweetest voice. "The boys will be bringing a couple of tents ."
Even so my wife couldn't make free from fear(害怕). It was true that we had a large garden, but there was still the problem of feeding four growing boys.
"And what if it rains?" she asked.
But Saturday morning turned out to be bright and clear when I went to the station to meet Aunt Clara. I tried to squeeze(往车里塞)three of the boys, together with the luggage(行李), into the back of the car. The youngest sat in front, with Aunt Clara and me.
"I didn't see the tents among your luggage, " I turned over and said to David, the eldest boy.
"The tents!" said Aunt Clara. "Oh! We left them in the luggage van(行李车厢)".

question_sets.context:
Marry is eight years old now. This autumn she starts her school. She likes her teachers and has some friends. She studies hard and is good at her classes, so we think she's a good girl.
It's Sunday today. It's fine and after breakfast the girl and her parents are going to the zoo. She likes to watch the animals very much. Now they're standing at the bus stop and waiting for the bus. She sees her friend Jim and his grandpa there.
"Good morning, grandpa!" says the girl. "Are you going to the zoo, too?"
"Yes, we are, " says the old man. Then he says to Mary's father, "You have a polite(有礼貌的) daughter. How old is she?"
"Eight, grandpa." answers the girl.
"Eight?" the old man says with a smile. "But you're shorter than my stick(拐杖)!"
"How old is your stick, then?" says the girl.

questions.explanation: The passage states that "This autumn she starts her school," indicating she is a student.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: We think Mary is a good girl because___________.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "She studies hard and is good at her classes, so we think she's a good girl."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Mary and her parents are going to the zoo by___________.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "Now they're standing at the bus stop and waiting for the bus."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Mary's parents and the girl are going to the zoo because___________.

choices.A: they like to watch the animals
choices.C: the zoo is near their house
choices.D: Jim and his grandpa are going there, too

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that "She likes to watch the animals very much."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Which of the following is right?

choices.B: The old man is not going to the zoo.
choices.D: Marry is taller than the old man's stick.

questions.explanation: The passage states that the old man said, "You have a polite daughter."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
It was Jimmy's birthday and he was five years old. He got a lot of nice birthday presents(礼物) from his family, and one of them was a beautiful drum.( 鼓 )
" Who gives him that thing?" Jimmy's father asked. " His grandfather," answered Jimmy's mother.
Of course Jimmy liked his drum very much. He made a terrible noise (噪音)with it, but his father didn't know . His father worked during the day and Jimmy was in bed when he got home in the evening, so he couldn't hear the noise.
But one of the neighbors ( 邻居 ) didn't like the noise at all, so a few days later, she took a sharp ( 锋利的 ) knife(刀) and went to Jimmy's house when he was hitting his drum. She said to him, "Hello, Jimmy, do you know, there is something nice inside(在……里面) your drum? Here is a knife. Open the drum and let's find it."

questions.text: Jimmy got a lot of nice presents from his _________.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states, "He got a lot of nice birthday presents from his family."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Who gave Jimmy the drum?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions, "His grandfather," answered Jimmy's mother, implying that the grandfather gave Jimmy the drum.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: When did Jimmy's father work?
questions.explanation: The passage states, "His father worked during the day."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: One of the neighbors _________.

choices.B: enjoyed listening to the sound of the drum
choices.C: didn't like the noise at all
choices.D: wanted to show Jimmy a nice knife.

questions.explanation: The passage says, "But one of the neighbors didn't like the noise at all"
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: What did Jimmy's neighbor really want him to do? To ___________.

choices.C: teach him how to hit(击,敲) the drum
choices.D: find something nice in his drum

questions.explanation: The neighbor brought a knife to Jimmy, suggesting she wanted him to destroy the drum to stop the noise.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
Mrs. Brown was very fat. Her husband(丈夫) thought she shouldgo on a diet, and he made her eat no meat or cakes.
One morning, Mrs. Brown made a nice cake for her husband, and he ate half(一半) of it. After he went out, Mrs. Brown cut a very small piece(片) of the cake and ate it. It was very delicious. Then she cut a bigger piece and ate it, too. In a few minutes she finished up the cake. "My husband is going to be very angry," she thought. "What should I do?" She made another cake very quickly, ate half of it, and put the other half on the table. Mr. Brown came back late. When he saw the half of the cake on the table, he was very happy.

questions.text: Mrs. Brown's husband made her eat no meat or cakes because _____.

choices.A: meat and cakes are junk food
choices.B: meat and cakes could make her fatter
choices.D: meat and cakes could make her ill

questions.explanation: The passage states that her husband thought she should go on a diet, implying that he wanted her to lose weight, which means meat and cakes could make her fatter.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: What's the Chinese for "go on a diet" in the passage?
questions.explanation: "Go on a diet" means to restrict food intake, which translates to "节食" in Chinese.

questions.text: Which of the following is true?

choices.A: Mrs. Brown ate half of the first cake and left the other half for her husband.
choices.B: Mrs. Brown ate half of the first cake and half of the second one that morning.
choices.C: Mr. Brown ate two cakes that morning.
choices.D: Mr. Brown didn't eat any cakes that morning.

questions.explanation: The husband ate half of the first cake. The wife ate the other half of the first cake and half of the second one, leaving the rest half of the second cake for the husband. Thus the husband didn't eat any cake made by the wife that morning.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Mrs. Brown made another cake because _________.

choices.A: She was good at making cakes
choices.C: She wanted to eat more cakes
choices.D: she didn't want her husband to be angry

questions.explanation: Mrs. Brown thought her husband would be angry if he found out she ate the whole cake, so she made another one to cover it up.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Why was Mrs. Brown's husband very happy when he saw the half of the cake on the table?

choices.B: Because Mrs. Brown made it for him.
choices.C: Because he thought Mrs. Brown didn't ate any cakes.
choices.D: Because the cake was nice and delicious.

questions.explanation: The husband was happy, as indicated in the last sentence of the passage, because he thought Mrs. Brown hadn't eaten any cake, staying true to her diet.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

question_sets.context: Danny was just tired about the way things were going. His mother came to the school and went on and on about Rick Jackson. It seemed that she would never stop talking." Somebody's got to stop that boy!" she was shouting. "Rick's troubling everybody in neighborhood_(四邻).And he loves to pick on_(结交)little boys like Danny."Mrs.Green, Danny's teacher, was concerned_(担心)a lot." I didn't know that Rick was picking on Danny," she answered. "He's never said anything about this to me!" Mrs. Green looked at Danny ."How long has this been going to?" she asked. Danny could only shake_(摇动) his head and look at the floor. He knew if he said a word about this, he would have trouble_(麻烦) after school. Danny hadn't said anything about the problem because he wanted to do things with the boys in the neighborhood. After all, most of them were nice to him. He didn't like to leave the gang_ just because of Rick. Maybe the time had come to find new friends. He felt it hard to make up his mind_(下定决心).

questions.text: We learn from the reading that _____.

choices.A: Danny was not a good student
choices.B: Danny's mother talked too much about the school
choices.C: Danny's teacher knew something about Danny's problem before.
choices.D: Danny wanted to get away from Rick

questions.explanation: The passage states that Danny may need to find new friends, implying he wants to get away from Rick. The other options are not supported by the text.

questions.text: When Danny's mother came for Mrs. Green, the matter was now ____ to Mr. Green.
questions.explanation: Danny's mother coming to school to complain indicates that the matter was serious.

questions.text: Danny now ______ .

choices.A: was tired of the school and his friends
choices.C: was not sure what he should do with the problem
choices.D: made some new friends in the neighborhood

questions.explanation: The passage says that Danny felt it hard to make up his mind, meaning he wasn't sure what to do.

questions.text: Danny didn't say anything about the matter to Mrs. Green because ________ .

choices.B: the other boys would tell her
choices.C: he didn't want to be in trouble
choices.D: his mother didn't want him to say it

questions.explanation: The passage says 'He knew if he said a word about this, he would have trouble after school.', implying Danny feared retribution.

questions.text: The word '_gang_' in the reading means '_________ '.

choices.A: a place for boys to play games
choices.C: a school bus for children to and from school

questions.explanation: In this context, 'gang' refers to a group of young people, specifically the boys in the neighborhood.

question_sets.context: Bill was fourteen years old and in the ninth grade. He had a part-time job which got him up at five. He was a newspaper boy. Each morning, Bill left the houses at five fifteen to go to the corner. The newspapers had been sent to the corner by truck at midnight. He always rode a bike to carry them. In winter it was still dark when he got up, but during the rest of the year it was bright. Bill had to send the newspapers to the houses of people in all kinds of weather, he tried to put each paper in the box where it would be kept safe from wind and rain or snow. His customers together. Since many of them worked during the day, Bill had to get the money at night. Sometimes when Bill was ill, his elder brother had to send the newspapers. Once Bill's father had to help him. Bill had 70 customers, but he hoped to get more soon. Some day, if he got many more customers, perhaps Bill could win a prize for being a very good newspaper boy, he wanted to win a visit to Europe, but he would be happy if he won a new bike.

questions.text: Bill couldn't do his part time job, when <blank>.

choices.A: he was very busy with his study
choices.D: It was raining heavily and blowing strongly

questions.explanation: Sometimes when Bill was ill, his elder brother had to send the newspapers.

questions.text: From the story we know that Bill's part-time job could <blank>.

choices.A: make him become a college student
choices.C: help him make many good friends
choices.D: help him get what he needed most at that time

questions.explanation: he wanted to win a visit to Europe, but he would be happy if he won a new bike.

questions.text: Sometimes Bill's customers gave him some tips because <blank>.

choices.A: they thought newspaper boys got too little for their work
choices.B: Bill asked them to do so
choices.D: they wanted Bill to work for them longer

questions.explanation: Not mentioned in the passage. Can be inferred.

questions.text: From the story we know the customers liked <blank> people to work for them.
questions.explanation: Not mentioned in the passage. Can be inferred.

questions.text: As a newspaper boy, if one worked very well, he could possibly win <blank>.

choices.D: a visit to some place or a new bike

questions.explanation: he wanted to win a visit to Europe, but he would be happy if he won a new bike.

question_sets.context: Expert(专家) say that students usually need eight to ten hours' sleep at night, but most Chinese students do not get enough sleep. Some Chinese parents are usually glad to see their children studying late. They will think their children work very hard, but not all parents are happy about this. Once a mother told us tat every morning her 10-year-old boy put up one finger (手指) with his eyes still closed, begging(请求) for one more minute to sleep. Like thousands of students " early birds" in China, he has to get up before six every morning. A report shows that without a good night's sleep, students seem to be weaker (虚弱) than they should be. Many students have fallen asleep during class at one time or another. Too much homework is not the only reason why students stay up late. Some watch TV or play the computer games late into the night. Experts have ever said that the students should develop good study habits. So some clever students never study last, they are able to work well in class.

choices.B: it wasn't time for him to get up
choices.C: he didn't want to go to school
choices.D: he wanted his mother to wake him up

questions.explanation: According to the context, the boy did not have enough sleep.

questions.text: In this passage we know if students don't get enough sleep, they may <blank>
questions.explanation: Students seem to be weaker than they should be.

questions.text: In this passage "early birds" means "persons who <blank>"
questions.explanation: early birds in China, he has to get up before six every morning.

questions.text: "Stay up late" here means "<blank>"

choices.C: not go to bed until late

questions.explanation: Too much homework is not the only reason why students stay up late. Some watch TV or play the computer games late into the night.

choices.A: If you want to study better, you must work hard at night.
choices.C: Some clever students are able to work well in class because they have good study habits.
choices.D: Students don't have enough sleep because they have lots of homework to do.

questions.explanation: Experts have ever said that the students should develop good study habits. So some clever students never study last, they are able to work well in class.

question_sets.context: The earth moves round the sun, and the moon moves round the earth. When our part (部分) of the earth turns to the sun, it is day, When our part of the earth turns away from the sun, it is night. The sun is much bigger than the moon. But sometimes the moon looks bigger than the sun, because it's much nearer to the earth. The sun is very bright. It gives a very strong light. The moon looks quite bright, too. But it doesn't give any light at all. The moon looks much bigger and brighter than the stars. But in fact the stars are much bigger and brighter than the moon. They look smaller than the moon because they're much farther away from us.

questions.explanation: According to the first sentence, the moon moves around the earth.

choices.B: doesn't give a very strong light
choices.C: it is much nearer to the earth than the sun
choices.D: it comes out only at night it

questions.explanation: The passage states that the moon looks bigger because it is nearer to the earth.

choices.B: isn't bright ,but it gives a very strong light
choices.C: is very big, but it doesn't give any light at all
choices.D: is very round, but it can't move round

questions.explanation: The passage says the sun is very bright and gives a strong light.

choices.D: are much farther away from us than the moon

questions.explanation: The last sentence states that the stars are much farther away from us than the moon.

question_sets.context:
Mr Evans works in Sydney. Last week he had a two-week holiday, but he didn't know where to go. He said to his friend Robert, "I hate the hot weather here, but I can't think of a cool place in Australia. Where shall I take my holiday?"
"That's easy," said Robert, "You can go to Moscow. Snow and ice are covering the ground there now."
Mr Evans agreed with his friend. He bought a plane ticket and soon arrived in Moscow. He was having a good time there, but one day he got into trouble(麻烦). After lunch, he went to a park outside the city. He noticed a dog following him when he was walking past a house. It was hungry and wanted some food to eat. But Mr Evans had no food in his pockets. He tried to shoo (以嘘声吓走) it away, but it began to bark at him. Just at that moment, he saw a stone on the ground. He tried to pick it up, but he couldn't.
"How strange these Russians are!" Mr Evans said to himself, "They do not tie up (栓住) their dogs, but firmly(牢牢地)tie down the stones!"

questions.text: Mr Evans is<blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that Mr. Evans works in Sydney, which is in Australia.

questions.text: Mr Evans didn't like the<blank>in Australia.
questions.explanation: Mr. Evans says, "I hate the hot weather here," indicating his dislike for the hot weather in Australia.

questions.text: Mr Evans went to Moscow<blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that he bought a plane ticket and arrived in Moscow, implying he traveled by air.

questions.text: The word "bark" means "<blank>".
questions.explanation: "Bark" means "叫" (to make a sound, especially a dog).

questions.text: Mr Evans couldn't pick up the stone because<blank>.

choices.C: the Russians tied their stones to the ground

questions.explanation: Mr. Evans said to himself, "They do not tie up (栓住) their dogs, but firmly(牢牢地)tie down the stones!"

question_sets.context: One afternoon, Kate and her brother, Bob, went out to play. Kate was eight, and Bob was ten. "Let's go to the bridge and we can see fish in the river." said Kate."I don't know…" Bob said. "Mum told us, 'Don't go on the bridge.' She said it's dangerous."Kate said, " I am not afraid. Are you?"They walked onto the bridge and began looking for fish in the river. The bridge was a train bridge. Trains went over the bridge three times a day.The children were standing in the middle of the bridge when they heard a loud noise. " A train is coming!" Bob shouted. "Run!" He ran to the end of the bridge. He was safe.Kate ran, too, but she fell. The train was coming fast. Kate ran towards Bob. She fell again right on the train tracks (铁轨). There was no time to leave. She had to lie down between the tracks. A few seconds later, the train went over the girl, but she was not hurt at all. She stood up and said to Bob, "Don't tell Mum! Don't tell Mum!"At last their mother found out about the story. She was angry because they went on the bridge. But she was happy that Kate was all right.

questions.text: Bob and Kate were <blank>.
questions.explanation: 根据原文"Kate and her brother Bob went out to play"部分, 答案为D.

questions.text: One afternoon they went to the bridge to see <blank>.
questions.explanation: 根据原文"and we can see fish in the river", 因此,答案为B

questions.text: When the train came, the children were <blank>.

choices.A: in the middle of the bridge
choices.B: at the end of the bridge
choices.C: on their way to the  bridge

questions.explanation: 根据原文"The children were standing in the middle of the bridge" 部分以及接着一句"A train is coming", 答案为A.

questions.text: Where was Kate when the train was going over her?

choices.A: She fell again right on the train tracks (铁轨).
choices.C: She had to lie down between the tracks.

questions.explanation: 根据原文"She had to lie down between the tracks" 部分,答案为C.

questions.text: When their mother knew about the story, she was <blank>.
questions.explanation: 根据原文"She was angry because they went on the bridge. But she was happy that Kate was all right." 部分---妈妈即生气又高兴,答案应该为D.

question_sets.context:
Mr. Jenkins is a farmer. One day he drives his truck to town and on the way his truck knocked down a boy and hurt(弄伤) him. He takes the boy to a hospital and he pays a lot of money for that, but the boy's parents want to get more money from him, so they say their son can't lift(举起) his right arm above his head.
Mr. Jenkins' lawyer comes and asks the boy some questions. "Now, my boy," he says, "Mr.Jenkins' truck knocks you down in the street."
"Yes, sir," he says.
"And you can't lift your right arm now?"
"Yes, sir," he says.
"Could you show how high you can lift your right arm?"
Slowly the boy lifts his right arm before his nose.
"Poor boy," says the lawyer, "And how high can you lift before the accident?"
"Oh, I can lift it very high." Says the boy, and the right hand goes up high above his head.

questions.text: Mr. Jenkins' truck knocks down <blank>.
questions.explanation: The text says Mr. Jenkins' truck knocked down a boy.

questions.text: The boy's parents want to get <blank> from him.
questions.explanation: The boy's parents want to get more money.

questions.text: Mr. Jenkins' lawyer asks the boy to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The lawyer asks the boy some questions.

questions.text: The boy says he can't lift his <blank> now.
questions.explanation: The boy says he can't lift his right arm above his head.

questions.text: There is <blank> wrong with the boy.
questions.explanation: The boy pretended to be injured.

question_sets.context:
Wanted: Babysitter
Do you like children? Do you have free time in the afternoon? We need a babysitter for our son. He's 6 years old. Hours are from Monday to Friday, 3:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. Sometimes you will work the whole day at the weekend. Pay is £4 per hour.
For the job, you will:
●look after our son
●Read to him
●Play with him
You will work in our house. We live in London, near City Hall Subway Station.
Please call 2956-4938. Ask for Ms White.

questions.text: The babysitter will work <blank> hours from Monday to Friday together.
questions.explanation: The babysitter works from 3:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. each day from Monday to Friday. That's 3 hours per day for 5 days, totaling 15 hours.

questions.text: What is NOT the babysitter's job?
questions.explanation: The text mentions the babysitter will look after the son, read to him, and play with him. Cleaning the house is not listed as a job.

question_sets.context:
A taxi hit(撞) a truck. A policeman spoke to the taxi driver and to the truck driver. He also spoke to Tom. He was a witness (目击者). This is what they said.

TRUCK DRIVER:I was driving from the airport to Newton. A car crossed the road, so I slowed down. I did not stop. A taxi hit the back of my truck. Nobody was seriously hurt but both cars were damaged(受损害).

TAXI DRIVER:I was driving behind a truck a few kilometers from Newton. The truck stopped suddenly. The driver did not give me a warning (警告). I was driving very slowly. I could not pass the truck because there were two cars coming near from Newton. My taxi hit the truck, and some glass cut my left hand.

TOM:I was watching the traffic about a kilometer from the airport. A truck was going to Newton. It was not going very quickly. There was a taxi about two hundred meters behind the truck. It was going fast. When the truck slowed down, the taxi hit it. The taxi driver was not looking at the truck. He was looking out of the window at something. My friend saw the accident, too.

Tom's friend spoke to the policeman and agreed with Tom.

questions.text: How many people are mentioned (提到) in the story?
questions.explanation: The story mentions the truck driver, taxi driver, policeman, Tom, and Tom's friend, for a total of five people.

questions.text: The truck was hit on the way <blank>.
questions.explanation: The truck driver states, 'I was driving from the airport to Newton'.

questions.text: From the story, we know <blank> didn't tell the truth.
questions.explanation: Tom said the taxi was going fast and the driver was not looking at the truck. The taxi driver claimed he was driving slowly and the truck stopped suddenly without warning.

questions.text: In fact, Tom's friend was also a <blank>.
questions.explanation: The text states that Tom's friend also saw the accident and agreed with Tom, implying he was also a witness.

question_sets.context:
What do we know about the sea? Most of us have seen it. We know that it looks very pretty (漂亮的) when the sun is lighting on it. We also know that it can be less pretty when the weather is terrible. What other things do we know about it?
The first thing is that the sea is very big. Look at a map of the world and you'll find there is less land than the sea. The sea covers (复盖)3/4 of the world. The sea is very deep (深) in some places. Some parts of the sea is nearly 11 kilometres deep! If the highest mountain in the world were put into the sea at the place, there would be two kilometers of water above it.

questions.text: Which of the following is true according to (根据) the passage?

choices.A: The sea always looks very pretty.
choices.C: The sea looks neither pretty nor terrible when it is fine.
choices.D: The sea doesn't look pretty all the time.

questions.explanation: The passage says the sea looks pretty when the sun is lighting on it, and less pretty when the weather is terrible, meaning it's not always pretty.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Main Idea Identification

questions.text: What will you find if you look at a map of the world? <blank>.

choices.A: There's much more water than land.
choices.B: The sea covers 3/4 of the land.
choices.C: The land covers 1/4 of the land.

questions.explanation: The passage states that there is less land than the sea, implying there is more water than land.

questions.text: This passage tells us that <blank>.

choices.A: the sea is very shallow(浅的)
choices.D: the depths (深)of the sea in different places are quite different

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes the depth of the sea, mentioning some parts are nearly 11 kilometers deep.

questions.text: The word "it" in the last sentence of this passage means <blank>.
questions.explanation: The sentence refers to putting the highest mountain into the sea, so 'it' refers to the mountain.

questions.text: The best title of this passage is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage gives general information about the sea, including its size and depth, making 'Something About The Sea' the most appropriate title.

question_sets.context: Mr. Smith gave his wife money every Friday evening. His wife always spent it all the next Wednesday, so that for the next three days she had no money to spend at all. One day Mr. Smith asked her, "But how did you spend all that money?" She answered, "I don't know." So one Friday evening, Mr. Smith gave her money together with an exercise book and a pencil. He said to his wife, "Please write down how you spend the money." Next Tuesday, his wife had no money again. Mr. Smith took the exercise book to see how she had spent it. "I have done what you told me," she said gladly. She had written "Friday, I got 18 pounds from Mr. Smith." on the first page, and on the second page, she wrote, "Tuesday, I have spent it all."

questions.text: Mrs. Smith always spent all the money <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says she spent all the money the next Wednesday.

questions.text: Mr. Smith gave his wife an exercise book and a pencil and asked her <blank>

choices.C: to write down how she spent the money
choices.D: to draw a picture on it

questions.explanation: He asked her to write down how she spent the money.

questions.text: Mrs. Smith was <blank> to do what Mr. Smith asked her to.
questions.explanation: She said gladly, so she was happy.

questions.text: Mr. Smith gave his wife money <blank> a week.
questions.explanation: The passage says every Friday evening.

questions.text: The story tells us that Mrs. Smith was not very <blank>.
questions.explanation: She spent all the money and didn't know how, so she was not careful.

question_sets.context: There are forty-eight students in our class. There are twenty-three boys and twenty-five girls. Some students live near the school, and some others live very far from the school. About half of the students come to school by bike. They often get to school at a quarter to seven. About ten students often come to school by bus. They often go to school very early, too. Another ten students come to school on foot. Their homes are near the school, but they are often late for school, because they get up very late.

questions.text: More than half of the students usually come to school <blank>.
questions.explanation: About half come by bike and ten by bus, so more than half come early.

choices.A: their homes are far from the school
choices.B: they go to school on foot
choices.D: they don't like going to school

questions.explanation: The passage states they are late because they get up very late.

questions.text: About <blank> students go to school by bike.
questions.explanation: About half of forty-eight is about twenty-four, so the closest is twenty.

questions.text: About ten students often come to school by bus because <blank>.

choices.A: their homes are not near the school
choices.D: they want to go to school very early

questions.explanation: Although not directly stated, it can be inferred that they come by bus because their homes are not near.

questions.text: How many students live far from the school?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that 'Some students live near the school, and some others live very far from the school.' Since there are 48 students total, and it's implied that 'some' means a portion less than half, then the 'some others' who live far away would be the remaining amount, leaning towards a higher number like 38.

question_sets.context:
What is the sky? Where is it? How high is it? What lies above it? These questions are difficult to answer, aren't they?
Is the sky blue? The sky has no colour. We know that there is air around the world. When planes fly, they need air to lift their wings. Planes cannot fly very high because when they go higher, the air gets thinner. If we go up about  1,200 kilometres from the earth, we find there is no air.
Perhaps we can answer some of our questions now. The sky is space. In  this space there is only the sun, the moon and all the stars.

questions.text: What is the sky?
questions.explanation: The last paragraph states, 'The sky is space.'

questions.text: The sky <blank>
questions.explanation: The passage mentions, 'The sky has no color.'

questions.text: Planes cannot fly very high because <blank> .

choices.B: the flying machine is not good
choices.C: people will be afraid if the planes fly too high
choices.D: it is not necessary for planes to fly so high

questions.explanation: The passage explains, 'Planes cannot fly very high because when they go higher, the air gets thinner.'

questions.text: If we go up about 1,200 kilometres from the earth, we find <blank> .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions, 'If we go up about 1,200 kilometers from the earth, we find there is no air.'

questions.text: In space there is <blank> .

choices.D: only the sun, the moon and all the stars

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'In this space there is only the sun, the moon and all the stars.'

question_sets.context: Tom lives in a small town in England. He used to stay in England for his holidays. Last year, Tom made a lot of money, so he thought, "I've never been aboard. All my friends have been to France and they enjoyed themselves very much, so this year I'll go there, too." First he went to the capital, Paris, and stayed in an expensive hotel for a few days. On the first morning he went out for a walk. In England people drive on the left, but in France people drive on the right. Tom forgot about this, and while he was crossing a busy street, a bike knocked him down. Tom lay on the ground for a few minutes and then sat up and said, "Where am I? Am I in England or in France?" Just then, an old man selling maps of Paris went past him. When he heard Tom's words, he said to Tom, "Map of the city, sir?"

questions.text: Tom always stayed in England for his holidays_________.

choices.B: because he was so poor that he couldn't afford a long trip
choices.C: before he went to visit Paris, the capital of France
choices.D: before he married a rich woman in his small village

questions.explanation: According to the text, he used to stay in England before visiting Paris.

questions.text: People drive________ in France while _______ in England.

choices.A: on the right; on the left
choices.B: on the right; on the right
choices.C: on the left; on the left
choices.D: on the left; on the right

questions.explanation: The passage states people drive on the right in France and on the left in England.

questions.text: A bike knocked Tom down ___________.

choices.A: while he was walking on the left
choices.B: while he was walking on the right
choices.C: while he was crossing a busy street
choices.D: when he bought a map of Paris from the old man

questions.explanation: The passage says he was knocked down while crossing a busy street.

questions.text: The old man thought that Tom _______.

choices.B: wanted to buy a map of Paris

questions.explanation: The old man offered Tom a map, suggesting he thought Tom wanted to buy one.

questions.text: Which is wrong?

choices.A: Tom has never been aboard except to Paris
choices.B: Tom's friends had a good time in Paris
choices.C: Tom was hurt, but not seriously
choices.D: Tom wished to spend less money in Paris

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't mention Tom's desire to spend less money.

question_sets.context:
In 1826, a Frenchman named Niepce needed pictures for his business. But he was not a good artist. So he invented a very simple camera. He put it in a window of his house and took a picture of his garden. That was the first photo.
The next important date in the history of photography(摄影术)was in 1837.That year, Daguerre, another Frenchman, took a picture of his reading-room. He used a new kind of camera in a different way. In his picture you could see everything very clearly, even the smallest thing.The kind of photo was called a Daguerreotype.
Soon, other people began to use Daguerre's way. Travellers brought back wonderful photos from all round the world. People took pictures of famous buildings, cities and mountains.
In about 1840, photography was developed. Then photographers could take pictures of people and moving things. That was not simple. The photographers had to carry a lot of film and other machines.But this did not stop them, for example, some in the United States worked so hard.
Mathew Brady was a famous American photographer. He took many pictures of great people. The pictures were unusual because they were very lifelike(栩栩如生).
Photographers also became one kind of art by the end of the 19thcentury. Some photos were not just taken of the real world, they showed ideas and feelings, like other kinds of art.

questions.text: The first photo taken by Niepce was a picture of ________.
questions.explanation: The passage states Niepce took a picture of his garden.

questions.text: The Daguerreotype was _________.
questions.explanation: The passage describes the Daguerreotype as a kind of photo.

questions.text: If a photographer wanted to take pictures of moving things in the year of 1840, he had to ______________.

choices.D: take a lot of film and something else with him

questions.explanation: The text mentions photographers had to carry a lot of film and other machines.

questions.text: Mathew Brady ____________.

choices.B: was famous for his unusual pictures
choices.D: took many pictures of moving people

questions.explanation: Mathew Brady's pictures were unusual and lifelike, making him famous.

questions.text: This passage tells us _______.

choices.B: how to show your ideas and feelings in pictures
choices.C: how to take pictures in the world

questions.explanation: The passage primarily describes the development of photography.

question_sets.context:
We all need to exercise. Doctors say it is good for us. It makes your heart and body strong. It also gives you more energy. And you will feel better about yourself. lt's best to exercise twice a week. Twenty minutes each time is enough.
There are many ways to exercise. You can walk,run,play sports,or swim. Many people go to special places to exercise.
They are ca1led "fitness centers." These places have a lot of equipment. Some People buy equipment for their homes. But it is very expensive.
Exercising can be fun. Friends can exercise together at a fitness center. Or,they can play sports together. How do you exercise ?

questions.text: What is the main idea?

choices.B: Playing sports is a good way to exercise.

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes the importance of exercise for everyone's health.

questions.text: We should exercise <blank>.
questions.explanation: It's best to exercise twice a week.

questions.text: At fitness centers,<blank>.

choices.B: people can do many kinds of exercising

questions.explanation: These places have a lot of equipment.

questions.text: Which of these kinds of exercising is not in the article?
questions.explanation: You can walk, run, play sports, or swim.

questions.text: Which of these sentences about exercising is true?

choices.B: Exercise is good for your heart.

questions.explanation: Doctors say it is good for us. It makes your heart and body strong.

question_sets.context: I never get up early on Sundays. Sometimes I stay in bed until lunch time. Last Sunday I got up very late. I looked out of the window. "What a bad day!" I thought, "It's raining again." Then I went to the kitchen. Just at that moment the telephone rang. It was my aunt Jenny, "I'm at the railway station. I'm coming to see you ." "But I'm having breakfast!" I said. "My God." she said, "Do you always get up so late? It's one o'clock!"

questions.text: The writer was <blank> when Jenny rang him up.
questions.explanation: The writer said: 'I'm having breakfast!'

questions.text: <blank> he stays in bed until lunch time.
questions.explanation: The writer said: 'Sometimes I stay in bed until lunch time.'

questions.text: Jenny came to see the writer <blank>
questions.explanation: The writer said: 'I'm at the railway station.'

questions.text: Jenny was very <blank> to hear the writer's words.
questions.explanation: Jenny said: 'Do you always get up so late? It's one o'clock!'

questions.text: The weather was <blank> that day last Sunday.
questions.explanation: The writer said: 'It's raining again.'

question_sets.context: There are twelve months in a year. February has twenty-eight days, but it has twenty - nine days once every four years. And that year is called the leap year. Four of the months have thirty days such as April, June, September and November. The other months have thirty-one days. 2000 was a leap year. What about the year 2004? How many days are there in a leap year? Do you know?

questions.text: How many days are there in January?
questions.explanation: The text says 'The other months have thirty-one days'. January is one of the other months.

questions.text: How many days were there in February, 2002?
questions.explanation: 2002 is not a leap year, so February has 28 days.

questions.text: How often do we have a leap year?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'February has twenty-nine days once every four years.'

questions.text: How many days are there in a leap year?
questions.explanation: A leap year has one extra day. Thus, it has 366 days.

questions.text: How many weeks are there in a leap year?
questions.explanation: A leap year has 366 days. There are 52 weeks in general. The answer would be B.

question_sets.context:
Betty is an American school girl. She is very happy because her parents will
take her to China for a visit. They are going to fly from New York on June 30
and get to Beijing on July 1. They will stay at Lido Holiday Inn. Their Chinese
friends will show them around Beijing. They are going to visit the Palace
Museum, the Summer Palace, the Temple of Heaven and the Great Wall. They will
also visit some Chinese homes and try some Chinese food. They will spend a week
in Beijing and then go to Xi'an, Guilin and some other places for sightseeing.
The whole trip will take three weeks and she is sure she will have a great time
in China.

questions.explanation: According to the text, Betty is going to visit China with her parents.

questions.text: After they visit Beijing , they will go to <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the text, they will go to Xi'an and Guilin after visiting Beijing.

questions.text: How long will the whole trip take?
questions.explanation: According to the text, the whole trip will take three weeks.

question_sets.context: In the United States, parents often give a baby the name of its father, mother or another family member. Some people just choose a name that's popular at that time. Two hundred years ago, 50% of boy babies in England were named William, John or Thomas, and 50% of girl babies were named Elizabeth, Mary or Anne. Some of these names are still popular(流行的),but other names are popular, too. Today, parents sometimes give their babies the names of famous athletes(运动员),film stars, characters from literature or TV shows.

questions.text: In the USA, parents give a baby the name <blank>.

choices.B: of its parents or another family member

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that parents often give a baby the name of its father, mother, or another family member.

questions.text: <blank>, 50% of girl babies were named Elizabeth, Mary, Anne.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'Two hundred years ago' in relation to the names Elizabeth, Mary, and Anne.

questions.explanation: The parents hope the names are popular forever.

questions.text: Today some babies' names are from film stars, literature, TV shows and <blank>.
questions.explanation: The last sentence mentions that babies' names are sometimes taken from famous athletes, film stars, literature, or TV shows.
