questions.explanation: Margaret is a girl's name

question_sets.context:
Scientists are trying to make the deserts (沙漠) into good land again. They want to bring water to the deserts, so people can live and grow food. They are learning a lot about the deserts. But more and more of the earth (地) is becoming deserts all the time. Scientists may not be able to change the deserts. Scientists think that people make deserts. People are doing bad things to the earth.
Some places on the earth don't get very much rain, But they still don't become deserts. This is because some green plants are growing there. Small green plants and grass are very helpful to dry places. Plants don't let the hot sun make the earth even drier. Plants don't let the wind blow the earth (泥土) away, When a little of rain falls, the plants hold the water. Without plants, the land can become a desert much more easily.

questions.text: Why can the land become a desert?

choices.A: Some places don't get very much rain.
choices.B: Plants don't let the hot sun make the earth even drier.
choices.C: People don't keep the earth well.
choices.D: Scientists haven't learnt enough about the deserts.

questions.explanation: The passage states that scientists think people make deserts by doing bad things to the earth.

questions.text: Scientists <blank> to make the deserts into good land again.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates scientists are trying to make deserts good again and are learning a lot about them, which is synonymous with studying.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true?

choices.A: The land never stops becoming deserts.
choices.B: Scientists ask people to live in the deserts and grow food there.
choices.C: People do bad things to the earth.
choices.D: Scientists may not be able to change the deserts.

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't state that scientists ask people to live in deserts. They want to bring water so people *can* live there, but it is not the same.

questions.text: Why are green plants and grass helpful?

choices.B: They can stop the wind from blowing the earth away.
choices.C: They can keep the earth wet(湿的)

questions.explanation: The passage states that plants hold water and prevent the wind from blowing the earth away, which helps keep the earth wet.

questions.text: Which of the following is the best title (题目) for the passage (短文)?

choices.D: The Desert, the Tree and the Water

questions.explanation: While all options relate to the passage, 'The Desert Problem' best encompasses the overall theme of the passage.

question_sets.context:
A woodcutter(伐木工) was working in the forest one day when he found a box full of gold coins. Unfortunately, his wife was the kind of woman who could not keep a secret. Somehow, he knew, he had to prevent(阻止) her from talking about the gold.
He thought about this for a long time, then had an idea.
" I found something in the forest", he told his wife, "come with me and I'll show you.".His wife followed him into the forest and soon they came to a tree." Look at that!" the woodcutter said to his wife, and pointed to the tree. "There's a fish growing on that branch!" His wife was surprised ,especially when he climbed up the tree and brought down the fish for her to see.They walked on and soon came to the river. "I'll just pull in my net and see what I've caught", the woodcutter said.
He pulled in his net and inside there were several hares(野兔). "How interesting!" he said "there are now hares in the river." After that, they came to where the woodcutter had found the box of gold. "Look, wife", he said "this is what I have found. A box of gold coins."The next day, his wife could not stop herself from telling her friends about all the wonderful things she had seen.Of course, nobody believe her!

questions.text: Where did the woodcutter find the box of gold?

choices.C: In the forest where he was working
choices.D: On his farm fields, where he was farming

questions.explanation: The first sentence states that the woodcutter found the box while working in the forest.

questions.text: The woodcutter's wife couldn't keep a secret, could she?
questions.explanation: The second sentence states that the wife was the kind of woman who could not keep a secret.

questions.text: Where do you usually see hares?
questions.explanation: Hares are typically found in forests, not rivers, streets, or the sea.

questions.text: Why did his wife tell her friends what happened? Because <blank>

choices.B: she wondered why the hares were in the river and fish was in the tree

questions.explanation: The last sentence says "The next day, his wife could not stop herself from telling her friends about all the wonderful things she had seen."

questions.text: Which statement is right?

choices.B: Fish often lives on a tree.
choices.C: Hares often live in the river.

questions.explanation: The woodcutter cleverly tricked his wife.

question_sets.context: Ladies and gentlemen, I hope you are enjoying your flight(航程) to Milan this morning. Now we are passing over the nice city of Geneva, in the west of Switzerland. If you are sitting on the left side of the plane, you can see the city from the window. We are flying at a height(高度) of 10,000 metres and we are flying at a speed(速度) of 700 km/h. I'm afraid the weather in Milan this morning is not very good. It's raining and there's a light wind blowing. Enjoy the rest of your flight. Thank you for flying with us today.

questions.text: They are flying to Milan <blank>.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. The passage states they are flying to Milan 'this morning'.

questions.text: Geneva City is in the <blank> of Switzerland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. The passage says Geneva is 'in the west of Switzerland'.

questions.text: They can see Geneva City <blank> of the plane.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The passage mentions 'If you are sitting on the left side of the plane, you can see the city'.

questions.text: The plane is flying <blank> metres an hour at the moment.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The plane is flying at a height of '10,000' metres and a speed of '700 km/h'.

questions.text: What's the weather like in Milan this morning?

choices.A: It's rainy and there's a light wind.
choices.C: It's snowing and there's a light wind.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. The passage says 'It's raining and there's a light wind blowing'.

question_sets.context:
A young passenger was looking everywhere for his ticket because the conductor was coming to check the ticket. He was looking for it in all the pockets of his coat and trousers. To the other passengers' surprise, they found the young man had the ticket in his mouth. The conductor quickly pulled the ticket in his mouth, punched(打孔) it and then gave it back to the young man. When the conductor went away, all the other passengers couldn't help laughing. At last one of them said to him, "I am sure you felt foolish just now, looking everywhere for your ticket when it was right in your mouth all the time."
"Foolish?" answered the passenger. "I was chewing(嚼) the date off."

questions.text: From the story we know that the young passenger <blank>.

choices.B: was looking for a lost ticket
choices.C: didn't buy a ticket for his trip
choices.D: didn't remember where he had put his ticket

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. The passenger was chewing the date off, implying it was an old ticket.

questions.text: The other passengers laughed because <blank>.

choices.A: the young passenger lost his ticket
choices.B: the young passenger gave his ticket to another passenger
choices.C: they saw the ticket was just in the passenger's mouth
choices.D: the conductor went away without asking the passenger

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. The passengers were surprised to find the ticket in his mouth.

questions.text: It is clear that the conductor <blank>.

choices.A: knew the young man had no money for a ticket
choices.B: didn't know the young man had lost his ticket
choices.C: knew why the young man had the ticket in his mouth
choices.D: didn't know why the young man put the ticket in his mouth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The conductor didn't know the real reason the ticket was in the passenger's mouth.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the conductor?

choices.A: He thought the young man was too lazy.
choices.B: He thought the young man was forgetful.
choices.C: He knew the young man had lost the ticket.
choices.D: He knew the young man would get off at the next station.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. The conductor may have thought the young man was forgetful for not remembering where the ticket was.

questions.text: The best title(标题) for the story is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. It reflects the main point: the passenger was chewing the date off to reuse an old ticket.

question_sets.context:
A lot of boys and girls in Western(西方的)countries are wearing the same kind of clothes, and many of them have long hair, so it is often difficult to tell if they are boys or girls.
One day, and old man went for a walk in a park in Washington, and when he was tired, he sat down on a chair. A young person was standing on the other side of the pool(水池).
"Oh!" the old man said to the person sitting beside him on the chair. "Do you see that person with the glasses and long hair? Is it a boy or a girl?"  "A girl," said the neighbour(邻人). "She is my daughter." " Oh!" the old man said quickly. "Please_forgive_me, I did not know you were her mother." "I'm not," said the other person. "I'm her father."

questions.text: What did the old man see on the other side of the pool?
questions.explanation: The text states 'A young person was standing on the other side of the pool'.

questions.text: "Is it a boy or a girl?" The word  "it" here means <blank>.
questions.explanation: The old man is referring to the person he sees across the pool, asking if 'that person' is a boy or a girl.

questions.text: The meaning of the word "forgive" is <blank>.
questions.explanation: "Forgive" means to pardon or excuse someone for an offense or mistake, which translates to "原谅" in Chinese.

questions.text: The old man thought his neighbour was <blank>.
questions.explanation: The old man apologized for not knowing the neighbour was 'her mother'.

questions.text: The old man thought that his neighbour was the girl's mother because his neighbour <blank>.
questions.explanation: Because the old man was confused about the gender of the person across the pool with long hair, he thought the neighbour was the girl's mother possibly because he saw similarities between them.

question_sets.context:
A Hard-working Student
This story is about a young student. She worked very hard at her lessons. She was too busy to have a rest. At last, she became ill, and couldn't go to sleep. Every night, when she went to bed, she closed her eyes and tried to sleep. But the more she tried, the more she stayed awake.
After a while she went to see a doctor, "I just can't go to sleep at night. What should I do?" "I have a suggestion(建议)," said the doctor, "Try counting numbers. By the time you reach one thousand, you will be asleep. I'm sure of it."
The next day the student returned to the doctor's office. "Well," said the doctor, "How are you today? Did you try my suggestion?" The student still looked tired. "Yes," she said, "I tried counting one, two, three...up to one thousand. But when I reached five hundred and sixty-nine, I began to feel sleepy. I had to get up and drink some coffee so that(以便) I could go on counting up to one thousand. But then I still couldn't fall asleep."

questions.text: Why couldn't the young student go to sleep?

choices.A: She was worried about her lessons.
choices.C: She had worked too hard and became ill.
choices.D: There was a lot of noise.

questions.explanation: The passage states that she became ill and couldn't sleep because she worked too hard.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Cause & Effect

questions.text: What did the doctor ask the young student to do while she was lying in bed?

choices.B: To count numbers while she was lying in bed.
choices.C: To count numbers before she went to bed.
choices.D: To read some books on the bed.

questions.explanation: The doctor suggested counting numbers while in bed.

questions.text: The underlined word "awake" in paragraph 1 means "<blank>".
questions.explanation: "Awake" means not sleeping.

questions.text: What did she do after she felt sleepy?

choices.C: She got up and drank some tea.
choices.D: She got up to have some coffee.

questions.explanation: She drank coffee when she felt sleepy.

questions.text: The coffee made her <blank>, so she still couldn't fall asleep.
questions.explanation: Coffee made her excited, preventing sleep.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Cause & Effect

question_sets.context:
Where Am I
Nat lived in a small town in England. He always stayed in England for his holidays, but then last year he thought, "I've never been to any place outside this country. All the friends go to Spain and they like it very much. So this year I am going there, too."
First he went to Madrid and stayed in a small hotel (旅馆) for a few days. On the first morning, he went out for a walk. In England, people drive on the left. But in Spain, they drive on the right. Nat forgot about this. While (正当) he was walking along a busy street, a bike came before him and knocked (撞) him down. Nat lay(躺) on the ground for a second and then he sat up and said, "Where Am I?"

question_sets.context: A man went to buy a piece of meat. As he didn't know how to cook meat, he asked the butcher (屠夫) to tell him the way of cooking it. The butcher told him how to cook it, "But I can't remember your words," the man said. "Will you please write them down for me?" The butcher was kind enough to write them down for him. The man went home happily with the meat in his hand and the note (字条) in his pocket (口袋). A dog followed him on the way. It jumped at him, took the meat away and ran off. The man stood there, not knowing what to do. Then he laughed and said, "never mind. You don't know how to eat it. The note is still in my pocket."

question_sets.context:
It was Jimmy's birthday, and he was five years old. He got quite a lot of nice birthday presents from his family, and one of them was a beautiful drum(鼓).
"Who gave him that thing?" Jimmy's father said when he saw it. "His grandfather did," answered Jimmy's mother.
"Oh," said his father. Of course Jimmy liked his drum very much. He made a terrible noise with it, but his father didn't mind. His father was working during the day and Jimmy was in bed when he got home in the evening, so he didn't hear the noise.
But one of the neighbours didn't like the noise at all, so one morning a few days later, she took a sharp knife and went to Jimmy's house while he was hitting his drum. She said to him, "Hello, Jimmy, do you know, there is something very nice inside your drum? Here is a knife. Open the drum and let's find it."

questions.explanation: He got quite a lot of nice birthday presents from his family

question_sets.context:
Tom lived by himself a long way from town. He hardly went to town, but one day he went into town to buy a few things. After he bought them, he went into a restaurant and sat down at a table. When he looked around, he saw some old people put glasses on before reading their newspapers. So after lunch he decided to go to a shop to buy himself one pair, too. He walked along the road, and soon found a shop.
The man in the shop let him try on a lot of glasses, but Tom always said, "No, I can't read with these."
The man became puzzled (迷惑的) , and he said, "Excuse me, but can you read?"
"No, of course I can't!" Tom said angrily. "If I could read before, do you think I would come here to buy your glasses?"

questions.text: Tom lived <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that "Tom lived by himself a long way from town," which means he lived in the country.

questions.text: Tom didn't go to town <blank>.
questions.explanation: The second sentence says "He hardly went to town", indicating he didn't go to town often.

questions.text: Why did Tom decide to buy a pair of glasses?

choices.A: Because he thought if he bought them, he could read.

questions.explanation: Tom saw old people use glasses to read and assumed that glasses would enable him to read, even though he couldn't read before.

questions.text: Tom went to the shop to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Tom went into town "to buy a few things" and then "decided to go to a shop to buy himself one pair, too."

questions.text: What do you think of Tom?
questions.explanation: Tom's assumption that buying glasses would enable him to read, despite never being able to read before, indicates foolishness.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Tone & Attitude

question_sets.context:
One day a visitor came to Walley's house. "I am your cousin from London," he said, "and I have brought you a goose to celebrate the visit." Walley was very excited. He asked his wife to cook the goose and made a fine dinner.
The next day another visitor arrived. "I'm the friend of the man who brought you the goose." He said. Wally invited him in and gave him a good meal. The next day another visitor arrived, and said he was the friend of the friend of the man who brought the goose. Again Wally invited him for a meal. However, he was getting annoyed. His house seemed to be a restaurant.
Another visitor came, and said he was the friend of the friend of the friend of the man who brought the goose. Wally invited him to eat dinner with him. His wife brought some soup to the table and the visitor tasted it. "What kind of soup is this? "asked the visitor. "It tastes just like warm water." "Ah!" said Wally, "That is the soup of the soup of the soup of the goose."

questions.text: How many of the visitors brought a goose?
questions.explanation: Only the first visitor, who claimed to be Wally's cousin from London, brought a goose.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

questions.explanation: "Annoyed" means feeling or showing irritation.

questions.explanation: Wally served a soup that tasted like warm water, discouraging further visits.

question_sets.context:
Jack is a twenty-year-old young man. Two years ago, when he finished middle school, he found work in a shop. Usually he works until ten o'clock in the evening. He is very tired when he gets home. After a quick supper he goes to bed and soon falls asleep. His grandma who lives downstairs is satisfied with him.
One day, on his way home, he met Mary. They were both happy. He asked the girl to his house, she agreed happily. He bought some fruit and drinks for her. And they talked about their school, teachers, classmates and their future. They talked for a long time."Have a look at your watch, please," said the girl. "What time is it now?""Sorry, something is wrong with my watch," said Jack. "Where's yours?""I left it at home."Jack thought for a moment and found a way. He began to stamp his foot on the floor, "Bang! Bang! Bang!"The sound woke his grandma up. The old woman shouted downstairs, "It's twelve o'clock in the night, Jack. Why are you still jumping upstairs?"

questions.text: Jack was <blank> when he finished middle school.
questions.explanation: Jack is twenty years old now, and the text says it happened 'two years ago'. So he should be 18 when he finished middle school.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.explanation: The text states that Jack's grandma is satisfied with him, implying he is quiet and doesn't disturb her.

question_sets.context:
When you are feeling unhappy or forget how great you are, these are six ways to make you feel good about yourself.
1) Look in the mirror and say to yourself, "I am a special person and there's no one in the world like me. I can do anything!" It may not sound so good, but it really works!
2) Do something nice for someone. Helping others always makes you feel good.
3) Smile! Be friendly to people you meet. Look for the good things in your friends and family.
4) Learn something new! Have you always wanted to decorate your own room or learn how to swim? New challenges are fun and give you a sense of accomplishment when you have finished.
5) Read and start a diary. Turn off the TV and let your imagination fly! Write down your thoughts, dreams or anything you want! Writing always helps to express your feelings.
6) Stay with your family. We all need our family time. Talk with your Mum or Dad or maybe even your cousin.

questions.explanation: "A sense of accomplishment" means a feeling of having done something well.

question_sets.context: Mr. King was the manager of a hotel. One weekend all the hotels in the city were full because there was a large meeting. On Friday night, three men came into the hotel and asked for rooms. Mr. King said there were no rooms ready because of the meeting. The men were unhappy.Mr. King wanted to help them. He remembered that Room 418, a very small room, was empty. He asked them if they would share a room. The three men said they would. Mr. King said the room would be thirty dollars: ten for each one. Each man gave him the money and then went up to the room.Mr. King soon began to feel sorry. "Thirty dollars is a lot to ask as price for that small room." he thought. He called his assistant over and said, "Here is five dollars. Take it to the men in Room 418. I asked too much for their room."The assistant took the money. While he was on the way there, he started to think, "How can three men divide five dollars? I'll give them each only one dollar and keep the two dollars for myself. The men will be happy to get something back, and Mr. King will never know." So the assistant returned one dollar to each man.Each man had at first paid ten dollars. After the assistant returned them one dollar each, each had paid nine. There were three men, $ 9Ⅹ3 = $ 27. The assistant kept $ 2.$ 27 + $ 2 = $ 29. Where is the missing dollar?

question_sets.context:
Mygrandfather was a fine man. I love him very much. But one day I told him a lie. I can not tell you now what the lie was. I was only seven years old then.
Grandfather was not cross with me
"Ask Jim to get a long ladder," he said. "My boy now jumps from the tops of houses, up to the roof".
Jim brought the big ladder. Then Grandfather said, "My boy now jumps from the tops of houses. The ladder is for him."
I knew at once what he was telling me. I had often heard the old saying," A lie is a jump from the top of a house"
I said nothing .But I felt like crying.
The minutes went by. What would people think about the ladder? It stood by the front door. I was afraid it might be there a long time. I had to do something!
At last I went to Grandfather. He was reading a book. I went to him and put my face on his arm.
"Grandfather," I said," I will not tell a lie again. We don't need the ladder now."
Grandfather seemed very happy once again. He called Jim. "Take the ladder away," he said,"My boy does not jump from the tops of houses."
His words made me happy once again.

questions.text: From the reading we cannot know <blank>.

choices.A: whether the boy told a lie
choices.C: what Grandfather did with the boy

questions.explanation: The text does not specify what the lie was.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: The word "cross" in the reading means <blank>.
questions.explanation: "Cross" means angry or annoyed.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Synonym Replacement

choices.A: see whether the boy could jump from the top of a house
choices.B: help the boy to climb to the top of the house

questions.explanation: The ladder was a symbolic way for the grandfather to show the boy the seriousness of lying.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Author’s Purpose

questions.explanation: The boy was worried that the ladder would reveal his lie.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.explanation: The story ends with the boy confessing and the grandfather forgiving him, leading to a happy resolution.

question_sets.context:
Almost all people like flowers. Some people like flowers because of their smells, shapes, colors and so on. Others like flowers because they think different flowers mean different things. Flowers have their own language. For example, red roses mean "love" and sunflowers mean "loyalty". So people in more than 100 countries have chosen their own national flowers which say something about their countries' spirit. In 1994, China talked about choosing a national flower. Some people liked the peony but others liked the plum blossom. They couldn't agree with each other. So it has not been decided yet.
People like to buy different flowers in different seasons. Where do all the beautiful flowers in shops come from? They may come from far away, so their price is higher.
a. Farmers grow flowers in their fields.
b. Planes or trains or buses take the flowers to different places.
c. Flower shopkeepers buy flowers from the flower markets. They look at the flowers and throw away the broken or bad ones. They cut the flowers to make them more beautiful.
d. You go to buy the flowers in the shops. When you buy a flower, you're paying lots of people: the farmer, the driver of the plane or train or bus. The seller in the flower market and the flower shopkeeper.
So you'd better keep your flowers from far away for a long time. But how? Why not dry them? It's easy! Sand drying is a way. Dry, clean sand is one of the oldest things for drying flowers. And it's one of the cheapest.
・Fill a box half-way with sand.
・Put the flowers on top of the sand.
・Put the box in a warm, dry place.
・Leave the flowers there for one to three weeks.
・Take them out and they will be dry.

questions.text: The underlined words "national flowers" most probably means <blank>.
questions.explanation: "National flowers" are the flowers that represent a country.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Synonym Replacement

questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

choices.A: no flower can show China's spirit
choices.B: China hasn't talked about choosing one
choices.C: nobody agrees to choose the national flower

question_sets.context:
A middle school student was forced to have his long hair cut off in a middle school in Foshan City, Guangdong Province. It was being talked a lot among teachers and students in Foshan city.
All schools have their own rules. In most schools, boy students are not allowed to wear long hair while girls are not allowed to dye their hair. And most school rules say that students should wear their school uniforms at school. No students can disobey these rules so that students can grow healthily at school.
Most students are for these rules. But some students disagree them strongly. They think that boy students wear long hair doesn't mean that they are not good students. Teenagers want to show of their own personality. They like fashion. They admire famous stars, even the stars' hairstyle and clothes.
A girl student thinks that she looks much more beautiful when she wears brown hair. So she had her dark hair dyed brown one day. When she went back to school the next day, the teacher of her class got very angry with her. When she was asked why she had her hair dyed, she just answered, "I like it." She says that she works hard at her lessons and does well in every subject. She just doesn't know why the teacher doesn't allow her to dye her hair while women teachers can dye their long hair. Some boys think that their stars often wear long hair, so they think that they will look cool too if they wear long hair and wear the hairstyle like their favorite stars.
It is not wrong for teenagers to admire stars, wear their favorite clothes or hairstyle. However, a school has its own rules for all the students to follow so that the school can be in good order. Students should not break the rules at school. But if they are outside school, they have their right to wear what they like.

questions.text: What is the passage mainly about?
questions.explanation: The passage discusses school rules.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Summarization

questions.text: What does the word "dye" probably mean?
questions.explanation: "Dye" means to color.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Synonym Replacement

questions.text: Which of the following may be NOT a school rule?

choices.B: School girls can't dye their hair.
choices.C: School boys can't wear long hair.
choices.D: Women teachers can't dye their hair.

questions.explanation: Women teachers are allowed to dye their hair.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Why can't the students break the school rules?

choices.A: School should be in good order.
choices.B: If they students break the school rules, they may become bad.
choices.C: The teachers want the students to grow healthily.

questions.explanation: All the above.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Cause & Effect

question_sets.context: Mr Jones had a few day's holiday, so he said, "I'm going to thecountry by train". He put on his best clothes, took a small bag,went to the station (火车站) and got into the train. He had abeautiful hat, and he often put his head out of the window during(在…期间) the trip (旅程) and looked at the mountains. But the wind(风) took his hat off.Mr Jones quickly took his old bag and threw that out of thewindow, too.The other people in the carriage (车厢) laughed. "Is your baggoing to bring your beautiful hat back?" they said."No," Mr Jones answered, "but there is no name and no address(地址) in my hat, and there's name and an address on the bag.Someone is going to find both of them near each other, and he's goingto send me the bag and hat."

question_sets.context: Most children like watching TV. It's very interesting. By watching TV they can see and learn a lot and know many things about their country and the world. Of course ,they can also learn over the radio. But they can learn better and more easily on TV. Why? Because they can hear and watch at the same time. But they can't see anything over the radio. TV helps to open children's eyes. It helps to open their minds , too. They learn newer and better ways of doing things. Many children watch TV only on Saturday or Sunday evening. They are always busy with their lessons. But a few children watch TV every night. They go to bed very late. They can' t have a good rest. How about you, my young friend?

question_sets.context: It was May 5. It was Mary's birthday. She came home, and saw a card on the table. It said, "There's a present for you, Mary. Go and look for it in your room." Mary ran to her room. Her parents were watching her. They were smiling. On her bed she saw a new red box. She thought, "What's in the box?" She opened it. There was nothing but a card in it. Mary took it out and read:"Dear Mary, I'm your present. My first letter is in the world ' book' ,but not in ' look' .My second letter is in ' ink' ,but not in ' thank' .You can find my third letter in both ' ink'  and ' book' .And my last letter is in ' she' ,but no in ' ship' .What am I?"Mary thought hard. B―I―K―E! She smiled and said, "Aha, I know, Mum. But where is it?" Her mother said, "Look at the back of the card." Mary turned it over and read, "Come and look for me in the garden."Mary hurried to the garden. There under a big tree she found her present―a nice new bike!"Happy birthday, Mary!"her parents said."Thank you, Mum and Dad."

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that 'It was May 5. It was Mary's birthday.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.explanation: The passage concludes with Mary finding 'her present—a nice new bike!' in the garden.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

choices.A: on the back of the card

questions.explanation: The passage concludes with Mary finding 'her present' under a big tree 'in the garden'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

questions.text: Mary's parents were ______.
questions.explanation: Mary's parents prepared the cards and the bike for her, and were smiling while watching her, showing that they were kind.

question_sets.context:
A Farmer was very tired after work. He sat near a big tree. The sun was very hot but it was very cool under the tree. A hare(野兔) ran out of a hole . When it saw the farmer ,it was afraid. It turned round and tried to run away. It ran so hurriedly that its head knocked against another tree. It died soon. The farmer was very happy to see it. He picked up the dead hare and took it home for dinner. He was very happy.
On the following day, he did not go to work , he sat under the same tree to wait for hares to come .No one but a fool would do such a thing .

question_sets.context:
The coldest and most difficult place in the world in which to live is Antarctica. Antarctica is the land of snow and ice near the South Pole. Most people do not think there is much life in the icy waters around it. They are wrong.
Antarctica's seas are full of life. There are many kinds of fishes, water birds, seals and whales. They eat the thick plant life in the sea and the smaller water animals. Some whales, for example, eat more than a ton of food every day.
The most famous animal of Antarctica is the penguin. It struts around the icy as if it were a movie star walking down the street.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, 'Antarctica's seas are full of life. There are many kinds of fishes, water birds, seals and whales.' Therefore, around Antarctica there are many animals.

questions.text: The word "struts" in the last paragraph means<blank>.
questions.explanation: The word 'struts' means 'walks proudly'.

question_sets.context:
When you are next in Hawaii, be sure to stay at the Garden Hotel. Whether you come on business or on holiday, you will find everything as comfortable and as convenient as you would expect in a first-class international hotel.
Every bedroom has its own private bathroom, telephone, wall-to-wall carpeting and colorful, modern materials and furniture in the local style.
In the Mitsui Restaurant, you can choose your meals from as wide a variety of dishes, both Eastern and European, as you will find anywhere in the country. In the Beach Bar, you can drink with your family and friends in air-conditioned comfort, to the music of internationally known musicians. Or you can take your drink outside into the beautiful garden that gives the hotel its name, or to the tables that surround the swimming pool. Throughout the hotel, you will find the service is both friendly and efficient.
The Garden Hotel is right on the beach, only five minutes from Hawaii's modern shopping center. Here you will find all that money can buy, at prices you can afford.

question_sets.context: During the day we work and play and at night we sleep. Our bodies rest while we sleep. In the morning we are ready to work and play again. It is while we are asleep that our bodies grow most. When children feel tired and angry, they usually need more sleep. We can get our lessons better, and we feel better, too, when we have had plenty of rest. Boys and girls, eight or nine years old, need ten hours of sleep every night. Our bodies need plenty of air when we sleep. If we do not get enough fresh air we wake up feeling tired. While in bed we must not cover our heads. If we do, our lungs(肺) will not get enough fresh air. If we open our windows at night we can have plenty of fresh air. Cool air is better than warm air. Boys and girls must get plenty of sleep if they want to grow and be strong.

questions.text: Our bodies grow most while we are ______.
questions.explanation: The text says 'It is while we are asleep that our bodies grow most'.

questions.explanation: The text says 'Cool air is better than warm air'.

questions.explanation: The text says 'If we open our windows at night we can have plenty of fresh air'.

questions.text: The writer is trying to tell boys and girls ______.
questions.explanation: The main idea is to emphasize the importance of getting enough sleep.

question_sets.context: The moon looks bigger than the stars at night. But in fact, it is smaller than any of them. The moon looks big to us, because it is closer to us than any other star. The moon goes around the earth. It makes one trip about four weeks. The moon is a round ball and looks beautiful. Don't you think so? Now people know quite a lot about the moon. There is no air or water on the moon so there are not any tree or animals, or people on the moon. The moon gets its light from the sun, but some places on the moon are quite dark. The days on the moon get hotter than boiling water. The nights get colder than the North Pole on the earth.

question_sets.context:
Last Sunday the Greens went to climb the hill. When they got home, It was very late. Mr. Green opened the front door and they both went into the house. Because it was too late, Mrs. Green turned on the light. Just they wanted to come into the bedroom, Mrs. Green suddenly said, " Listen, There is someone in our bedroom." They stood quietly outside the door. They could hear some voices in the room.
"There are two men in it. They are talking." So Mr. Green began to shout."Who is there?" But no one answered. Mr. Green opened the door quickly and turned on the light. There was no one there. Mr. Green found something and laughed. The radio was still on! "I forgot to turn it off this morning." Mr. Green said.

question_sets.context:
The sun is a huge, hot, bright star. It is important because without it there would be no life on earth. The sun gives us light and heat.
All living things need light and heat from the sun to live. Plants need light and heat to grow. They use the light from the sun to make food. We can't make our own food, but plants can. All the food we eat comes from plants in a food chain (链) which stars with the sun. For example,
Animals need sunlight, too. Just like us, their food come from a food chain which begins with the sun and the plants.
sun →leaf →caterpillar(毛虫) →bird
sun →seaweed (海藻) →small fish → whale (鲸)
Sunlight means we can see during the day. If there was no sun, it would be dark all the time. Even when the sky is cloudy, the sunlight is very strong and it shines through (穿越) the clouds.

questions.text: Which words tell us what the sun is like?

choices.B: Because the sun can't give us light all day long.
choices.C: Because the sunlight can shine through the clouds.
choices.D: Because we can't see at night.

questions.explanation: The passage says 'Even when the sky is cloudy, the sunlight is very strong and it shines through the clouds'.

questions.text: All the food we eat comes from <blank>. And it starts with the <blank>.
questions.explanation: All the food we eat comes from plants in a food chain which starts with the sun.

question_sets.context:
Dear Sir,
I have to travel every day from Souk Road to the airport. Two buses travel along this route (路线): the number 49 and number 16. But by the time the number 16 bus reaches Souk Road it is always full, so I can't get on it. I have to wait for the number 49, because sometimes there are empty seats on it.
The timetable says that there are buses from Souk Road to the airport every ten minutes. If this is so, why do I have to wait half an hour for a bus nearly every day?
The regulations (规章) say that if there are empty seats on a bus, the bus must stop at every stop where people are waiting. Why do the half-empty buses go straight past me when I am standing at the bus stop?
The regulations say that no bus may carry more than 40 seated passengers and 20 standing passengers. Yesterday I was the first to get off the bus when it reached the airport. I counted the other passengers as they got off. There were 129 of them.
It is clear that our bus companies break the regulations and think little of their passengers. Can nothing be done make your service (服务) better?
Yours,
Tired passenger

questions.text: This passage is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage is addressed to 'Dear Sir' and signed 'Yours', indicating it's a letter.

questions.text: The writer has to take Bus No. 49 because <blank>.

choices.D: it has fewer seats on it

questions.explanation: The writer states, 'I have to wait for the number 49, because sometimes there are empty seats on it.'

questions.text: How long does the writer usually have to wait for a bus?
questions.explanation: The writer says, 'why do I have to wait half an hour for a bus nearly every day?'

questions.text: The regulation say that each bus may carry <blank> passengers at most.
questions.explanation: The regulations say 'no bus may carry more than 40 seated passengers and 20 standing passengers', which totals 60.

questions.text: From the passage we can see that <blank>.

choices.C: no buses except the No. 49 bus passed Souk Road
choices.D: the writer was always the first to get on the bus

questions.explanation: The writer complains about buses being full, not stopping, and carrying too many passengers, implying poor service.

question_sets.context:
Different weather makes people feel different. It influences(影响) health, intelligence(智力)and feelings.
In August, it is very hot and wet in the south of USA. People there have heart trouble and other kinds of health problems during this month. In the northeast and Middle West, sometimes it is very hot and sometimes very cold. People in these states have more heart trouble after the weather changes in February or March.
The weather can also influence intelligence. For example, in a 1983 report by scientists, IQ of a group of students was 10% higher when a very strong wind came. The wind can help people have more intelligence. Very hot weather, on the other hand, can make it lower.
Weather also has a strong influence on people's feelings. Winter may be a bad time for thin people. They usually feel cold and unhappy during these months. But fat people may have a hard time in hot summer. At about 180C, people become stronger.

questions.text: From the passage we know that different weather makes people feel <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage says "Different weather makes people feel different."

questions.text: Because it is very hot and wet, many people may get <blank> and other kinds of health problems during August in USA.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions "People there have heart trouble and other kinds of health problems during this month" when describing the weather in August in the south of USA.

questions.text: It is said the hot weather can make people's intelligence <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions "Very hot weather, on the other hand, can make it lower." in the third paragraph.

questions.text: Thin people usually feel cold and unhappy in <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions "Winter may be a bad time for thin people. They usually feel cold and unhappy during these months." in the fourth paragraph.

questions.text: What's the main idea of the passage?

choices.A: The weather can influence people's intelligence.
choices.B: Hot and cold weather influences all people in the same way.
choices.D: IQ never changes while the weather changes.

questions.explanation: The passage discusses how weather affects health, intelligence, and feelings, so the main idea is that weather influences people's lives.

question_sets.context: "Don't eat meal and cakes," her doctor said to her. "I'm going to stop her eating them, doctor." Her husband said. The next morning, Mrs Brown made a beautiful cake for her husband, and her husband ate half of it. Then he went out. Mrs Brown cut a very small piece of the cake and ate it. It was very good. She cut a bigger piece and ate it. In a few minutes, she finished the cake. "My husband is going to be very angry," she said. " what am I going to do?" She made another cake very quickly, ate half of that, and left half on the table. Her husband came back later. He saw the half cake on the table and was very happy.

questions.text: The doctor told Mrs. Brown not or eat meat and cakes because _________.

choices.B: meat and cakes would make her fatter.
choices.C: meat and cakes are not good food.

questions.explanation: The passage does not explicitly state the reason, but it can be inferred that the doctor advised against meat and cakes due to health concerns, likely weight gain. The answer is B.

questions.text: The next morning Mrs. Brown made a cake for __________.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Mrs. Brown made a beautiful cake for her husband the next morning. The answer is A.

questions.text: Which of the following is true?

choices.A: Mr. Brown ate half of the cake and left the other half for his wife.
choices.B: Mrs. Brown ate half a cake that morning
choices.C: Mrs. Brown ate one cake that morning.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that Mr. Brown ate half the cake, and then Mrs. Brown finished the entire cake later. The answer is C.

questions.text: Mrs. Brown made another cake because ____________.

choices.B: She wanted to eat some more.
choices.C: Her husband would be angry when he knew she had eaten the cake.

questions.explanation: Mrs. Brown said, "My husband is going to be very angry," after finishing the first cake, which implies she made another one to avoid his anger. The answer is C.

questions.text: Why was Mr. Brown very happy when he saw the half of the cake on the table?

choices.B: Because cakes were his favourite food.
choices.C: Because he thought his wife began to stop eating cakes.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that Mr. Brown was happy because he likely believed his wife was adhering to the doctor's advice. The answer is C.

question_sets.context:
A man came home from work late, tired, to find his 5-year-old son waiting for him at the door.
"Daddy, how much money do you make an hour?"
"If you must know, I make $20 an hour,"
"Oh," the little boy replied, with his head down. He thought for a moment, looked up and said, "Daddy, could you lend me $10?"
The father was_furious_, "If you asked for the money to buy a toy or some other rubbish, then go straight to your room and think about why you are being so selfish(自私的)!"
The little boy quietly went to his room and shut the door. After about an hour or so, the father calmed(平静)down, and started to think, "Maybe he really needs to buy something and he didn't really ask for money very often." So he went to the little boy's room.
"Sorry! Maybe I was too hard on you just now." said the man, "Here's $10."
"Oh, thank you, Daddy!" he said happily. Then, the boy took out some coins. When the father found that the boy already had money, he got angry again.
"Why do you want more money since you already have some?" the father shouted angrily.
"Because I didn't have enough, but now I do." the little boy replied, "Daddy, I have $20 now. Can I buy an hour of your time? Please come home early tomorrow. I would like to have dinner with you."

questions.text: How much does the boy's father make an hour? <blank>.
questions.explanation: The father says he makes $20 an hour.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: In this passage, the underlined word "furious" means <blank>.
questions.explanation: "Furious" is a synonym for "very angry."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Synonym Replacement

questions.text: At first, the father refused to lend the boy any money because <blank>.

choices.B: he did not have enough money at that moment
choices.C: he thought the boy would buy something of no use
choices.D: the boy always borrowed money from him

questions.explanation: The father says he's furious and asks if the boy asked for money to buy a toy or rubbish.

choices.B: a nice present for his father
choices.C: a toy for his own birthday
choices.D: an hour of his father's time

questions.explanation: The boy says he wants to buy an hour of his father's time to have dinner with him.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

questions.text: From the passage, we can infer(推断)that the boy's father <blank>.

choices.B: spent little time with his son
choices.C: didn't love his son at all

questions.explanation: The boy's desire to buy an hour of his father's time suggests that the father is often busy and doesn't spend much time with his son.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Implicit Information

question_sets.context:
Drawing a picture is the simplest way of putting an idea down on paper. This is because men first began to write six thousand years ago or more. The alphabet(字母)we now use came down to us over a long period of time. It was developed from the picture-writing of ancient Egypt.
Picture-writing could be used to express ideas and objects. For example, a drawing of man meant man and a drawing of a man lying on the ground with a spear(矛)meant death.
Besides the Egyptians and the Chinese, the American Indians also developed the ways of writing in pictures. Thousands of pictures would have been needed to express all the ideas that people might have. It would have taken many thousands more to express all the objects known to man. No one could draw so many pictures in a lifetime, nor could anyone learn the meaning of all such drawings before he dies.

questions.text: When did man begin to know how to write?
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the second line says "men first began to write six thousand years ago or more".

questions.text: According to the article, the first country to use alphabet is <blank> .
questions.explanation: The last sentence says that alphabet was developed from the picture-writing of ancient Egypt.

questions.text: Picture-writing could be used <blank> .

choices.D: to express two kinds of objects

questions.explanation: The second paragraph says that picture-writing could be used to express ideas and objects, so it is to express many meanings.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is not true?

choices.A: The Chinese, the Egyptians and the American Indians developed the ways of writing in pictures.
choices.B: Picture-writing is the earliest way of writing.
choices.C: When one wants to express objects, he can't use picture-writing.
choices.D: No one could draw thousands of pictures to express all his ideas.

questions.explanation: The second paragraph says that picture-writing can be used to express ideas and objects. Therefore, the answer is C.

questions.text: Why don't most people use picture-writing?

choices.A: It is too easy to learn.
choices.B: It is too difficult for people to remember the meaning of all pictures.
choices.C: It will take too much time to draw if one wants to express a lot on paper.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, it needs thousands of pictures, and no one could draw so many pictures in a lifetime, nor could anyone learn the meaning of all such drawings before he dies.

question_sets.context:
Put an ice cube from your fridge into a glass of water. You have a piece of string(线) 10 centimeters long. The problem is to take out that piece of ice with the help of the string. But you must not touch the ice with your fingers.
You may ask your friends to try to do that when you are having dinner together. There is a saltcellar on the table. You must use salt when you carry out this experiment.
First you put the string across the piece of ice . Then put some salt on the ice. Salt makes ice melt(融化). The ice round the string will begin to melt. But when it melts, it will lose heat. The cold ice cube will make the salt water freeze(结冰) again.
After a minute or two you may raise the piece of string and with it you will raise your piece of ice!
This experiment can be very useful to you. If, for example, there is ice near the door of your house, you must use very much salt to melt all the ice. If you don't put enough salt, the water will freeze again,

questions.text: We must use <blank> when we carry out this experiment.
questions.explanation: The second paragraph says "You must use salt when you carry out this experiment."

questions.text: How long will it take to carry out this experiment?
questions.explanation: The fourth paragraph says "After a minute or two you may raise the piece of string and with it you will raise your piece of ice!".

questions.text: What is the task(任务) of this experiment?

choices.A: Put the ice cube into the glass of water with the help of the string.
choices.B: Take out the ice cube in the glass of water with the help of the string.
choices.C: Take out the ice cube in the glass of water with your fingers.
choices.D: Put some salt on the ice cube and then put the string across it.

questions.explanation: The first paragraph says "The problem is to take out that piece of ice with the help of the string."

questions.text: How many things at least are used in this experiment?
questions.explanation: At least four things: an ice cube, a glass of water, a string, and some salt.

questions.text: We can lean something about <blank> from the passage.
questions.explanation: Physics, because the task is to pull the ice out by string with the help of salt

question_sets.context:
Young people and older people do not always agree. They sometimes have different ideas about living, working and playing. But in a programme in New York State adults(成年人) and teenagers(十几岁的青少年)live together in peace.
Each summer 200 teenagers and 50 adults live together for eight weeks as members of a work group. Everyone works several hours each day. The aim is not just to keep busy. It is to fine meaning in work. Some teenagers work on the farm near the village. Some learn to build a house. The adults teach them.
There are several free hours each day. Weekends are free, too. During the free hours, some of the teenagers learn painting, others sit around and talk or sing. Each teenager had his own way to spend his free time.
When people live together, rules are always needed. In this programme the teenagers and the adults make the rules together. If someone breaks a rule, the problem goes before the whole group. They ask, "Why did it happen? What do we have to do about it?"
One of the teenagers has this to san about the programme, "You stop thinking only about yourself. You learn how to think about the group."

questions.text: The main idea of this text is that <blank>

choices.A: adults and teenagers in New York State live together in peace.
choices.B: adults and teenagers don't often agree with each other
choices.C: adults can teach teenagers how to live in peace
choices.D: adults and teenagers can work and live in peace

questions.explanation: The passage says that adults and teenagers live together in peace in a programme and they work together. Therefore, the answer is D.

questions.text: The aim of working every day in teleprogramme is <blank>.

choices.B: to get the members together several hours each day

questions.explanation: The passage says that the aim is not just to keep busy. It is to find meaning in work.

choices.A: the teenagers learn how to spend their free time
choices.B: the adults give the teenagers lessons
choices.C: the teenagers work on the farm or learn to build a house
choices.D: the teenagers work while the adults don't

questions.explanation: The passage says that some teenagers work on the farm near the village. Some learn to build a house.

questions.text: What does the text tell us about weekend?

choices.B: They have a good way to spend their free time
choices.C: How some of the teenagers learn painting

questions.explanation: The passage says that weekends are free. During the free hours, some of the teenagers learn painting, others sit around and talk or sing.

questions.text: If someone breaks a rule, the problem goes before the whole group. So<blank>.

choices.A: each member knows the rules better and thinks more about the group than himself
choices.B: the member who has broken the rule will be afraid
choices.C: all the members will remember the rules
choices.D: all the members have to make the rules again.

questions.explanation: One of the teenagers says that you stop thinking only about yourself. You learn how to think about the group.

question_sets.context:
We can not live a modern life without traveling. The fastest way of traveling is by air. With a plane one can travel in one day to places which it took a month or more to get to a hundred years ago.
Traveling by train is slower than by plane, but one can see the country he is traveling through. Modern trains have comfortable seats and dinning-cars. They make even the longest journey enjoyable.
Some people prefer to travel by sea when possible. There are large luxury liners (客轮) or river boats. They are not as fast as trains or planes, but traveling by sea is a very pleasant way to spend a holiday.
Many people like to travel by car. They can make their own timetable. They can travel hundreds of miles or only fifty miles a day, just as their wish. They can stop wherever they want to see something interesting or to enjoy a good meal at a good restaurant, or to spend the night at a hotel. That is why people choose traveling by car for pleasant trips, while they usually take trains or planes for business.

questions.text: According to the passage, the fastest way of traveling is <blank>
questions.explanation: The passage states "The fastest way of traveling is by air."

questions.text: If we travel by car, we can <blank>.

choices.B: travel only fifty miles a day
choices.D: travel to a very far place in a few minutes

questions.explanation: The passage says "They can make their own timetable."

questions.text: When people travel on business, they usually take <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states "they usually take trains or planes for business."

question_sets.context:
Every country has its favorite food. Italians like to eat pizza. Indians like to eat hot food. Japanese like to eat fish. Often they don't cook it.
In England, one of the most popular kinds of food is fish and chips. People usually buy it in a fish and chip shop. They put it in paper bags, and take it home, or to their workplace. Sometimes they eat it in the park or on the road. The world's favorite food is American fast food. If you go to some important cities in the world, you can find people eating hamburgers and chips.
Fish and chips, and Chinese take-away food are very popular in England. But they are less popular in the USA, they eat take-away food, too, like chicken. But the most popular kind of take-away food is the hamburger. It looks like bread with meat in it. Ham (火腿) is a kind of pork, but the hamburger does not have any pork in it. The beef is inside a kind of cake hamburgers are delicious. They are also popular in England and Australia.

questions.text: Italians like to eat <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Italians like to eat pizza.

questions.text: Fish and chips are very popular in <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that fish and chips are popular in England.

questions.text: In different countries people eat <blank> food.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that different countries have different favorite foods.

questions.text: The hamburger does not have any <blank> in it.
questions.explanation: The passage specifies that a hamburger does not have any pork in it.

questions.text: Hamburger is a kind of <blank>.
questions.explanation: A hamburger is a kind of food.

question_sets.context:
Mr Black and Mr White were two famous artists in the city. Their drawings were also very popular in the city. But they tried to see who could draw the best picture.
One day they asked an old man to be the judge. Mr Black drew an apple tree. He put his picture in the field. Soon the birds came and tried to eat the apples. The old man saw it and said, "You have certainly won. Mr White cannot draw better than you . But we will go to see his picture."
They went to Mr White's house. There were nothing but red beautiful curtains on the wall. The old man asked, "Where is your picture, Mr White?" He said, "Lift the curtains, and you will find my picture." The old man tried to lift the curtains but found that they were drawn there. They were Mr White's picture. The old man said, "Birds thought the apples were real. Men thought the curtains were real. So Mr White won. His picture is the best one."

questions.text: What did Mr Black draw?
questions.explanation: Mr. Black drew an apple tree.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

questions.text: The old man thought Mr Black's picture was good because <blank>.

choices.D: the birds thought it was real

questions.explanation: The old man was impressed because the birds thought the apples in the picture were real.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Mr White's picture was <blank>.
questions.explanation: Mr. White's picture was of curtains drawn on the wall.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

questions.text: Mr White won because the picture looked real to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The curtains in Mr. White's picture looked real to the men including the judge.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true?

choices.A: The birds came and ate the apples up.
choices.B: The old man said Mr White's picture was the best one.
choices.C: The two pictures were not so good.
choices.D: The curtains on the wall were real.

questions.explanation: The old man said Mr. White's picture was the best one.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
I traveled many times when I was a boy. My parents worked in South America and I often flew there in my holidays. A flight attendant would take care of me and I never had an unpleasant experience. I enjoy traveling by plane and I have felt frightened only once.
That happened when I was eight. I went to see my parents as usual. After the plane took off, we were flying low over the city and slowly gaining height, when the plane suddenly turned round and flew back to the airport. While we were waiting to land, a flight attendant told us to get off the plane quietly as soon as it had touched down. Everybody on the plane was worried and we wanted to find out what had happened. Later we learnt that there was a very important person on the plane. The police were told that a bomb had been put on the plane. After we had landed, the plane was searched carefully. Luckily, they found nothing and five hours later we were able to take off again.

questions.text: Why did the writer often travel by plane when he was young?

choices.B: His sister was a flight attendant.
choices.C: He went to see his parents in South America.
choices.D: He spent his holiday on the plane.

questions.explanation: The writer's parents worked in South America, and he flew there in his holidays.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

questions.text: The plane had to return <blank>.

choices.A: a long time after it had taken off

questions.explanation: The plane returned soon after taking off, while flying low over the city.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: The plane had to return because <blank>.

choices.A: there was a very important person on the plane
choices.D: the police were told there was a bomb on the plane

questions.explanation: The police were told there was a bomb on the plane.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

questions.text: Which of the following is true?

choices.A: The policeman found a bomb on the plane at last.
choices.B: There wasn't an important person on the plane.
choices.C: Flight attendants always took care of me on the plane.
choices.D: I don't like traveling by plane at all.

questions.explanation: Flight attendants always took care of the writer on the plane.

questions.explanation: The best title is "An unpleasant experience by plane."

question_sets.context:
In the world today ,all of the people need recreation.(消遣).We cannot work all the time if we are going to keep healthy and enjoy life.
Everyone has his own way of relaxing .Perhaps the most popular form (形式) is to take part in sports. There are team sports, such as basketball and football. There are also individual(个人的) sports. such as swimming and running. Skating and mountain climbing are the most popular recreation for people who like to be outdoor.
Not everyone who enjoys sports likes to takes part in them. Many people like watching them on TV or listening to them on the radio. So many people like some forms of indoor recreation, such as watching TV, singing and dancing .
It doesn't matter whether we like indoor recreation or take part in outdoor sports, It is important for everyone to relax from time to time, and enjoy some forms of recreation.

questions.text: Which is the most popular form of recreation?
questions.explanation: The passage states: 'Perhaps the most popular form is to take part in sports.'

questions.text: People want to take part in sports in order to _________
questions.explanation: The passage states: 'We cannot work all the time if we are going to keep healthy and enjoy life.'

questions.text: Outdoor sports include(包括)_________
questions.explanation: The passage states: 'Skating and mountain climbing are the most popular recreation for people who like to be outdoor.'

questions.text: Why do many people like watching sports on TV or listening to them on the radio?

choices.A: Because they like sports but don't like take part in them

questions.explanation: The passage states: 'Not everyone who enjoys sports likes to takes part in them.'

choices.A: basketball is kind of team sports
choices.C: different people have different ways of relaxing
choices.D: indoor recreation is not as important as outdoor sports.

questions.explanation: The passage discusses the importance of recreation and how different people have different ways of relaxing, including both indoor and outdoor activities.

question_sets.context: The best way of learning a language is using it .The best way of learning English is talking in English as much as possible. Sometimes you'll get your words mixed up (混合)and people will not understand you .Sometimes people will say things too quickly and you can't understand them. But if you keep your sense of humor (幽默感),you can always have a good laugh at the mistakes you make(你所犯的错误). Don't be unhappy if people seem to be laughing at your mistakes(错误). It is better for people to laugh at your mistakes than to be angry with you. because they don't understand what you are saying .The most important thing for learning English is : "Don't be afraid of making mistakes because everyone makes mistakes. "

questions.explanation: The passage starts with: 'The best way of learning a language is using it.'

choices.A: Be careful not to make any mistakes .
choices.B: Write as quickly as you can .
choices.C: Speak English as much as you can.

questions.explanation: The passage states: 'The best way of learning English is talking in English as much as possible.'

questions.explanation: The passage states: 'Don't be unhappy if people seem to be laughing at your mistakes.'

choices.D: There is no one who doesn't make mistakes

questions.explanation: The passage states: 'Don't be afraid of making mistakes because everyone makes mistakes.'

question_sets.context:
Working people in Hong Kong are always busy in the daytime. They don't have enough time to enjoy themselves. If you are one of those people, come and join us! We'll take a night-time cruise (乘船游览) around the Victoria Habour (维多利亚港). You can see fantastic city lights during the trip, and you can also enjoy a wonderful dinner on the junk (帆船) if you like.
Harbour Night CruiseTime:6:30 p.m.-10:00 p.m.  (Monday-Friday)7:30 p.m.-12:00 p.m.  (Saturday & Sunday)Price:        an adulta child under 12(With dinner)      300 yuan        200 yuan(Without dinner)     220 yuan        140 yuanTicket office:Harbour Travel Service (No. 30 Lam Ming Street)Place to Start:Star Company (No. 98 Cyberport Road)

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the night cruise starts at 7:30 p.m. and ends at 12:00 p.m. on Saturday and Sunday. So people can enjoy the night cruise for four and a half hours.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, an adult can save 80 yuan (300-220), and a child can save 60 yuan (200-140). So they can save 220 yuan.

question_sets.context:
A boy and his father were walking in the mountains. Suddenly the boy fell, hurt himself, and cried, "AAAhhhhhh!!!" To his surprise, he heard the voice repeating, somewhere in the mountain, "AAAhhhhhh!!!" Then the boy shouted, "Who are you?" he received the answer, "Who are you?" He got angry at the answer, so he shouted, "Foolish!" He received the answer, "Foolish!"
He looked at his father and asked, "What's going on?" The father smiled and said, "My son, listen." And then he shouted to the mountain, "I love you!" The voice answered, "I love you!" Again the man cried, "You are the best!" The voice answered, "You are the best!"
The boy was surprised, but did not understand. Then his father explained, "People call this 'Echo', but really this is life. It gives you back everything you say or do. Our life is just a reflection(反映) of what we have done. If you want more love in the world, have more love in your heart. If you want to be successful, work hard. This can be used in everything in life. Life will give you back everything you have given to it."

questions.explanation: According to the passage, suddenly the boy fell, hurt himself, and cried.

choices.D: someone else laughed at him in the mountain

questions.explanation: He got angry at the answer, so he shouted, "Foolish!" He received the answer, "Foolish!"

choices.C: show more examples to his son before giving him the answer
choices.D: let his son know whose voice was louder

questions.explanation: The father smiled and said, "My son, listen." And then he shouted to the mountain, "I love you!" The voice answered, "I love you!"

questions.explanation: According to the story, Echo means repeating voice.

choices.D: the boy and his father were rather tired

question_sets.context: Dictionaries are very useful books. People use dictionaries to find out the meaning of words. If you are learning English, you should use an English dictionary. Some students have dictionaries. Dictionaries contain Chinese and English words. They are useful, but it is usually better to use a dictionary written completely in English. If you use such a dictionary, you will have more practice in using English. This will help you to begin to think in English. A good English dictionary will show you the correct spelling of a word and its pronunciation: Many dictionaries also show how a word is used in a sentence.

question_sets.context:
One day, Jack comes to Mike's house and says, "Mike, you have so many good books. Can you lend me a book to read?" Mike doesn't want to lend a book to his friend, and he says, "Why do you want to take my book home: You can read it here in my house."
Jack sees that his friend is very selfish, but he say nothing. Next day, Mike comes to Jack's house and says, "Jack, you have a good garden-knife. I want to work in my garden tomorrow. Can I use it for two days?"
Jack answers, " Why do you want to take my garden-knife home? You can work with it in my garden."

choices.C: to borrow a book from Mike
choices.D: to go to the library with Mike

He will soon visit Darwin. From Darwin, he can fly to Perth. My brother has never been abroad before, so he is finding this trip very exciting and interesting. question_sets.context:
We live in the 'computer age". People like scientist, teacher, writers and students use computers to do all kind work. But more than 30 years ago, computers couldn't do much. They were very big and expensive. Very few people were interested in them and knew how to use them. Today computers are small and cheaper .Since they can do a lot of work, many people like to use them. Some people even have them at home.
Computers become very important because they can work faster than men and make fewer mistakes. Computers can help people do a lot of work. Writers now use computers to write. Teachers use them to help teaching .Students use them to study and children use them to play games. Computers can also remember what you put into them. Computers are very useful and helpful. They are our friends. Do you want to have a computer?

questions.text: What's the Chinese for "computer age"?
questions.explanation: "Computer age" means "计算机时代" in Chinese.

questions.text: The computers were very_____ over 30 years ago
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that computers were very big and expensive more than 30 years ago.

choices.A: they can do work more quickly than people and make fewer mistakes
choices.B: They can make fewer mistakes, but work more slowly
choices.D: lots of people like to use them

questions.explanation: The passage says that computers become very important because they can work faster than men and make fewer mistakes.

questions.text: Writers use computers to ______. .
questions.explanation: The passage states that writers use computers to write.

questions.text: Do computers have a memory?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that computers can remember what you put into them.

question_sets.context:
There was a pilot and three people in a small plane. Suddenly there was something wrong with the plane when it was flying in the air. The smoke was everywhere in the plane. The pilot told the people there were only three parachutes(降落伞). They all became worried and started to make excuses.
"I must go and mend the machine. " said the pilot, taking one of the parachutes. There was nothing he could do so he just jumped out.
The next person said, "I must have a parachute. I am a very clever person, and I have to attend an important sports game. I know I am going to win the game because I am going to be the cleverest person there. "He picked up a pack and jumped out.
Two men were left, an old businessman and a young mountain climber. By this time the plane was going down fast. The businessman said, "Young man, I am old but you're still young. You take the last parachute. "the young mountain climber smiled, "Don't worry, "he said, "we can both jump to safety because there are still two parachutes. Just now the clever person jumped out with my backpack."

questions.text: All the people became worried because <blank>.

choices.B: they were afraid the plane would be broken and knew there were not enough parachutes for each person.
choices.C: There was too much smoke and they couldn't jump out from the plane.
choices.D: They saw the pilot jump out first

questions.explanation: They were afraid the plane would crash and they knew there were not enough parachutes for each person.

questions.text: The clever man jumped out with <blank>.
questions.explanation: The clever man jumped out with climber's pack.

questions.text: All the people thought of themselves except <blank>.
questions.explanation: All the people thought of themselves except the businessman.

questions.text: From this story, we know <blank> would die.
questions.explanation: Since the clever man jumped out with a backpack rather than a parachute, he will die.

questions.text: <blank> was a kind hearted man.
questions.explanation: The businessman was kind hearted and offered the parachute to the mountain climber.

question_sets.context:
In the summer of 1963,Clinton won a drama contest,
so he went to visit the city of Washington.
Clinton was born in a poor family in 1946. Three
months before he was born ,his father died.
There he met President Kennedy. Then he decided to
become a president.
Bill Clinton took office on January 20th 1993 and became the 42nd U. S. president. He is the first U.S. president Who was born after World War Ⅱ , and he is very ambitious(有雄心的 ).
When he was young, his mother got married again.
Among all the greatest people in the world, Ⅰ like Edison most. He was so creative that he had 1,093 inventions in his life.
He was born in 1847 and died in 1931. The most famous of his
inventions was a light bulb. Besides the light bulb, Edison
developed the phonograph and the" kinetoscope ,"a small box for
seeing moving films. He also improved the design of the telephone.
He believed in hard work. Sometimes he worked twenty hours a day.
The name of Helen Keller is known around the world as a
woman of great intelligence ,high ambition and hard working.
She spent her life helping others.
Born in Tuscumbia, Alabama, in 1880, Helen Keller had a
fever that made her blind and deaf at the age of 19 months.
When she was seven years old, Anne Mansfield Sullivan became
her teacher. Helen Keller quickly learned to read and write. By
the age of 10 she began to speak. At the age of 20 she entered Radcliffe College, with Miss Sullivan at her side to spell textbooks letter by letter into her hand. Four years later Helen Keller graduated, and she began her life's work of helping blind and deaf-blind people. She traveled around the world and wrote many books and articles. She met every U. S. president from Grover Cleveland to Lyndon Johnson and played a major role in helping the blind.

questions.text: What's the right order about Clinton's life story?
questions.explanation: The correct order is 2(Clinton was born), 5(his mother got married again), 1(he won a drama contest), 3(he met President Kennedy), 4(he took office).

questions.explanation: The text says 'He believed in hard work. Sometimes he worked twenty hours a day.'

choices.D: met the presidents of U. S.

questions.explanation: They all did lots of things for the people.

questions.text: Helen Keller learned a lot <blank>.

choices.B: with the help of her parents.
choices.C: with the help of her teacher Sullivan.

questions.explanation: Helen Keller learned a lot with the help of her teacher Sullivan.

choices.A: Helen Keller didn't go to college.
choices.B: Clinton was born before the World War Ⅱ
choices.C: Edison invented the telephone by himself.
choices.D: Clinton lived a poor life when he was young.

questions.explanation: Clinton lived a poor life when he was young.
