question_sets.context:
Everywhere in the world, you'll find all people love to eat. Every country has its own(自己的) way of cooking. American people have their ways of cooking, don't they?
Most people in the United States like fast food, such as sandwiches, but if you think that American people don't like cooking, you are not right. It's true that most Americans take fast food as their breakfast and lunch, but many Americans think cooking is interesting. Parents see the importance(重要) of teaching their daughters how to cook. And most Americans say that home cooked meal is the best.
Americans have their own ways of cooking. For example, baking(烘,烤)is the most popular way of cooking food in America. A meal often has roast(烤)meat and other baked food. So Americans find it impossible(不可能的)to live without(没有)an oven(烤箱). Americans pay much attention(注意)to the balance(平衡) of food. When planning a big meal they try to cook meat, a few vegetables, some bread and often some sweet food. They also like to make the meal look beautiful. There are several different colors of food on the plate(盘子),so the meal looks beautiful and healthy.

questions.text: When Americans cook, what is necessary?
questions.explanation: The text mentions Americans find it impossible to live without an oven.

questions.text: What do most people in the United States like?
questions.explanation: The text says that most people in the United States like fast food, such as sandwiches.

questions.text: Which is the most popular way of cooking food in America?
questions.explanation: The text states that baking is the most popular way of cooking food in America.

questions.text: When planning a big meal, what do they try to cook?

choices.B: some bread, sweet food and sandwiches
choices.C: some sweet food, meat and vegetables

questions.explanation: The text mentions they try to cook meat, a few vegetables, some bread and often some sweet food.

questions.text: What's the main idea of the passage?
questions.explanation: The passage focuses on American cooking methods and preferences.

question_sets.context:
Charles Dickens, one of the greatest English writers, was born in 1812 in one of the small towns of England.
When Dickens was nine years old, the family moved to London, the capital of England. There were several younger children in the family. Their life was hard so Dickens could not go to school.
Only until his father was out of prison(监狱), could Charles go to school. At that time he was already twelve years old. But he didn't finish school. Two years later he began to work. The future writer often went to the library to read books. He read a lot. Then Dickens wrote lots of novels and stories all his life. Dickens died a hundred and thirty-six years ago, but people are still reading his books with great interest.

questions.text: Charles Dickens was a great <blank> writer.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Charles Dickens was one of the greatest English writers.

questions.text: Young Dickens was <blank> child in his family.
questions.explanation: There were several younger children in the family, meaning Dickens was an elder child.

questions.text: He began to go to school when <blank> .
questions.explanation: The passage says that Charles could go to school when he was twelve years old.

questions.text: According to the passage, Dickens' father was <blank> .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'Only until his father was out of prison, could Charles go to school'.

questions.text: When did Charles Dickens die?
questions.explanation: He died a hundred and thirty-six years ago (from the time of writing).

question_sets.context:
Miss Evans taught physics in a London school. Last month she was explaining to her class about sound, and she decided to test them to see how successful she had been in her work. She said to them, Now, I have a sister in Washington. If I was calling her on the telephone, and at the same time you were 20 meters away and listened to me from the other side of the street, who could hear what I said earlier, my sister or you? And why?
The cleverest boy at once answered, "Your sister, Miss Evans, because electricity (电) travels faster than sound waves(波)." That's very good, Miss Evans answered, but then one of the girls put up her hand, and Miss Evans said, Yes, Betty?
"I don't think so. Betty said, Your sister would hear you earlier because when it's eleven o'clock here, it's only six o'clock in Washington."

questions.text: Miss Evans was teaching her class __________.
questions.explanation: The first sentence says that Miss Evans was explaining to her class about sound.

questions.text: She wanted to make her students know__________.

choices.A: whether she could hear her sister in Washington
choices.B: whether her students could hear her from 20 meters away
choices.C: which was faster, London or Washington
choices.D: electricity travels faster than sound waves

questions.explanation: She tested them to see how successful she had been in explaining about sound.

questions.text: The cleverest boy thought that___________.

choices.A: sound waves travel faster than electricity
choices.B: they would hear her sister in Washington first
choices.D: Miss Evans's sister would hear her earlier

questions.explanation: The cleverest boy thought Miss Evans's sister would hear her earlier because electricity travels faster than sound waves.

questions.text: Miss Evans________.

choices.A: thought Betty's answer was much better
choices.B: thought the cleverest boy's answer wasn't so good
choices.C: was satisfied with what the girl had said
choices.D: was satisfied with what the cleverest boy had said

questions.explanation: The text says "That's very good" after the cleverest boy answered.

questions.text: Betty thought the cleverest boy was wrong, because_____________.

choices.A: clocks in Washington showed a different time from those in London
choices.B: electricity was slower than sound waves
choices.C: they were only 20 meters away from the telephone
choices.D: electricity travels as fast as sound waves

questions.explanation: Betty thought the cleverest boy was wrong because of the time difference between London and Washington.

question_sets.context:
What is a library for? Most libraries have books and other things to read. Many of them have things to listen to. Some libraries even have computers. Very few people would think of a library as a place to live in.
One library in New York City turned into(变成) a home for 250 people for a few days. These were all people near the library. They slept on the floor. Why did the people move into the library?
The people moved into the library because the city wanted to close it to save money. These 250 New Yorkers loved their library. They didn't want to lose it. So they moved in. They knew that the library couldn't be closed if they were living inside it. At last the city agreed to keep the library open, and the people all went home.

questions.text: Where did the story happen?_________.

choices.B: In a school in New York City.
choices.C: In the streets in New York City.
choices.D: In most libraries in New York City.

questions.explanation: The second paragraph indicates the story happened in a library in New York City.

questions.text: The library had hundreds of ___________.
questions.explanation: The passage says that one library turned into a home for 250 people.

questions.text: The people in the story _______________.

choices.A: were all the workers in the library
choices.B: were all people near the library

questions.explanation: These were all people near the library.

questions.text: Why did 250 people move into the library? Because_____________.

choices.A: these people wanted to save money
choices.B: these people needed places to live in
choices.D: they loved the library and they didn't want to lose it

questions.explanation: They loved their library and didn't want to lose it.

questions.text: From the passage we know that ___________.

choices.A: the library was kept open at last
choices.B: the library was closed because no one read in it
choices.C: the library became a home of these people
choices.D: the city saved a lot of money

questions.explanation: At last the city agreed to keep the library open.

question_sets.context: Mr Grey was the manager(经理) of a small office in London. He lived in the country, and came to work by train. He liked walking from the station to his office if it was not raining, because it gave him some exercises. One morning he was walking along the street when a stranger(陌生人) stopped him and said to him, " You may not remember me, sir, but seven years ago I came to London without any money in my pocket(口袋). I stopped you in this street and asked you to lend(借) me some money, and you lent me five pounds(英镑), because you said that you were happy to take a chance(机会)so as to give a man a start on the road to success." Mr Grey thought for a few moments and then said, " Yes, I remember you. Go on(继续) with your story." " Well," answered the stranger," are you still willing to take a chance?"

questions.text: Mr. Grey walked to his office only when the weather was <blank>.
questions.explanation: The text says "He liked walking from the station to his office if it was not raining", so the answer is "fine".

questions.text: Mr Grey walked because <blank>.

choices.C: it helped him in good health (健康)
choices.D: he had a lot of homework

questions.explanation: The text says "He liked walking from the station to his office if it was not raining, because it gave him some exercises", so the answer is "it helped him in good health".

questions.text: Mr Grey <blank> the stranger some years ago.
questions.explanation: The text says "I stopped you in this street and asked you to lend me some money, and you lent me five pounds", so Mr Grey had helped the stranger.

questions.text: The stranger <blank> since then.
questions.explanation: The stranger is asking Mr. Grey if he is willing to take a chance again, which indicates that the stranger had been successful.

questions.text: Now the stranger wanted to <blank>.

choices.B: give Mr Grey his money back
choices.D: lend(借给) Mr Grey some money

questions.explanation: The stranger is asking Mr. Grey if he is willing to take a chance again, which indicates that the stranger wants to ask for some money again.

question_sets.context:
It was a Sunday morning．Peter,a seven-year-old boy,watched TV in the room while his brother Bill did his homework．Their father watered the flowers in the garden and their mother went out to do some shopping．At ten the woman came back with a heavy basket．Peter ran up to her．He wanted to know what his mother bought．He found a bag of oranges in it．He liked them very much and wanted to eat．His mother stopped him．She gave five to each son and went to the kitchen(厨房)．Peter ate his oranges soon but his brother was busy(忙) finishing his homework and didn't touch his．Suddenly(突然)the telephone rang and Bill ran to answer it．Bill's friend asked him to play football with them．And when Bill talked with his friend,Peter took two of his oranges away and ate them．Bill found it and called him out and beat(打)him behind the house．He didn't tell his parents about it．
The next morning Miss Ball taught her class subtraction(减法)．Peter didn't hear what she said and couldn't understand it．So he couldn't answer her questions．She began to give him an example,"If your brother has five nuts and you take two from him,what will the result(结果)be?"
"He'll beat me,madam,"answered the boy．
All his classmates began to laugh．

questions.text: How many people are there in Peter's family?
questions.explanation: Peter, his brother Bill, his father, and his mother. There are four people.

questions.text: How many oranges did Peter eat?
questions.explanation: Peter ate his five oranges, and then took two of his brother's oranges. So he ate seven oranges in total.

questions.explanation: Miss Ball taught her class subtraction(减法), so she is a math teacher.

choices.B: Because he was afraid of his brother．
choices.C: Because his father didn't like him．
choices.D: Because his mother let Bill to do so．

questions.explanation: Peter took two oranges from his brother. He knew he was wrong, so he didn't tell his parents.

choices.B: he didn't listen to the teacher carefully
choices.D: he pretended(假装)to be a fool(傻瓜)

questions.explanation: Peter didn't hear what she said and couldn't understand it. So he didn't listen to the teacher carefully.

question_sets.context:
English is the most widely used in the world. It is one of the working languages at the United Nations. It is used in education, science, medicine and other fields. And now more than 450 million people in the world can speak English.
Three-fourths of the books, newspapers, magazines and business letters in the world are written in English. Most programs on international radio and TV are in English. We can get more information about the world from them.
English is taught in schools around the world. If you know English well, you can communicate with the world.
The best way to learn English is to use it every day. Try your best to learn it, because it is a useful tool.

questions.text: What is the best way to learn English?
questions.explanation: The passage concludes that 'The best way to learn English is to use it every day'.

question_sets.context:
Mr.Read works in a hospital.He's a good doctor but he often forgets thing.People know him well and don't mind it.
One morning he looked over an old woman and found something was wrong with her eyes.He began to do an operation.It took him three hours to finish it.The old woman could see again and thanked him very much.After that he had a look at his watch and found it was half past twelve.He felt hungry and wanted to buy some food for himself.
When he reached the lift,he remembered he didn't wash his hands.He had to return to his office.He took off his coat and put it on the back of the chair.After that he left.However in the restaurant,he realized he wasn't wearing his coat.All his money was in one of his pockets.He got up and went back to the hospital.The lift was just on the first floor.He ran to it but it was going to close.He put his head into it,and the doors opened.A man in the lift called out,"Oh,dear,sir!Why didn't you hold the doors open with your hands?It's too dangerous to do so with your head!"
"I think my hands are more important than my head,I have to do operation not with my head,but with my hands!"

question_sets.context:
"Which meal do we all need most, breakfast, lunch or dinner?" Miss Baker asks. Boys and girls wave their hands in the air. They know the answer.
"What do you think, Jim?" Miss Baker asks.
"Dinner, " Jim answers.
"Dinner is the big meal of the day," says Miss Baker. "But I don't think we need it most."
Tom puts up his hands. " Do we need lunch most?"
"No," says Miss Baker. "We need breakfast most." "Why is this so?"
"From night to morning is a long time to go without food," says Ann.
"That's right," says Miss Baker. "We need food every morning. What may happen to us if we have no breakfast?"
The students have many answers to give.
We may feel hungry."
"We may not feel like working."
"We may feel sick."
"Yes, you are right," says Miss Baker. "Now let's talk about what makes a good breakfast. Give me your answers. I will write them on the blackboard.

question_sets.context:
Many people like animals and keep one or more as pets ----dogs, cats or some kinds of birds. If you keep a dog or a cat as a pet, you must know how to look after them.
A grown-up dog needs two meals a day----not more. And it can eat meat, fish, rice and some other things. Dogs like large bones(骨头), but don't give them chicken bones. Remember to give them much clean water.
A dog should have a clean, dry box for sleeping. Washing it once a week is good for its health. If it is ill, take it to a doctor. A healthy dog will bring you more pleasure.
Be careful if you have a cat. It has two meals a day with some meat or fish. Cats drink a little milk every day. sometimes give them vegetables to eat. Don't forget that they need clean water to drink.
Take good care of your pets. They will be your good friends. Maybe they can give you some help when you need.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'Cats drink a little milk every day... Don't forget that they need clean water to drink'.

questions.text: In the writer's opinion, will pets be people's friends?
questions.explanation: The passage concludes with 'Take good care of your pets. They will be your good friends'.

question_sets.context: One day Mrs Wilson took Trudy and Ben to go shopping. They went to the supermarket in the new shopping mall(购物中心)."Why do you buy things here, Mum?" Trudy asked.  "Because they are cheaper than those at the corner store," Mrs Wilson said. "Help me check(检查) the prices." The Wilsons were not wealthy(富有的) and Mrs Wilson was always careful with her money. She looked carefully at the prices of things. She bought some groceries(杂货) in the supermarket. When they got home, the children said, "We don't think you saved(省) money by going to the supermarket there." "Of course I did," said Mrs Wilson, "everything was cheap there." "We know," said the children, "but we came home by taxi (出租车)because we had too much to carry. The cost(花费) of the taxi was more than the money you saved!" Mrs Wilson added(加) everything up and found her children were right. "Well done," she said, "next time we will do shopping near our home."

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that Mrs. Wilson took Trudy and Ben to the supermarket.

question_sets.context:
It was Sunday yesterday. Bruce went to play football with his friends. Soon he felt hot and took off his coat. On his way home, he forgot to put it on again. This morning he felt unwell and couldn't go to school. His mother told him to stay in bed and then went to buy some medicine for him. An hour later he wouldn't lie there, so he stood by the window.The sunwas shining and the birds were singing in the trees. Soon his mother came back and said, "It's warmer outside. Go to sun yourself after you take the medicine. "
Bruce went out and sat on a step and played alone. At that time a salesman (推销员)came up to him and asked, "Has your mother come back, my little friend? "
"Yes, sir, "answered the boy.
The man began to ring the doorbell, but nobody answered. He rang it for a long time and became angry.
"I don't think you are an honest(诚实的)boy, "said the salesman. "There's no one in the house. You've played a joke on (捉弄)me! "
"I don't think so, sir, "said Bruce. "The house isn't ours. "

question_sets.context:
Our new English teacher, Mr White, arrived today. He's American. He smiles a lot and he's friendly but he speaks very fast. It's difficult to understand his words . He also expects(希望)us to study hared, and speak English all the time in our English lessons.
During the first class, Mr White introduced himself, and showed us photos of his family. He's got a big family, two brothers and a sister. His brothers all look like him, They are very tall and they have dark hair, but one brother has a beard. His sister is slim, and she has fair hair ,They were smiling in all of the photos and look friendly. Then he told us about Americans. He showed us how Americans say "Hi. How are you doing?" and shake hands when they meet people. We all practiced. Smile a lot and are usually friendly because Americans think it's polite to be friendly. At the lesson, we all said "Goodbye", "See you soon" to everyone. English lessons are going to be enjoyable!

question_sets.context:
Many people go to school for a good education. They learn languages, history, maths and other subjects. School education is very important and useful. Yet no one can learn everything from school. No matter how much a teacher knows, he cannot teach his students everything they want to know. His work is to show his students how to learn. He teaches them how to read and how to think. So, much more is to be learned outside school by the students themselves.
It is always more important to know how to study by oneself. It is quite easy to learn something in language or a formula in maths, but it is difficult to use a formula in finding the answer to a maths problem. Great inventors do not get everything from school, but they can invent many things and change the world a lot. Though Thomas Edison invented many things, he didn't have much school education. How do they do all this? A lot of things are not taught in the classroom. They get knowledge from books outside school. They work hard all their lives, and the most important thing is that they know how to use their heads.

questions.text: Why do many people go to school?
questions.explanation: The passage states that many people go to school for a good education.

questions.text: What should a student do since he can't learn everything from school?

choices.A: Try to remember more knowledge and formulas (公式).
choices.B: Try to remember what the teachers teach.
choices.C: Try to learn how to read and how to think.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the teacher's work is to show his students how to learn, teach them how to read and think.

questions.text: How can an inventor invent things?
questions.explanation: The passage concludes that the most important thing is that they know how to use their heads.

choices.A: School education is important for a person.
choices.B: A student should learn how to study .
choices.C: A student cannot learn everything from school.

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes the importance of learning how to study oneself, making this the main idea.

question_sets.context:
One day a visitor came to Walley's house. "I am your cousin from London," he said, "and I have brought you a goose to celebrate the visit." Walley was very excited. He asked his wife to cook the goose and made a fine dinner.
The next day another visitor arrived. "I'm the friend of the man who brought you the goose." He said. Wally invited him in and gave him a good meal. The next day another visitor arrived, and said he was the friend of the friend of the man who brought the goose. Again Wally invited him for a meal. However, he was getting annoyed. His house seemed to be a restaurant.
Another visitor came, and said he was the friend of the friend of the friend of the man who brought the goose. Wally invited him to eat dinner with him. His wife brought some soup to the table and the visitor tasted it. "What kind of soup is this? "asked the visitor. "It tastes just like warm water." "Ah! said Wally, "That is the soup of the soup of the soup of the goose."

questions.text: How many of the visitors brought a goose?
questions.explanation: Only the first visitor brought a goose.

questions.text: Guess the meaning of "annoyed" according to the passage.
questions.explanation: Annoyed means 烦恼, which is being bothered.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Inference Skills

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true?

choices.B: The second visitor is the friend of the first visitor.
choices.C: The last visitor didn't drink the soup of the goose.
choices.D: The last visitor drank the soup.

questions.explanation: Wally didn't know the first visitor, who claimed to be his cousin.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

choices.B: The visitors ate his four geese.
choices.C: The first visitor brought a goose, but the others didn't bring anything.
choices.D: His house seemed to be a restaurant.

questions.explanation: Wally got angry because his house seemed to be a restaurant.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Cause & Effect; Inference Skills

questions.text: How did Wally solve the problem?

choices.A: He served soup, but it tasted of nothing, so that no visitors would like to come to his house again.
choices.B: He served good soup, so that everyone would want to eat at his house.
choices.D: He didn't serve the last visitor.

questions.explanation: Wally served soup that tasted of nothing so that no visitors would want to come again.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Cause & Effect

question_sets.context: Jack is a twenty-year-old young man. Two years ago, when he finished middle school, he found work in a shop. Usually he works until ten o'clock in the evening. He is very tired when he gets home. After a quick supper he goes to bed and soon falls asleep. His grandma who lives downstairs is satisfied with him.One day, on his way home, he met Mary. They were both happy. He asked the girl to his house, she agreed happily. He bought some fruit and drinks for her. And they talked about their school, teachers, classmates and their future. They talked for a long time."Have a look at your watch, please," said the girl. "What time is it now?""Sorry, something is wrong with my watch," said Jack. "Where's yours?""I left it at home."Jack thought for a moment and found a way. He began to_stamp_his foot on the floor, "Bang! Bang! Bang!"The sound woke his grandma up. The old woman shouted downstairs, "It's twelve o'clock in the night, Jack. Why are you still jumping upstairs?"

questions.text: Jack was ________ when he finished middle school.
questions.explanation: Jack is twenty now and finished middle school two years ago, so he was eighteen when he finished middle school.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.explanation: The old woman is satisfied with Jack because he can keep quiet.

questions.explanation: The word "stamp" in the story means 跺 in Chinese.

choices.C: that his grandma was going to tell him the time
choices.D: that his grandma was going to buy him a watch

questions.explanation: Jack stamped his foot on the floor so that his grandma was going to tell him the time.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Cause & Effect; Inference Skills

question_sets.context:
When you are feeling unhappy or forget how great you are, these are six ways to make you feel good about yourself.
1) Look in the mirror and say to yourself, "I am a special person and there's no one in the world like me. I can do anything!" It may not sound so good, but it really works!
2) Do something nice for someone. Helping others always makes you feel good.
3) Smile! Be friendly to people you meet. Look for the good things in your friends and family.
4) Learn something new! Have you always wanted to decorate your own room or learn how to swim? New challenges are fun and give you_a sense of accomplishment_when you have finished.
5) Read and start a diary. Turn off the TV and let your imagination fly! Write down your thoughts, dreams or anything you want! Writing always helps to express your feelings.
6) Stay with your family. We all need our family time. Talk with your Mum or Dad or maybe even your cousin.

questions.text: This passage may be taken from_ _.
questions.explanation: This passage is likely to be taken from a magazine, which often provides advice and tips.

questions.text: According to the passage, when you are helping others, you will_ _.
questions.explanation: Helping others always makes you feel good.

questions.text: What do the underlined words in 4) "a sense of accomplishment" mean?
questions.explanation: "a sense of accomplishment" means 成就感.

questions.text: Which of the following should you say "NO" to when you are unhappy?

choices.A: You should always look for the good things of others.
choices.B: Stay alone at home as much as possible.
choices.C: Learn something new and go for it!
choices.D: Keep a diary to express your feelings.

questions.explanation: Staying alone at home as much as possible is not a way to feel good about yourself.

questions.text: The best title(标题)for the passage is_ _.

choices.B: Six Ways to Feel Good about Yourself
choices.C: It's Never too Late to Learn

questions.explanation: The best title for the passage is "Six Ways to Feel Good about Yourself".

question_sets.context: Mr. King was the manager of a hotel. One weekend all the hotels in the city were full because there was a large meeting. On Friday night, three men came into the hotel and asked for rooms. Mr. King said there were no rooms ready because of the meeting. The men were unhappy.Mr. King wanted to help them. He remembered that Room 418, a very small room, was empty. He asked them if they would share a room. The three men said they would. Mr. King said the room would be thirty dollars: ten for each one. Each man gave him the money and then went up to the room.Mr. King soon began to feel sorry. "Thirty dollars is a lot to ask as price for that small room." he thought. He called his assistant over and said, "Here is five dollars. Take it to the men in Room 418. I asked too much for their room."The assistant took the money. While he was on the way there, he started to think, "How can three men divide five dollars? I'll give them each only one dollar and keep the two dollars for myself. The men will be happy to get something back, and Mr. King will never know." So the assistant returned one dollar to each man.Each man had at first paid ten dollars. After the assistant returned them one dollar each, each had paid nine. There were three men, $ 9Ⅹ3 = $ 27. The assistant kept $ 2.$ 27 + $ 2 = $ 29. Where is the missing dollar?

question_sets.context:
Mygrandfather was a fine man. I love him very much. But one day I told him a lie. I can not tell you now what the lie was. I was only seven years old then.
Grandfather was not cross with me
"Ask Jim to get a long ladder," he said. "My boy now jumps from the tops of houses, up to the roof".
Jim brought the big ladder. Then Grandfather said, "My boy now jumps from the tops of houses. The ladder is for him."
I knew at once what he was telling me. I had often heard the old saying," A lie is a jump from the top of a house"
I said nothing .But I felt like crying.
The minutes went by. What would people think about the ladder? It stood by the front door. I was afraid it might be there a long time. I had to do something!
At last I went to Grandfather. He was reading a book. I went to him and put my face on his arm.
"Grandfather," I said," I will not tell a lie again. We don't need the ladder now."
Grandfather seemed very happy once again. He called Jim. "Take the ladder away," he said,"My boy does not jump from the tops of houses."
His words made me happy once again.

questions.text: From the reading we cannot know _____.

choices.A: whether the boy told a lie
choices.C: what Grandfather did with the boy

questions.explanation: We don't know what the lie was.

questions.text: The word "cross" in the reading means _____.
questions.explanation: Cross means angry.

questions.text: Grandfather asked Jim to get a ladder to ____.

choices.A: see whether the boy could jump from the top of a house
choices.B: help the boy to climb to the top of the house
choices.C: let the boy know it was wrong to tell a lie

questions.explanation: Grandfather used the ladder to make the boy realize it was wrong to tell a lie.

questions.text: "What would people think about the ladder?"shows the boy was afraid people would _______.

choices.D: come to take care of Grandfather

questions.explanation: The boy was afraid people would know what had happened.

questions.text: At the end of the story the result is ______.
questions.explanation: The ending is enjoyable.

question_sets.context:
Almost all people like flowers. Some people like flowers because of their smells, shapes, colors and so on. Others like flowers because they think different flowers mean different things. Flowers have their own language. For example, red roses mean "love" and sunflowers mean "loyalty". So people in more than 100 countries have chosen their own_national flowers_which say something about their countries' spirit. In 1994, China talked about choosing a national flower. Some people liked the peony but others liked the plum blossom. They couldn't agree with each other. So it has not been decided yet.
People like to buy different flowers in different seasons. Where do all the beautiful flowers in shops come from? They may come from far away, so their price is higher.
a. Farmers grow flowers in their fields.
b. Planes or trains or buses take the flowers to different places.
c. Flower shopkeepers buy flowers from the flower markets. They look at the flowers and throw away the broken or bad ones. They cut the flowers to make them more beautiful.
d. You go to buy the flowers in the shops. When you buy a flower, you're paying lots of people: the farmer, the driver of the plane or train or bus. The seller in the flower market and the flower shopkeeper.
So you'd better keep your flowers from far away for a long time. But how? Why not dry them? It's easy! Sand drying is a way. Dry, clean sand is one of the oldest things for drying flowers. And it's one of the cheapest.
・Fill a box half-way with sand.
・Put the flowers on top of the sand.
・Put the box in a warm, dry place.
・Leave the flowers there for one to three weeks.
・Take them out and they will be dry.

choices.A: no flower can show China's spirit
choices.B: China hasn't talked about choosing one
choices.C: nobody agrees to choose the national flower
choices.D: people can't agree to choose the same flower

questions.explanation: The Chinese national flower has not been decided yet, because people can't agree to choose the same flower.

questions.text: You'd better keep your flowers for a long time, because_ _.

choices.A: the flowers are easy to dry
choices.B: the farmer will also ask you to pay
choices.C: the flowers are expensive to buy
choices.D: the shopkeeper has made them more beautiful

questions.explanation: You'd better keep your flowers for a long time, because the flowers are expensive to buy.

questions.text: Sand drying is everything here in the following but_ _.
questions.explanation: Sand drying is easy, old, and cheap, but it's not necessarily clean. It requires clean sand, but the process itself isn't inherently clean.

During the day we work and play, at night we sleep. Our bodies rest while we sleep. In the morning we are ready to work and play again. While we are sleeping, our bodies grow most. Children who are tired usually need more sleep. We can get our sleep better and we feel better, too, when we had plenty of rest. Boys and girls who are nine years old need ten hours of sleep every night. Our bodies need plenty of air when we sleep. If we do not get enough fresh (新鲜的)air we'll feel tired when we wake up. While in bed, we must not cover our heads. If we do, our lungs(心脏) will not get enough fresh air. If we open our windows at night, we can have plenty of fresh am Cool air is better than warm air. Boys and girls who want to grow and be strong must get plenty of sleep.

question_sets.context: One day Mrs Wilson took Trudy and Ben to go shopping. They went to the supermarket in the new shopping mall(购物中心)."Why do you buy things here, Mum?" Trudy asked.  "Because they are cheaper than those at the corner store," Mrs Wilson said. "Help me check(检查) the prices." The Wilsons were not wealthy(富有的) and Mrs Wilson was always careful with her money. She looked carefully at the prices of things. She bought some groceries(杂货) in the supermarket. When they got home, the children said, "We don't think you saved(省) money by going to the supermarket there." "Of course I did," said Mrs Wilson, "everything was cheap there." "We know," said the children, "but we came home by taxi (出租车)because we had too much to carry. The cost(花费) of the taxi was more than the money you saved!" Mrs Wilson added(加) everything up and found her children were right. "Well done," she said, "next time we will do shopping near our home."

question_sets.context:
In the west, people usually give a party to celebrate a person's birthday. The guests will come to the party with birthday presents and say "Happy Birthday" to the birthday person. The guests then watch him or her open the presents and he or she thanks them for the presents they have bought. In the party, drinks and food are served. Towards the end of the dinner the lights in the room are turned off, and someone comes in from another room with a cake on which there are lighted candles, one for each year.
Seeing the birthday person, the guests begin singing "Happy Birthday to You" and the birthday person makes a wish before he or she blows out the candles on the cake. It is said that the wish will come true after all the candles go out in one puff. After that, the cake is cut in pieces, usually by the birthday person, one piece for each guest. When the party is over, the guests wish the birthday person "Happy Birthday" again and leave.

question_sets.context: When you go to see a doctor, he will write you a note(处方) to take to the_chemist _for some medicine.Chemists are usually good at reading doctors' notes. But sometimes doctors write too badly and even the chemist can not read them. One day a man wrote to a doctor to invite(邀请) him to have dinner at his house. The doctor wrote a reply(回复), but he wrote too badly and the man could not read it. "What shall I do?"he asked his wife, "I don't know whether he is going to come or not. I don't want to call him and say that I don't understand him." His wife thought for a while and then she had an idea. "Take it to the chemist," she said, "He will be able to(能) read it for us." "Thank you," said her husband. "That's a good idea." He went to the chemist's shop and gave the doctor's "note" to him. The chemist looked at it for a long time. "Could you wait a moment, sir?" he said. Then he went to the back of his shop. After a few minutes he came back, carrying a large bottle. He gave the bottle to the man. "Take one spoonfu(一匙) every day."he said.

Peter works in a food shop. He helps the shopkeeper. He puts food on the shelves every day, and then people come into the shop and buy the food. "Today there aren't any bags of rice on the shelves. Peter" says the shopkeeper. "We need some bags of rice. Bring some rice to the shelf."
Peter runs to get some bags of rice. They are in another room and they are on the top of the shelf. The shelf is high up. Peter is tall, but he can't reach the bags. He brings two boxes and puts one box on top of the other. Then he stands on them. Now he can reach the bags on the shelf. The shopkeeper is coming, He's calling Peter. "Peter, Hurry up, what are you doing? Where are the bags of rice?" he says. He opens the door. He can't see Peter on the boxes. "Don't open the door" Peter says. Then Peter falls down. Now Peter is on the floor. There's some rice on his head.

question_sets.context:
The English language started about 1, 500 years ago in England. Three groups of people came to the country. They were the Angles, the Saxons, and the Jutes. These three groups brought their languages with them to England. After some time, the three languages became one new language--- English. The name " English" comes form the Angles. They lived in most of England. " England" means " Angle Land" or " Country of the Angle".
The language that we speak today-Modern English is not the same as the English that people used 1,500 years ago, including Old English(before 1150) and Middle English ( up till 1500). That language-Old English sounds different, and it has some different rules of grammar. There were only a few thousand words in Old English. But Modern English does come from Old English, and it is still like it in many important ways.

questions.text: When did Modern English start?

choices.C: Between the 12th century and the 16th century

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that Middle English lasted 'up till 1500,' implying Modern English started around that time.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Inference Skills

questions.text: How many languages did Old English come from?
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'Three groups brought their languages... After some time, the three languages became one new language--- English.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Which language did the name "English" come from?
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly says, 'The name " English" comes form the Angles.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: According to the passage, modern English differs form Old English in ______.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'Old English sounds different, and it has some different rules of grammar. There were only a few thousand words in Old English.'

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'There were only a few thousand words in Old English,' implying Modern English has more.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
When Mencius(孟子) was a small boy, his father died. So Mencius and his mother were quite poor. One day Mencius returned home from school and found his mother making some cloth(布). It was very beautiful and expensive.
"How much of your book did you read today?" Mencius's mother asked him.
Mencius threw down his book. "I didn't read any of it," he answered, "I played with some friends of mine in the fields."
When his mother heard this, she picked up a pair of scissors and cut the colth.
"Why did you cut your cloth?" Mencius asked, "It was so beautiful and now you wasted(浪费) it."
"You wasted your time," his mother said. "Now I wasted mine. Look at the terrible thing we did!"
Mencius learnt a lot from this lesson. After this, he always studied hard.

questions.text: When did the story happen? <blank>.
questions.explanation: Mencius lived over 2000 years ago.

questions.text: One day, when Mencius returned home from school, his mother was <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states she was making cloth.

questions.text: What was Mencius doing while his mother was cutting the cloth? <blank>.

choices.B: He was playing in the fields
choices.C: He was trying to help her

questions.explanation: Before the mother cut the cloth, Mencius was playing in the fields. After the mother cut the cloth, he was watching strangely.

questions.text: Why did his mother cut her cloth? Because <blank>.

choices.A: she thought making cloth was just wasting time.
choices.B: she wanted to make some more beautiful cloth
choices.C: she wanted to make a coat for her son.
choices.D: she wanted to show her son a terrible thing

questions.explanation: She wanted to show him the consequence of wasting time.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Cause & Effect

questions.text: Mencius learned a lot from this lesson. After this, he always <blank>.

choices.C: helped his mother with making cloth

questions.explanation: The last sentence of the passage confirms he studied hard.

question_sets.context:
One day a lawyer's (律师) wife fell ill and he went to get a doctor. The doctor went to see the woman, but before he went into the house he stopped. He knew that the lawyer never paid his bill. So he said to the man, "But if I do cure(治愈)your wife, I am afraid you may not pay(付钱) me."
"Sir," said the lawyer, "here I have $500. Whether(是否)you cure my wife or kill her I will give you all this."
The doctor was now sure of the payment and went into the house. When he reached the woman's bedside, it was soon clear to him that he could do little. She was badly ill, and though (尽管)he gave her some medicine to take , she soon died. He told the lawyer he was very sorry, then asked for the money. "Did you kill my wife?" asked the lawyer. "Of course not," said the doctor. "Well ,did you cure my wife?" asked the lawyer. "I'm afraid that wasn't possible(可能)," answered the doctor. "Well then ,since(既然)you didn't kill her and you didn't cure her, I have nothing to pay you."

questions.text: Before the doctor went into the lawyer's house he stopped because <blank>.

choices.A: the lawyer was too poor to pay his bills
choices.B: the lawyer had a bad name
choices.C: he knew well he couldn't cure the lawyer's wife
choices.D: it was well-known that the lawyer would not be willing(愿意)to pay what he should

questions.explanation: The passage states the lawyer never paid his bill.

questions.text: Because the lawyer's wife was badly ill, the doctor <blank>.

choices.A: didn't look over her at all
choices.B: found it impossible(不可能) to cure her
choices.C: spent a lot of time operating on her

questions.explanation: It was soon clear that the doctor could do little, suggesting it was impossible to cure her.

questions.text: After the lawyer's wife died, the doctor <blank>.

choices.A: got nothing except the money for the medicine
choices.D: didn't want to take the pay

questions.explanation: The lawyer used a trick and paid nothing.

questions.text: The doctor was very sorry because <blank>.

choices.A: he didn't cure the lawyer's wife
choices.B: the lawyer's wife was badly ill
choices.D: the lawyer paid nothing for his work

questions.explanation: The doctor expressed sorrow for not being able to cure the wife.

questions.text: Which do you think is the best title(题目) for the passage?

choices.C: A Good Doctor and a Poor Lawyer

questions.explanation: The story revolves around the lawyer's trick to avoid paying.

The old man believed (相信) his friend and began to look for a happy man. He went to many places and met many people. But they all said they were not happy. One day he saw a poor farmer working in the fields. The man was singing all the time and looked very happy. The old man came up to him and asked, "Are you happy, my good man?" "Yes, quite happy," answered the farmer. "Can you give me your shirt?" asked the old man. "My shirt?" the farmer answered. "But I haven't got a shirt, never had one."

question_sets.context:
Different people have different color skin(皮肤).Some have black skin , some have yellow skin , and some have white skin . Once there was a woman in Alaska . Her skin was an orange color . It was almost the color of orange juice . How did this woman become orange ? She ate lots of tomatoes, carrots and squash(南瓜).She ate too many orange things .
This was why her skin turned(变成)orange .
Why did she eat so many orange things ? She thought she needed more sun .So she ate sunny things .
The woman didn't want to be orange . She went to the doctor . The doctor said, "Stop eating orange things . Try some green things." The woman did so . And she wasn't orange any more .

question_sets.context:
Once upon a time there lived an old man. He had three sons. One day, he called them together and said, "Sons, I will die soon. To my oldest son I give half my camels, to my second, one-third(三分之一), and to my youngest, one-ninth (九分之一)." Soon after that he died.
Now, the old man had seventeen camels, and the three brothers didn't know how to do as their father said. They thought a long time about the problem, and it seemed that they must either kill some of the camels and cut them into pieces, or disobey their father. At last they went to their father's old friend and asked for his advice. As soon as he heard their story, he said, "I will help you. I was a good friend of your father's. I am old. I have only one camel, but take it-it is yours."
The three sons thanked the old man and took his camel. Now they found it was easy to do as their father wished, The oldest took half- that was nine camels; the second took one-third, that was six; and the youngest took one-ninth, that was two.
After each had got his camels, they found that there was still a camel there. So, to show their thanks to their father's friend, they gave the camel back to him.

questions.text: "Once upon a time" means " ________".
questions.explanation: "Once upon a time" is a fixed expression, meaning "long long ago".

questions.text: The meaning of "disobey" in the second paragraph is" ________".
questions.explanation: "disobey" means "违背" in Chinese.

questions.text: The meaning of "asked for his advice" in the second paragraph is " ________".
questions.explanation: "asked for his advice" means "向他请教" in Chinese.

questions.text: The second old man ________the three brothers.
questions.explanation: The second old man helped the three brothers to divide the camels, so he was good to them.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Character Analysis

questions.text: Both the two old men in the story were ________.
questions.explanation: Both the two old men were clever, because they solved the problem of dividing the camels.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Character Analysis

question_sets.context:
When you are in England, you must be very careful in the streets because the traffic drives on the left.
Before you cross a street, you must look to the right first and then the left.
If the traffic lights are red, the traffic must stop. Then the people on foot can cross the road--carefully!
If the traffic lights are green, the traffic can go. People on foot mustn't cross.
In the morning and in the evening when people go to or come from work, the streets are very busy. Traffic is most dangerous then.
When you go by bus in England, you have to be careful, too. Always remember the traffic moves on the left. So you must be careful. Have a look first or you will go the wrong way.
In many English cities, there are big buses with two floors. You can sit on the second floor. From there you can see the city very well. It's very interesting!

choices.A: there are many cars and buses on the road
choices.B: the buses and cars move on the left

questions.explanation: The passage clearly states that the traffic drives on the left.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly mentions looking to the right first and then to the left.

choices.B: the traffic, the people on foot
choices.C: the traffic, the people on bikes

questions.explanation: The passage states that when the traffic lights are green, the traffic can go and people on foot mustn't cross.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that there are big buses with two floors in many English cities.

question_sets.context:
A Clever Parrot
A man has a parrot. It's blue and green. It can speak like a man. Every morning the man goes to talk with it. But the parrot doesn't say anything to him.
Then one morning the man is angry with it. He doesn't give it any food and water. The next morning the man goes to see the parrot again. He says something to it. But the parrot still doesn't speak. At last the man says, "Fool! You're a fool." Soon he hears the same words from the parrot. He laughs.
He loves it very much. It's a clever parrot.

question_sets.context:
The other day a man William Smith went to a po lice. He wanted to get a license to drive a car. Behind the desk in the police station sat a police captain. "I'd like to get a license to drive a car. " said Mr. Smith shyly. "You have to fill out this card first, " said the captain, throwing a small white card in Mr. Smith's direction (方向). "Put your name at the top. "" In ink?" asked Mr. Smith very politely. "Of come. In ink. " said the captain. "Put your last name first and your first name last. " "How's that?" said Smith. "Write your name backwards. BACKWARDS! Backwards? " That's right. "That's just what I said. "
Slowly, carefully, Mr. Smith began to write. It seemed a little strange (奇怪的) to him. But the police captain must know what was correct. Smith wrote his name : HTIMSMAILLIW.

question_sets.context:
People communicate with words. Do you think you can communicate without words? A smile on your face shows you are happy or friendly. Tears in your eyes tell others that you are sad. When you raise your hand in class, the teacher knows that you want to say something or ask questions. You shake your head, and people know you are saying “No.” You nod and people know you are saying “Yes”.
Other things can also carry messages, for example, a sign at the bus stop helps you to know which bus to take. Signs on the door tell you where to go in or out. Have you ever noticed that there are a lot of signs around you and that you receive messages from them all the time?
People can communicate in many other ways. An artist can use his drawing to tell about beautiful mountains; about the blue sea and many other things.
Books are written to tell you about all the wonderful things in the world and also about people and their ideas. Books, magazines, TV and radio and films all help us to communicate with others. They all help us to know what is going on in the world and what other people are thinking about.

questions.text: Which example about communication without words isn't mentioned?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions smiles, tears, nodding, and raising hands, but not shaking hands.

questions.text: From the passage we know that signs on the door tell you <blank>.

choices.A: which floor the room locates on
choices.C: where to go in or out
choices.D: the layout of the whole building

questions.explanation: The passage states, "Signs on the door tell you where to go in or out."

questions.text: In the writer's opinion, <blank>.

choices.A: word is the best way for people to communicate with each other
choices.B: a sign at the bus stop can also carry messages
choices.D: the two main ways for communication are words and signs

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that "a sign at the bus stop helps you to know which bus to take", implying signs also carry messages.

question_sets.context:
The world is divided (划分) into two parts. One half of the world is rich and the other is poor. In the poor part, a lot of people never have enough to eat. When they are ill, none of the hospitals can accept them because they have no money. In the rich part, a lot of people eat too much. For example, a dog or a cat in North America eats better than a child in some poor countries.
The poor countries have some difficult problems to solve. Sometimes the land is too poor to grow anything on. People there have neither rich land nor enough water. The land can be made better, but a lot of things must be done. The people must be taught and water must be found.
But rich countries have problems, too. There are not always good places to live in. Sometimes the air is not clean and the rivers are too dirty to swim in or to drink from. The roads and streets are full of people and buses. Cars and buses have to move slowly. There is too much noise. Some people don't have houses. Something must be done about these problems. The air and the rivers must be cleaned and be kept clean. More houses have to be built. But these things can't be done easily.

question_sets.context:
One day Mrs. Jones went shopping. When her husband came home in the evening, she began to tell him about a beautiful cotton dress."I saw it in a shop this morning,"she said,"and…"
"And you want to buy it."said her husband,"How much does it cost?"
"Fifteen pounds."
"Fifteen pounds for a cotton dress? That's too much."
But every evening, when Mr. Jones came back from work, his wife continued to speak only about the dress, and at last, after a week, he said,"Oh, buy the dress. Here's the money."
But the next evening, when Mr. Jones came home and asked,"Have you bought the famous dress?"
"No,"she said.
"Why no?"he asked.
"Well,"Mrs. Jones said,"it was still in the window of the shop after a week, so I thought, 'Nobody else wants this dress', so I don't want it either."

questions.explanation: The text says 'tell him about a beautiful cotton dress'.

choices.B: Because she no longer liked it.
choices.C: Because nobody else wanted to buy it.
choices.D: Because the dress was too expensive.

questions.explanation: The text says 'every evening... after a week'.

questions.explanation: The text says 'Oh, buy the dress. Here's the money'.

question_sets.context:
(1) A ten-year-old Teacher
How young can a teacher be? A teacher can be any age .Just ask Chrissie Mckenney .She was only 10 when she started teaching.
How did Chrissie get the job? It was not easy. Chrissie wanted to help children who cannot hear .But the school had never had such a young helper. Could Chrissie do it?
First, Chrissie learned to sign. Signing is a way of talking with your hands .Soon it was easy for Chrissie to talk to the children. So the school let her help. Now Chrissie visits the school almost every day. The children love their young teacher. She is their friend.

questions.text: Chrissie wanted to help children who can't __________.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "Chrissie wanted to help children who cannot hear."

questions.explanation: The story describes Chrissie, who was a young teacher.

questions.text: In the third part of the story, what does the word "learned" mean __________?
questions.explanation: "Learned" means found out how to do something.

questions.text: The school let Chrissie help because she__________.
questions.explanation: The school let Chrissie help because she could sign, which is a way of communicating with children who cannot hear.

questions.text: You can guess from the story that most teachers__________ Chrissie.
questions.explanation: Since Chrissie started teaching at 10, it's reasonable to guess that most teachers are older than her.

The earth moves round the sun, and the moon moves round the earth. When our part of the earth turns to the moon, it is night.
The sun is much bigger than the moon. But sometimes the moon looks bigger than the sun, because it's much nearer to the earth.
The sun is very bright. It gives a very strong light. The moon looks quite bright,
too. But it doesn't give any light at all.
The moon looks much bigger and brighter than the stars. But actually the stars are much bigger and brighter than the moon. They look smaller than the moon because they're much farther away from us.

question_sets.context:
Different countries have different food. If you go to England, you may find many fish and chip shops along the streets. Fish and chips is the most popular take-away food in England. People often have this kind of food at shops, but sometimes they put the food into paper bags and take it away, or to their work place.
Chinese take-away food is also popular in England, Australia and America, but the most popular take-away food in the USA is fried chicken.

question_sets.context:
Two weeks after the Second World War (战争)began, Peter wanted to join the army, but he was only 16 years old, and boys were allowed to join only if they were over 18.So when the army doctorexaminedhim, he said that he was 18. But Peter's brother Bill had joined the army a few days before, and the same doctor had examined him, too. This doctor remembered Bill's family name, so when he saw Peter's papers, he was surprised.
"How old are you?" he said.
"Eighteen, Sir." said Peter.
"But your brother was eighteen, too." said the doctor, "Are you twins?"
"Oh, no, Sir," said Peter, and his face went red, "My brother is five months older than me."

questions.explanation: The passage states that the story happened two weeks after the Second World War began.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that Peter was only 16 years old.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Bill had joined the army a few days before.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that the doctor was surprised.

questions.text: What is the Chinese meaning of "examined" in the passage?
questions.explanation: "Examined" means '检查' in Chinese in this context.

question_sets.context:
Almost every child in cities has the chance to go to school, but not all children in the villages are so lucky.
There is a girl called Xiao Lian. She is ten years old and lives in a small village. When she was seven, she wanted to go to school. But she could not, because her family was too poor to afford theschool feesfor her, so her parents had to keep her at home. Instead of studying, Xiao Lian looked after her brother and worked in the field every day. Then the Hope Project ( 希望工程 ) heard about Xiao Lian. It agreed to help her to go to school. Her wish of study came true, and now she is studying in a school.
Unluckily there are many thousands of children who can not go to school. You can join in Hope Project and help these children. You know all the good work needs money. Hope Project needs your help.
If you give Hope Project ￥300 each year, it can pay for one child to go to school for a whole year. With more money, Hope Project can build new schools, buy good desks, chairs , blackboards and books. Let's help the children together and give them a chance to have a good start in life.

questions.text: School feesmeans _________ in Chinese.
questions.explanation: "School fees" means '学费' in Chinese.

choices.B: she had to look after her brother
choices.D: she didn't like to go to school

questions.explanation: The passage states that her family was too poor to afford the school fees.

questions.text: A poor child can go to school for _________ with 300 yuan.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that 300 yuan can pay for one child to go to school for a whole year.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that not all children in the villages are lucky to go to school.

choices.B: Xiao Lian joined in Hope Project
choices.C: There are three people in Xiao Lian's family
choices.D: Hope Project helps poor children to go to school

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that Hope Project helps poor children to go to school.

question_sets.context:
In Britain the weather never gets too hot or too cold. There is not a great difference between summer and winter. Why is this?
Britain has a warm winter and a cool summer because it is an island country. In winter the sea is warmer than the land. The winds from the sea bring warm air to Britain. In summer the sea is cooler than the land. The winds from the sea bring cool air to Britain.
The winds from the west blow over Britain all the year. They blow from the southwest across the Atlantic Ocean (大西洋). They are wet winds. They bring rain to Britain all the year. The west of Britain is wetter than the east. The winds must blow across the high land in the west. The east of Britain is drier than the west.

questions.text: What's the weather like in Britain?

choices.A: It's either too hot or too cold.
choices.B: It's both too hot and too cold.
choices.C: It's neither too hot nor too cold.

questions.explanation: The first sentence states that the weather in Britain never gets too hot or too cold.

questions.text: When do the winds bring cool air to Britain?
questions.explanation: The passage states that in summer the sea is cooler than the land, and the winds from the sea bring cool air to Britain.

questions.text: Why is the weather in summer and in winter almost the same?

choices.A: There is no difference between summer and winter in Britain.
choices.B: There is sea air around this country.
choices.C: There are winds from the high land.
choices.D: There is much rain in the Atlantic Ocean.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that the sea's temperature influences the air, making summers cooler and winters warmer.

questions.text: Which of the following is right?

choices.A: There is more rain in the east than in the west.
choices.B: There is as much rain in the west as in the east.
choices.C: There is less rain in the east than in the west.
choices.D: There isn't so much rain in the west as in the east.

questions.explanation: The passage states that 'The west of Britain is wetter than the east', which means there is less rain in the east than in the west.

questions.text: The text tells us ________.
questions.explanation: The passage mainly describes the factors that influence the weather in Britain.

question_sets.context:
Do you get angry when your friends sing loudly while you are trying to work? Or when your best friend does not wait for you after school?
If you do, you need to take control (控制) of your feelings and stop getting angry so easily. Getting angry with people can cause you to lose friends.
Gary Egeberg, an American high school teacher, has written "My Feelings Are Just Like Wild Animals" to help you control your feelings. It tells teens how to stay cool when bad things happen to them.
The book says that getting angry only makes problems worse. It can never make them better. Getting angry is not a natural(天然的) way to act, the book says. It is just a bad habit (习惯), like smoking(抽烟). The book says you can control your anger(生气) easily ---- all you have to do is tell yourself not to be angry.
When a baby falls over, it only cries if people are watching it. Like a baby, you should only get angry if you are sure it is the right thing to do.
The book gives many tips(建议) to help you if you get angry easily. Here are our top three:
1. Keep a record. Every time you get angry write down why you are angry. Look at it later and you will see you get angry too easily.
2. Ask your friends to stop talking to you when you get angry. This will teach you not to be angry.
3. Do something different. When you get angry, walk away from the problem and go somewhere else. Try to laugh!

questions.text: You may be get angry ________ in this passage.

choices.A: when your best friends don't wait for you after school
choices.B: when you hear your bad mark after taking the exam
choices.C: if you don't control your feelings all the time
choices.D: if you can't work out the problems in class

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage mentions getting angry when your best friends don't wait for you after school.

questions.text: If you often become angry with people, ____________.

choices.D: you won't make friends later on

questions.explanation: The second sentence states that getting angry with people can cause you to lose friends.

questions.text: _______ tells teens to keep cool when bad things happen to them.
questions.explanation: Gary Egeberg, an American high school teacher, wrote a book to help you control your feelings.

questions.text: Which is the best title(标题) of the passage?

choices.B: How to keep cool when angry.

questions.explanation: The book is to help you control your feelings and tells teens how to stay cool when bad things happen to them.

questions.text: Which of the following sentences is right?

choices.A: Getting angry every time is as good a habit as getting up early every morning.
choices.B: Please keep an angry record every time so that you will turn angry easily.
choices.C: You'd better ask your friends to talk with you when you are in anger.
choices.D: You are always telling yourself to stay cool to control your anger if you are getting angry.

questions.explanation: The book says you can control your anger easily ---- all you have to do is tell yourself not to be angry.

question_sets.context:
Last Sunday I saw the worst storm. It came suddenly and went on for more than three hours.
After lunch, I went into my room to have a rest. The air was hot, and all was quiet. The strong wind started blowing into my room suddenly. Pieces of paper on my desk flew high into the air and some flew out of the open window. As I ran out to catch them, big drops of rain began to fall.
When I came back into the house, it was raining harder and harder. I tried very hard to close the window. Then I heard a loud crashing(碰撞的) sound from the back of the house. I ran out of my room to find out what it was- a big tree had fallen down and broken the top of the back room.

choices.C: while I was in the back room
choices.D: while I was in the garden

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'It came suddenly and went on for more than three hours'.

questions.text: The wind blew some of the paper ______.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'Pieces of paper on my desk flew high into the air and some flew out of the open window'.

questions.text: The top of the back room was broken because of _______.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'a big tree had fallen down and broken the top of the back room'.

question_sets.context:
A ten-year-old Teacher
How young can a teacher be? A teacher can be any age .Just ask Chrissie Mckenney .She was only 10 when she started teaching.
How did Chrissie get the job? It was not easy. Chrissie wanted to help children who cannot hear .But the school had never had such a young helper. Could Chrissie do it?
First, Chrissie learned to sign. Signing is a way of talking with your hands .Soon it was easy for Chrissie to talk to the children. So the school let her help. Now Chrissie visits the school almost every day. The children love their young teacher. She is their friend.

questions.explanation: The passage states, "Chrissie wanted to help children who cannot hear."

questions.explanation: The story focuses on Chrissie, who was a young teacher.

questions.text: In the third part of the story, what does the word "learned" mean __________?
questions.explanation: In the context, "learned" means to acquire knowledge or skill, which is similar to "found out how."

questions.text: The school let Chrissie help because she__________.
questions.explanation: She learned to sign, allowing her to communicate with the children.

questions.text: You can guess from the story that most teachers__________ Chrissie.
questions.explanation: Since Chrissie was only 10, most teachers would be older than her.

The earth moves round the sun, and the moon moves round the earth. When our part of the earth turns to the moon, it is night.
The sun is much bigger than the moon. But sometimes the moon looks bigger than the sun, because it's much nearer to the earth.
The sun is very bright. It gives a very strong light. The moon looks quite bright,too. But it doesn't give any light at all.
The moon looks much bigger and brighter than the stars. But actually the stars are much bigger and brighter than the moon. They look smaller than the moon because they're much farther away from us.

question_sets.context:
Henry finds a job on a farm. He is the strongest and youngest. He eats more, sleeps more, but works less. He doesn't like to use his head, so he knows little. He has to do some unskilled (无需特殊技能的) work. He always says he's tired and hopes to have a good rest. So he gets less money than others.
Winter is coming. The workers are getting ready for the next year. Only Henry does nothing. The farmer tells him to cut down some trees in the forest. The young man has to go there with a chair. He feels lonely (寂寞的) in the forest and is afraid of the animals. So he looks around and sings loudly. Nobody knows what he's singing.
After three days, Henry doesn't cut down any trees. The farmer feels strange. He wants to find out how the young man is working there. To his anger (生气), Henry is sitting on the chair, cutting the tree. "Why are you sitting here to cut the trees?" asks the farmer. "Because I can't work if lying (躺着), sir."

question_sets.context:
Dr Smift was a famous man. Near his house lived a rich old lady. She always send him some presents by her servant (仆人) . Dr Smift took the presents but never gave the boy anything. One day the boy ran into the room and threw a bag full of meat on the desk and said. "My mistress (女主人) sent you some meat."
Smift said "My boy, that's not the way to give someone a present. Now you sit in my chair, watch what I will do."
The boy sat down, Smift went out, knocked at the door and waited. The boy said "come in. " The doctor came in, walked to the desk and said, "If you please sir, my mistress sends me to say hello to you and hopes you will take the bag full of meat." The boy answered, "Thank you, my boy. Give your mistress Dr Smift's thanks for her kindness. And here's two shillings (先令) for yourself. " The doctor laughed, and after that, Smift never forgot to give his tip (小费) .

questions.explanation: The passage states that Dr. Smift was a famous man.

questions.explanation: The old lady sent presents, which suggests she was kind.

questions.explanation: The boy threw the meat on the desk, indicating rudeness.

choices.A: to give the boy some presents
choices.B: to teach him how to write
choices.C: to give the boy a lesson
choices.D: to teach the boy how to be a polite boy

questions.explanation: Dr. Smift demonstrated the proper way to give a gift.

questions.text: After that, Smift <blank>.
questions.explanation: Smift remembered to give the boy tips after the lesson.

question_sets.context:
Jimmy is a very kind young man. He works in a big supermarket. His workmates like him very much.
Last month Jimmy caught a bad cold, he stayed in bed for about two weeks. But after he got well. Something happened―he couldn't stop winking(眨眼) . When he stayed at home, he was all right as usual. But if he went out, he couldn't stop his eyes from winking.
Jimmy went to work the next morning. On the way he met a policeman and winked at him. The policeman felt surprised but said nothing. Then he met an old man and winked at him. The old man thought he must be mad. But still he didn't say a word.
Real trouble started when he met women. First he met a young lady. He winked at her. The woman's face turned red, and ran away as fast as she could. And then he met an old woman who carried a walking stick. Jimmy winked at her, she looked closely at him. Jimmy winked again. Without saying a word, she hit Jimmy on the head with her walking-stick.
"Take that!" she cried out "This is a lesson(教训) for you."
Poor Jimmy! How could he explain it ? He ran away quickly.
From then on, he always wears a pair of dark glasses when he goes out.

questions.text: What had happened to Jimmy after he caught a bad cold?<blank>

choices.A: He had to stay in hospital for a long time.
choices.B: He couldn't stop closing his eyes.
choices.D: There was something wrong with his eyes.

questions.explanation: Jimmy couldn't stop winking, which is related to his eyes.

questions.text: When he stayed at home, <blank>.

choices.A: He couldn't control (控制) his eyes of winking.
choices.D: He wore a pair of dark glasses.

questions.explanation: He was all right when he stayed at home.

questions.text: Who felt surprised when Jimmy winked? <blank>
questions.explanation: The policeman felt surprised.

questions.text: Jimmy winked at the young lady because <blank> .

choices.A: he wanted to talk with her.
choices.D: he couldn't stop his eyes from winking.

questions.explanation: He couldn't stop winking.

questions.text: Why did the old woman hit Jimmy?<blank>

choices.A: Because she was the young lady's grandma.

questions.explanation: The old woman hit Jimmy because he winked at her.

question_sets.context:
In Africa I heard a story about a giraffe that did not believe himself.
The giraffe's mother had left him when he was a few days old because she couldn't feed him. For three years he lived in the warden's (看守人) house and played with the children. Then he grew too large for the house.
The family decided that he should return to his fellows (伙伴). They took him to join a herd (一群) of wild giraffes.
One look was enough for the giraffe's small brain(大脑). He could not believe that such extraordinary(特别的) animals existed(存在). Or that he was one of them! He turned and bolted (逃走).
The family took him back several times. In the end they gave up (放弃). Now their giraffe lives by himself near the warden's house.

questions.text: The baby giraffe was probably separated (分开) from his mother because <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states the mother left because she couldn't feed him.

choices.A: too wild to play with the children
choices.B: too large to play with the children
choices.D: too big to live in the house

questions.explanation: The passage says he grew too large for the house.

questions.text: The warden's family tried to <blank>.

choices.A: let the giraffe do what he liked
choices.C: tell the giraffe what he was
choices.D: take the giraffe to join the herd

questions.explanation: The family took him to join a herd of wild giraffes.

questions.text: When he met the herd, the giraffe could not understand <blank>.

choices.A: how animals like giraffes could exist
choices.B: why he wouldn't join the other giraffes
choices.C: that he was really a giraffe, too

questions.explanation: He could not believe such extraordinary animals existed, or that he was one of them.

questions.text: The story suggests (暗示) that <blank>.

choices.A: most mother giraffes leave their babies
choices.C: giraffes are not very smart (精明)

questions.explanation: The giraffe's inability to recognize himself suggests a lack of understanding.

question_sets.context: Mr. Jones and Mr. Brown worked in the same office . One day Mr. Jones said to Mr. Brown ,"We are going to have a small party at our house next Wednesday evening . Would you and your wife like to join us ?" Mr. Brown said ,"Thank you very much . That is very kind of you . We are free that evening . I think , but I will telephone my wife and ask her . Maybe she wants to go somewhere else that evening ."So Mr. Brown went to the other room and telephoned . When he came back , he looked very sorry . "What is the matter ?"said Mr. Jones ."Did you speak to your wife ?" "No ,"answered Mr. Brown ,"She wasn't there , my small son answered the telephone . I said to him ,'Is your mother there , David ?'and he answered ,'No , she is not in the house ,''Where is she then ?'I asked .'She is somewhere outside .''What is she doing ?''She is looking for me .'"

question_sets.context: Jack London was a famous American writer . He was born on January 12 , 1876 , in San Francisco , California . His family was very poor , and Jack had to leave school to make money . He worked hard in many different jobs . Later , Jack returned to school , but he didn't stay . He wrote ,"Life and pocketbook(袖珍书)were both too short ." In 1897 , he went to Alaska to find gold . Instead , he found ideas there for his books and stories . He returned home and started to write . His writings were successful(成功的), and he became rich and famous in his twenties . Jack London was not a happy man , however . In poor health , he took his own life(自杀)in 1916 . He was only 40 years old .

question_sets.context: One day, Mr. Black went into a restaurant. He put his coat on a chair near the door. There was nothing in the pockets of his coat. After he had his meal, he went to take his coat back. He found there was much money in one of his pockets."Whose is this?"he thought. He saw a waiter near the door, so Mr. Black said to him,"Somebody put a lot of money in my coat. I have no time to wait for him. I have to go. Take it, please. When he comes back, give it to him."The waiter took it and went away. At the moment, another man came with a coat just like Mr. Black's."I'm sorry,"said the man."I took your coat and you got mine. Please give me my coat and the money."Mr. Black answered,"I gave the money to the waiter. He'll give it to you." Mr. Black called the manager(经理), but the manager said, "We have no waiters here. We only have waitresses(女服务员). He must be a thief(贼)!"
