question_sets.context: An old woman suddenly got blind(瞎). She promised(答应)a doctor a lot of money if he could make her see again. "If you fail," she said, "you will get nothing. " The doctor agreed. The doctor soon found out what was wrong with her , but he decided not to cure(治愈)her right away. Instead , each time he visited , he secretly took one of her things. When he had taken everything he wanted, he cured her blindness and set her a large bill. Now when the old woman could see again she found that all her things had gone and she refused(拒绝)to pay the bill. So the doctor took her before a judge. "But I say I am not cured , because I can't still see any of the things in my house. " The old woman won her case(讼案)and the doctor went away unhappily without getting his pay.

question_sets.context:
Jenny began to go to school when she was at the age of six．She liked her first day very much．Her teacher, Miss Black, was very nice, too．
At the end of the second day, the other children left the classroom after school, but Jenny stayed behind and waited．At first, Miss Black had some work to do and did not see Jenny, but then she looked up and saw her．
"Why not go with the others, Jenny?" she asked her kindly,"Did you want to ask me some questions?"
"Yes, Miss Black," Jenny said．
"What is it?" Miss Black asked．
"What did I do in school today?" Jenny said．
Miss Black laughed,"What did you do in school today?" she said,"Why did you ask me that, Jenny?"
"Because I'm going home now," Jenny answered,"and my mother's going to ask me．"

question_sets.context:
In the sea there are many island. In its warm water there are some little ones. We call them Coral Island(珊瑚岛).
A coral island is very nice to look at. It looks like a ring of land with trees, grass, and flowers on it. One part of the ring is open to the water. There is a little round lake inside the island.
If you look at a piece of coral, you will see many little holes in it. In each of these holes a very small animals has lived. There sea animals make the coral. They began to build under the water. Year after year, the coral grew higher and higher. At last it grew out of water.
Then the sea brought it to small trees and something else. After some tears, these things changed into a earth. Sometimes birds flew over it and brought seeds to the island.
The little seeds grew. In a few years there were plants all over the island. In a few more years there were trees growing there.
So you see, these island were built by little. The workers were very small. Do they not teach us a lesson ? Can you think what the lesson is?

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "It looks like a ring of land with trees, grass, and flowers on it."

questions.explanation: The passage states, "In each of these holes a very small animals has lived."

question_sets.context:
Dear John,
Thank you very much for your letter. I am glad that you enjoyed your holiday with me. We enjoyed having you and your sister here. We hope that you will both be able to come again next year. Perhaps you'll be able to stay longer next time you come. A week is not really long enough, is it? If your school has five weeks holiday next year, perhaps you'll be able to stay with us for two or three weeks.
We are long back at school three weeks now. It feels like three months! I hope that you are both working very hard now that you are in Grade One. I shall have to work hard next year when I am in Grade One. Tom and Ann won't be in Grade One until 2002.
They went for a picnic yesterday but I didn't go with them because I cut my foot and I couldn't walk very well. They went to an island(岛)and enjoyed themselves there. Do you still remember the island? That's where all five of us spent the last day of our holiday.
Tom, Ann and I send our best wishes to Betty and you. We hope to see you soon.
Yours sincerely,
Michael

question_sets.context:
Mr. Green had a farm in England. He and his wife grew a lot of things on the farm. They worked very hard. One day Mr. Green said to his wife, "Dear, let's go to London next Sunday. We can have a good lunch there, and then we can go to the cinema." His wife was very happy when she heard this, because she and her husband always ate a lot, and she didn't like cooking three times every day.
They went to London by train and walked for an hour. When it was twelve o'clock, they wanted to have a meal. They looked at a few restaurants. In one of them there was a blackboard outside. On the blackboard was "Lunch 12:30 ￡1.50".
"Well, that's good," Mr. Green said, "We eat for two hours for ￡1.50 here! This is the palce for us."

questions.explanation: The price of lunch was only ￡1.50, so the restaurant was very cheap.

choices.B: they must eat for two hours
choices.C: they could have lunch any time between 12:30 and 2:30
choices.D: They must be in the restaurant at 12:30 and leave at 2:30

questions.explanation: They eat for two hours for ￡1.50 here!

question_sets.context:
A man came out of the airport. A lot of taxis were there. He asked the name of every taxi-driver. Then he took the 3rd one. It cost 5 dollars from the airport to the hotel. "How much does it cost for the whole day?" the man asked. "One hundred dollars, "said the taxi-driver. This was very expensive, but the man said it was OK.
The driver took the man everywhere. He showed him all the parks and museums in the city. In the evening, they went back to the hotel. The man gave the driver I00 dollars and said, "What about tomorrow?" The taxi-driver looked at the man and said, "Tomorrow? It's another I00 dollars. " But the man said, "That's OK! See you tomorrow. "The driver was very pleased.
The next day the driver took the man everywhere again. They visited all the parks and museums again. And in the evening they went hack to the hotel. The man gave the driver 100 dollars again and going home tomorrow. " The driver was because he liked the man and above all, 100 dollars a day was a lot of money. "So you're going home. Where do you come from?" he asked. "I come from New York. "" New York!" said the driver. I have a sister in New York. Her name is Lucy. Do you know her? Of course I know her. She gave me 200 dollars for you!"

question_sets.context: Our eating habits are very important for good health and a strong body. There are times when most of us like eating sweets and ice cream better than meat and rice. Sweets and ice cream are not bad for us if we eat them at the end of a meal. If we eat them before a meal, they may take away our appetite(食欲). It's important for us to eat our meal at regular(规律)time each day. When we feel worry or excited, we may not want to eat. A long time ago, in England, some judges(法官) often decided whether a man was telling truth by giving him some dry bread. If the man could not swallow(吞)the bread, it meant that he wasn't telling the truth. Though this seems strange and foolish they thought it was good way of finding out truth. A man who is worrying something has difficulty in swallowing anything dry, because he loses his appetite.

questions.explanation: According to the first sentence, good eating habits contribute to good health and a strong body.

questions.explanation: The passage states that sweets and ice cream are not bad for us if we eat them at the end of a meal.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that it's important to eat our meal at regular time each day.

questions.explanation: The passage says that when we feel worry or excited, we may not want to eat.

question_sets.context: Have you ever heard the song Auld Lang Syne(<友谊天长地久>或译<旧日逝去不再来>)?"Auld Lang Syne" means, in English, "old days gone by". The music was an old Scottish tune. People in Britain usually sing this song on special occasions(时刻), such as  New Year's Eve, when they gather either at home or in the local pubs, enjoying their whisky or beer. This song was originally written by Robert Burns(罗伯特・彭斯) in Scottish. Robert Burns was born at Alloway in 1759. He wrote about three hundred traditional songs, both in the Scottish dialect(苏格兰方言) and in Standard English(标准英语). Burns' birthplace, a cottage, is now a museum. Scotsmen celebrate Burns' birthday on 25 January every year.

questions.explanation: The passage states the song was written in Scottish.

questions.text: "Auld Lang Syne" means, in English, "<blank>".
questions.explanation: The passage states that "Auld Lang Syne" means "old days gone by" in English.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Robert Burns wrote songs in Scottish dialect and Standard English.

questions.text: In the passage, "museum" means "<blank>".
questions.explanation: "Museum" means "博物馆" in Chinese.

questions.text: When is Robert Burns's birthday?
questions.explanation: The passage indicates Burns' birthday is celebrated on January 25th.

question_sets.context:
No.4 Middle School
Kunming ,Yunnan
April 2nd,2004
Dear editor,
I live in a beautiful city. Many visitors come to my city. There are so many colorful peacocks here. The peacocks mostly live on the grass land of Dongfeng Square.
They are given food freely by visitors. They usually throw food to them, and don't think about at all whether the food is right or not. Some of the peacocks become ill, some even died after eating the bad food given by the visitors. I'm sure most of the visitors who throw food to the peacocks really like the birds, but don't realize that they may be doing them harm. The visitors should be told that what have done is very harmful to the birds, and this kind of thing must be stopped from happening. Perhaps we can build some small shops beside Dongfeng Square to sell peacock food. For us every person, it's our duty to give more love to these beautiful birds and to look after them carefully.
Yours,
Sun Yan

questions.explanation: From the passage, we can know that many visitors come to the writer's city to see beautiful peacocks.

questions.text: Some peacocks became ill and died because some visitors <blank>.

choices.D: loved them and played with them

questions.explanation: From the passage, we can know that some peacocks became ill and died because some visitors threw them some bad food.

questions.text: Some shops can be built beside Dongfeng Square so that they may <blank>.
questions.explanation: From the passage, we can know that some shops can be built beside Dongfeng Square so that they may sell food for peacocks.

questions.text: From the passage we know people should <blank>.

choices.A: live and play with the birds
choices.B: stop the birds from eating too much
choices.C: give right food to the birds
choices.D: give more food to the birds

questions.explanation: From the passage, we can know that people should give right food to the birds.

questions.text: We can guess the writer of the letter, Sun Yan, may be a <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer is a student.

question_sets.context:
A man made a nice talking machine. It could weigh people's weight. The man wanted to try the machine before he could make a lot of machines.
He put the machine into the waiting room of a station. There were always lots of people in and out.
The first one who used the machine was an Indian woman. She stood on the machine, the machine thought for a few seconds to decide which language to speak.
"Good morning, Madam." it said in Indian. "Your weight is 72 kilograms. That's three kilograms more. If you eat more fruit and vegetables, you will be soon all right. Please have a nice day."
The second one to use the machine was a Chinese girl. She stood on the machine and waited to hear her weight.
"Good morning, Miss." the machine said in Chinese. "Your weight is 45 kilograms. It's all right for your age. Keep eating what you eat every day. Please have a nice day."
The third one to use the machine was a very fat American woman. She thought for a long time to stand on the machine. The machine spoke quickly in English, "Good morning. Will one of you get off?"

questions.text: The machine in this passage could <blank>.

choices.B: tell people what they should eat

questions.explanation: The machine could weigh and talk to people.

questions.text: The man put his first machine <blank>.
questions.explanation: The man put his first machine in the station.

questions.text: The machine told the Indian woman <blank>.

choices.D: to eat what she wanted to eat

questions.explanation: The machine told the Indian woman she was a little heavier.

questions.text: The machine said to a Chinese girl that she <blank>.
questions.explanation: The machine said to a Chinese girl that she kept herself healthy.

questions.text: How was the American woman?
questions.explanation: The American woman was too heavy.

question_sets.context:
Roberto Clemente was a_great_basketball player, in fact, he was a star. He could jump to catch a ball. He could run fast .And he could hit a ball hard.
Roberto Clemente loved children. He wanted to build a park for the children of Puerto Rico.
In 1972, Roberto was killed in an airplane, but people did not forget him. They sent money for the park. In 1975, the park was opened .Roberto Clemente's dream had come true.
Notes:
1. kill 杀死 2.dream 梦想 3.come true 实现.

questions.text: Roberto Clemente was killed in __________.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "In 1972, Roberto was killed in an airplane."

questions.text: This story tells about __________.
questions.explanation: The story is about Roberto Clemente, and his kindness is shown through wanting to build a park for children.

questions.text: In the first part of the story, what does the word "great" mean?
questions.explanation: The word 'great' in this context means 'very, very good', describing his skill as a basketball player.

questions.text: Roberto Clemente wanted to build a park because he __________.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "Roberto Clemente loved children. He wanted to build a park for the children of Puerto Rico."

questions.text: You can guess from the story that people __________ Roberto Clemente's dream.
questions.explanation: The passage says that "people did not forget him. They sent money for the park", implying that they 'believed in' his dream.

question_sets.context: Mr Smith gave his wife money every Friday evening. His wife always spent it all the next Wednesday, so that for the next three days she had no money to spend at all. One day Mr Smith asked her, "But how did you spend all that money?" She answered, "I don't know." So one Friday evening, Mr Smith gave her money together with an exercise book and a pencil. He said to his wife, "Please write down how you spend the money." Next Tuesday, his wife had no money again. Mr Smith took the exercise book to see how she had spent it. "I have done what you told me," she said gladly. She had written "Friday, I got 18 pounds from Mr Smith" on the first page, and on the second page, she wrote, "Tuesday, I have spent it all."

question_sets.context:
Modern life is impossible without traveling. The fastest way of traveling is by plane. With a modern airline you can travel in one day to places that it took a month or more to get to a hundred years ago.
Traveling by train is slower than by plane, but it has its advantages. You can see the countries you are traveling through. Modern trains have comfortable seats and dinning-cars. They make even the longest journey enjoyable.
Some people prefer to travel by sea when possible. There are large lines and riverboats. You can visit many other countries and different parts of your country on them. Ships are not so fast as trains or planes, but traveling by sea is a very pleasant way to spend a holiday.
Many people like to travel by car. You can make your own timetable. You can travel three or four hundred miles or fifty or one hundred miles a day, just as you like. You can stop wherever you wish. Where there is something interesting to see, at a good traveling by car is popular for pleasure trip. And also many people usually take a train or a plane when they are traveling on business.

questions.text: From the passage, we know the fastest way of traveling is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence says that the fastest way of traveling is by plane.

questions.text: If we travel by car, we can <blank>.

choices.B: travel to a very far place in several minutes
choices.D: travel only fifty or one hundred miles a day

questions.explanation: The passage states that when traveling by car, you can make your own timetable.

questions.text: The underlined word "They" in the passage refers to <blank>.

choices.C: the travels on the modern trains

questions.explanation: In the second paragraph, "They make even the longest journey enjoyable" refers to the comfortable seats and dining cars.

questions.text: When people travel on business, they usually take <blank>.
questions.explanation: The last sentence mentions that people usually take a train or a plane when traveling on business.

questions.text: How many ways of traveling are mentioned in the passage?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions traveling by plane, train, sea, and car.

question_sets.context: There are 45 students in our class. I have made a survey, 36 students say they like to exercise. Most boys play basketball together twice a week. But girls think basketball is difficult for them, they'd like to play volleyball together twice a week. My friend, Tonny, is good at running. He runs fastest (最快) in our class. He runs for 30 minutes on the playground every evening before he goes to bed. Is it interesting? Gray is good at swimming. He goes to the swimming club three times a month in winter and three times a week in summer. So he's pretty healthy. Some of my classmates have good eating habits. They eat both meat and vegetables. 70% of them drink milk every day. 15 students say they drink milk three or four times a week. But some students like to eat junk food, especially Sally. What's worse (更糟糕的) is that she doesn't like to exercise, so she is very fat. She always says " I'm going to lose weight tomorrow."

questions.text: How often do most boys play basketball?
questions.explanation: The answer is C, according to the passage: "Most boys play basketball together twice a week."

questions.text: Why do the girl dislike to play basketball?

choices.B: Because they think it's not easy.
choices.C: Because they don't like to play with the boys.
choices.D: Because they don't like to exercise

questions.explanation: The answer is B, according to the passage: "But girls think basketball is difficult for them".

questions.text: When does Tonny often run for 30 minutes?

choices.C: every evening before he goes to bed

questions.explanation: The answer is C, according to the passage: "He runs for 30 minutes on the playground every evening before he goes to bed."

questions.text: How often does Gray swim in winter?

choices.D: it's not mentioned(提到)in the passage

questions.explanation: The answer is A, according to the passage: "He goes to the swimming club three times a month in winter".

questions.text: Why is Sally so fat?

choices.A: Because she doesn't like to exercise.
choices.B: Because she likes to eat junk food every much.
choices.C: Because she eats too much meat, but doesn't exercise.

questions.explanation: The answer is D, according to the passage: "But some students like to eat junk food, especially Sally. What's worse (更糟糕的) is that she doesn't like to exercise, so she is very fat."

question_sets.context:
A hungry fox is looking for something to eat. He sees a frog (青蛙) playing near the river, He goes up to the frog and is going to eat it.
Just at that time a tortoise (乌龟) comes up and sees all this. He goes up quickly and bits(咬) the fox's tail (尾巴).The fox can't move and the frog jumps into the river. "I' m going to throw you into the sky." says the fox angrily to the tortoise." Thank you. I'm always hoping to go into the sky," says the tortoise. "I'm going to throw you into the fire" says the fox again to the tortoise." Thank you very much. I'm very cold and want to keep warm," the tortoise says. "Don't throw me into the river .I'm afraid of water very much," says the tortoise in tears. When he hears this, the fox gets up and throws the tortoise into the river. Now the tortoise is swimming in the river happily and laughing at the fox.

questions.text: The fox wants <blank>.
questions.explanation: The answer is C. The passage says that the fox is hungry and sees a frog and is going to eat it.

questions.text: Does the tortoise really want to fly?
questions.explanation: The answer is B. The tortoise is being sarcastic and doesn't want to fly.

questions.text: The fox's tail is bitten by (被------咬) <blank>.
questions.explanation: The answer is D. The tortoise bit the fox's tail.

questions.text: The tortoise is <blank> to be in water again.
questions.explanation: The answer is A. The passage indicates that the tortoise is happily swimming in the water.

questions.text: There are <blank> animals in this story.
questions.explanation: The answer is C. The animals in the story are the fox, the frog, and the tortoise.

question_sets.context:
In China, many people like watching TV. Watching TV is one of the must important activities of the day. TV brings the outside closer(close adv.接近地) to people's homes. Some people say the world is smaller than before ― because of TV.
What's going on (发生) in the other countries? How do people love in places far away? Is there a good sports game somewhere? What's life in the deepest part of the sea?
If you want to answer these and other kinds of questions. just turn on the TV. Turn it on and watch. You can see a lot and learn a lot. Of course, people can also learn through reading of listening to the radio. But with TV they can learn better and much easily. Why? Because they can hear and watch, too.
TV helps to open our eyes. TV also helps to open our minds. TV often gives us new ideas. We learn newer and better ways of doing something.

questions.text: Some people say the world is smaller than before because <blank>.

choices.A: TV makes the earth smaller and smaller
choices.B: all people like to watch TV
choices.C: watching TV is one of the most important activities of the day
choices.D: TV brings the outside world closer to people

questions.explanation: The answer is D. The first paragraph states that "TV brings the outside closer to people's homes. Some people say the world is smaller than before because of TV."

questions.text: We can <blank> when we watch TV.

choices.A: go to live in the other countries

questions.explanation: The answer is C. The third paragraph says that you can see a lot and learn a lot when you watch TV, which means you can get a lot of information.

questions.text: People learn better through TV than radio because <blank>.

choices.A: TV sets are bigger than radios
choices.B: people can not only hear but also watch
choices.C: without TV people can't open their eyes
choices.D: it's easier to turn on TV than to turn on the radio

questions.explanation: The answer is B. The third paragraph says that "with TV they can learn better and much easily. Why? Because they can hear and watch, too."

questions.text: The sentence "TV also helps to open our minds' means <blank>.

choices.A: our minds can not only be opened by TV
choices.B: something is wrong with our minds
choices.C: we can learn more with TV than without TV

questions.explanation: The answer is C. The sentence "TV also helps to open our minds' means we can learn more with TV than without TV.

questions.text: This article has told us <blank>.

choices.B: not to watch TV any more
choices.C: students shouldn't watch TV at any time
choices.D: to stop reading to watch TV

questions.explanation: The answer is A. The article mainly discusses the benefits of watching TV, thus implying that it is good to watch TV.

question_sets.context:
One day, a dentist was starting his morning work. Suddenly(突然)a man ran in. His face was red and he could only say "Quick! Quick!" The dentist thought he must be very ill. His assistant(助手) helped to make the poor man sit in a chair. The dentist gave the man some medicine to make him sleep. Then, he looked into the man's mouth and pulled out all the bad teeth. As soon as the man woke up, he said in a low voice(声音),"Quick, doctor, quick."
"It's all right now." said the dentist.
"I came to tell you your house is on fire." said the man.

questions.text: The story took place(发生) <blank>.
questions.explanation: The story took place in the morning.

questions.text: When the man ran in, the dentist thought he must be <blank>.
questions.explanation: When the man ran in, the dentist thought he must be ill.

questions.text: The man <blank> after he took some medicine.
questions.explanation: The man went to sleep after he took some medicine.

questions.text: The dentist pulled <blank> out of the man's mouth.
questions.explanation: The dentist pulled all the bad teeth out of the man's mouth.

questions.text: The man ran in <blank>.

choices.C: to tell the dentist that he was all right
choices.D: to tell the dentist that his house was on fire

questions.explanation: The man ran in to tell the dentist that his house was on fire.

question_sets.context:
Almost(几乎) everyone likes dogs, and almost everyone likes to read stories about dogs. I have a friend. He has a large(大的) police(警察) dog named Jack. Police dogs are very clever. Every Sunday afternoon my friend takes Jack for a long walk in the park. Jack likes these long walks very much.
One Sunday afternoon a young man came to visit my friend. He stayed a long time. He talked and talked. Soon it was time for friend to take Jack for his walk. But the visitor still stayed. Jack became very worried. He walked around the room several times(几次) and then sat down in front of the visitor and looked at him. But the visitor paid no attention(没注意) to Jack. He went on talking. At last Jack got angry. He went out of the room and came back a few minutes later. He sat down again in front of the visitor, but this time he took the visitor's hat in his mouth. The visitor was surprised to see it. He laughed and left.

questions.text: Jack is a <blank> name.
questions.explanation: Jack is the name of a dog in the passage.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Pronoun Reference

questions.text: Jack became worried because <blank>.

choices.A: he wanted to go out for a walk
choices.B: he wanted to play with him.
choices.C: he didn't know the young man.
choices.D: he wanted the visitor to leave.

questions.explanation: It was time for Jack's walk.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Cause & Effect

questions.text: Where do they go for a long walk?
questions.explanation: Every Sunday afternoon my friend takes Jack for a long walk in the park.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: When do they go for a walk?
questions.explanation: Every Sunday afternoon my friend takes Jack for a long walk in the park.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details; Time Expressions

questions.text: Jack went out of the room, but this time he came back with the visitor's <blank> in his mouth.
questions.explanation: He took the visitor's hat in his mouth.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
A Key Deer
A Key deer is a small deer. It is about the size of a large dog. Sometimes it is called a "toy deer". This deer lives in only one place in the world. That place is Florida. Not long ago, there were only 50 Key deer left. Would all the Key deer soon be gone? Some people worked very hard to save the animals. Their hard work helped. Now there are more than 700 Key deer.

questions.text: A Key deer is the size of a large <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, a Key deer is about the size of a large dog.

questions.text: This story does not tell about <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions where Key deer live and their size, but not what they eat.

questions.text: In the third part of the story, what does the word "left" mean?
questions.explanation: In the context of the passage, 'left' means 'still around' or remaining.

questions.text: There are more than 700 Key deer now because people <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that people worked hard to save the Key deer, which led to an increase in their population.

question_sets.context: It is a Saturday morning in May. When Mrs Green opens her windows and looks out, she says"It's going to be a beautiful day. " She says to her son,"Get up, Tom. We are going to the zoo today. Wash your hands and face. We are going to New York by train,"Tom is six years old. He is very happy now, because he likes going to the zoo very much. He also likes going by train. He says"I dreamed(做梦) about the zoo last night, Mum. ""And what did you do in the zoo in your dream? "Tom laughs and answers,"You know, Mum! You were there in my dream too. "

questions.text: It is a Saturday morning <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "It is a Saturday morning in May."

questions.text: They are going to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "We are going to the zoo today."

questions.text: They are going to New York <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "We are going to New York by train."

questions.text: Tom is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "Tom is six years old."

questions.text: Tom is very happy <blank> he likes going to the zoo very much.
questions.explanation: "because" is used to indicate the reason for Tom's happiness.

question_sets.context: Elena's baby brother is crying. Elena thinks he must be hungry. She gives him some food. He will not eat. She gives him something to drink. He will not drink. She takes him for a walk. Still he crys and crys. Then Elena starts to sing a song. The baby stops crying. She makes  funny faces. He laughs. She rocks him. He goes to sleep. Taking care of the baby is a lot of work.

questions.text: The best title(标题) is <blank>.
questions.explanation: "Taking Care of Baby" is the most appropriate title for the passage.

questions.text: The story says that Elena gives the baby <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "She gives him some food."

questions.text: The baby goes to sleep when Elena <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "She rocks him. He goes to sleep."

questions.text: You can tell(判断) that the baby <blank>.
questions.explanation: Since the baby doesn't eat the food, we can infer that he isn't hungry.

questions.text: The word"rocks"in Line 5(第5行) means <blank>.
questions.explanation: In this context, "rocks" means to gently move back and forth.
